Species.Author: Linnaeus

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Supplement to the general synopsis of birds
Subspecies.Taxonomy: IOC and eBird/Clements accept _johanseni_ Delacour 1951 and that subspecies could be more likely in the region. Distinction clinal and hence impossible to be sure if those birds are involved in any of the Indian records. Here, we treat _johanseni_ as a synonym of the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Harike (Punjab), Manipur, and Bhigwan (Maharashtra).
Subspecies.Notes: Some records possibly from this population (Praveen et al 2014, Bhoi _et al._ 2022).

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Izvestiya Imperatorskago Obshchestva Lyubitelei Estestvoznaniya, Antropologii i Etnografii
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Anser grandis_ Middendorff, 1853. Ruokonen _et al._ (2008) found this subspecies to be genetically distinct from other Bean Geese.
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Dibru-Saikhowa (Assam).
Subspecies.Notes: See Robson (2007), Praveen _et al._ (2014) for the details of the sight record.

Species.Author: Gould
Species.Taxonomy: Not always recognised as a species. Sometimes both subspecies under this species are lumped under _A. fabalis_.

Subspecies.Author: Buturlin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Opredelitel Promyslovykh Ptits
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Tumariya (Uttarakhand).
Subspecies.Notes: It is not possible to safely eliminate this taxon based on photos but the bird in Bhattacharjee (2013) has been claimed to be this taxon.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Gharana (Jammu), Sariska (Rajasthan), Gajoldoba (Bengal), Maguri, Kaziranga, and Pabitora (last three in Assam)
Subspecies.Notes: Most photographic records of 'Tundra' type birds wintering in India (Sangha 2015, Das 2016, Biswas 2017) are believed to be this taxon. They breed east of Taimyr peninsula in the Tundra region (Reeber 2018).

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus

Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Historical reports from Uttar Pradesh, Mumbai (Maharashtra) and Lohit river (Assam/Arunachal).
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies variation slight and historical reports based on specimens (AR2001). Five specimens in AMNH from Assam is labelled as this subspecies and the collection also has a few _orientalis_ from India. No other specimens located. Taxon included here mainly on the strength of the statement in AR2001.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _comatus_ Salvadori, 1895. The specimen NHMUK:Old Vellum Cat.42.84a not considered a type here following Salvadori (1895).
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Ladakh and Himachal. Non-breeding: Along the Himalayan lakes, adjoining terai, and Assam plains; sparsely in Chambal valley and Chota Nagpur region.
Subspecies.Notes: See Sangha (2019).

Species.Author: Linnaeus

Subspecies.Author: Hardwicke
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Specimens: AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Beebe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zoologica: scientific contributions of the New York Zoological Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised and often lumped with the nominate subspecies (RA2012). Type specimen is #387 in Kuser-Beebe collection; the whereabouts of the same is now unknown.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim and N Bengal.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Sela or Tela Range, above Tawang eastern Bhutan-Tibet boundary, Arunachal)
Subspecies.Distribution: NW Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Might occur along the national boundary and lack of distribution further east may be due to lack of adequate surveys.

Subspecies.Author: Beebe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zoologica: scientific contributions of the New York Zoological Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Though Abdulali (1969) JBNHS: 66:269 considers the BHHS Mishmi specimen to be the N Myanmarese subspecies _marionae_ Mayr 1941, we follow RA2012 in treating the Mishmi hills population as _kuseri_. ZSI Mishmi specimen, that was examined, also matches with _kuseri_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Mishmi hills in Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Might occur in Walong region and Dapha bum in E Arunachal as well.

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Le règne animal distribué d'aprés son organisation, pour servir de base a l'histoire naturelle des animaux et d'introduction à l'anatomie comparée. Nouvelle édition, revue et augmentée

Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rupchandi_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: Mishmi hills, Namdapha, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Mishmi population remains unsampled but is believed to be the nominate subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Validity of the subspecies needs investigation.
Subspecies.Distribution: Dafla hills (W Arunachal).
Subspecies.Notes: Media available but probably no specimens from W Arunachal.

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Species.Distribution: Restricted to Arunachal from the Dafla hills in the west till Mishmi hills in the east.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, YPM

Genus.Name: Lophophorus
Genus.Author: Temminck
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle générale des pigeons et des gallinacés, accompagné de planches anatomiques

Species.Author: Latham

Species.Taxonomy: Includes _chambanus_ Marshall 1884 from Chamba, Himachal.
Species.Distribution: Himalaya from Kashmir in the west till W Arunachal in the east and disjunctly in Mishmi hills and Walong region.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Kumar R & Singh
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Arunachal from Sela till Pakdhung (Kurung Kumey).

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: E Arunachal – from Mishmi hills till Dapha bum.

Genus.Name: Pucrasia
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A list of the genera of birds, with their synonyma and with an indication of the typical species of each genus. 2nd. ed.
Genus.Taxonomy: New name for _Eulophus_ Lesson 1836 (not of E. L. Geoffroy 1762).

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Gilgit (?).
Subspecies.Notes: Included based on a specimen (#13728) labelled 'Kashmir' in the BNHS (See Abdulali 1969). Occurs in Chitral (Pakistan) and hence possibly also in Gilgit.

Subspecies.Author: Marshall
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _bethelae_ Fleming 1947 from Manali, Himachal.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Kashmir, and W Himachal.

Subspecies.Author: Lesson

Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: Possibly restricted to Nepal and does not occur in India but there is a claimed sight record in E Nepal and hence may occur in adjacent territories – require investigation.

Subspecies.Author: Madarász
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Walong region in E Arunachal.

Subspecies.Notes: See Ludlow & Kinnear (1937) who reported it from Mago district in Goshu Chu valley in W Arunachal. No specimens have been located from Sikkim or Arunachal.

Genus.Name: Syrmaticus

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis

Species.Author: Hardwicke

Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, LKO

Genus.Name: Lophura

Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir through Himachal till Kumaon hills in E Uttarakhand.

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kumaon hills (Uttarakhand) and N Bihar (Valmiki Tiger Reserve).
Subspecies.Notes: Old specimen from Mussoorie believed to be an escapee but investigation required as to the recent occurrence of both _hamiltoni_ and the nominate subspecies in certain parts of Kumaon hills. See Choudhury (2016) for its presence in Bihar.

Subspecies.Author: Hutton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _moffitti_ Hachisuka 1938 from an unknown type locality is now widely considered a hybrid of captive origin (RA2012:133). Delacour (2008) considered it to be a valid form intermediate between _lathami_ and _melanota_ and hypothesised its range to be C Bhutan or Khasi hills. AR2001 mentions a wild specimen from Bhutan.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim and N Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: Possibly occurs in W Assam.

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Animal Kingdom. Arranged in conformity with its organization, by the Baron Cuvier, with additional descriptions of all the species hitherto named, and of many not before noticed
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Tripura, N Mizoram, and adjoining Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Photographs from N Mizoram exists.

Subspecies.Author: Oates
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A manual of the game birds of India
Subspecies.Distribution: S Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Sight reports from S Mizoram may be of this subspecies. Though YPM #042204 from Cachar and ZSI #29583 are listed as this subspecies, they need to be examined to verify if they have intermediate characteristics.

Genus.Name: Pavo
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: All across the country except the high and trans Himalaya, driest portions of Thar desert and the hilly regions of NE India. Introduced in Ross Is. in South Andaman.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Shaw
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The naturalist's miscellany
Subspecies.Distribution: Historically, from E Manipur hills and possibly E Mizoram hills.
Subspecies.Notes: No Indian specimens available, but records (e.g., old hunting records in Higgins 1928) are from the range of this taxon.

Genus.Name: Galloperdix
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Birds. 1st ed.
Subspecies.Distribution: Rajasthan, adjoining E Madhya Pradesh, and NE Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: Intergradation zone believed to be Hathidhara in W Gujarat (AR2001).

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttar Pradesh south through peninsular India, east till W Bengal, west till Dangs, S along the Deccan, and E slopes of W Ghats including Wayanad.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats and coastal Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Intergradation zone not well-defined but presumed to be the Wayanad plateau (Kerala).

Species.Author: Valenciennes
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Species.Distribution: Most of peninsular India from about Ganga, west till about the driest parts of Thar desert, most of C India, east up till the Jharkhand-Bengal border in W Bengal, south all the way till the tip of the peninsula along the eastern slopes of SW Ghats. Absent in entire W India including Gujarat, W and C Maharashtra, W Karnataka, W coast as well as western slopes of the W Ghats and coastal plains of Tamil Nadu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Polyplectron
Genus.Author: Temminck
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue systématique du cabinet d'ornithologie et de la collection de quadrumanes de Crd. Jb. Temminck

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Subspecies _bakeri_ (Lowe 1925) of Sikkim till W Arunachal that supposedly have mostly green (vs purple) ocelli, not recognised here as these are potentially individual variations. Monotypic as proposed by Penhallurick & Walters (2005).
Species.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal foothills, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rincheni_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizo hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Namdapha), Nagaland, Meghalaya (Garo and Khasi hills), Cachar hills, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Genus.Name: Gallus

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Robinson & Kloss
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Records of the Indian Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _gallina_ Koelz 1954 from Kotla, Kangra, Himachal.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir eastwards along the outer Himalaya till E Arunachal, south till about Godavari river, west till E Maharashtra, and E Madhya Pradesh (till Pachmarhi).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Bonnaterre
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Tableau encyclopédique et méthodique des trois règnes de la nature. Ornithologie. 2nd ed.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Genus of the protonym is considered _Perdix_ in Ri1961. However, the original reference (Bonnaterre 1792) refers to it as a _Coturnix_.
Subspecies.Distribution: From Mishmi hills (NE Arunachal) and further east.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies identity of birds in NE hill states is unclear.

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle générale des pigeons et des gallinacés, accompagné de planches anatomiques
Species.Taxonomy: Considered monotypic though slightly paler (probably clinal) population in the north was recognised as _wangyeli_ Koelz, 1954. Timbre of calls reported as different (AR2001), but existing recordings from Rajasthan do not show any difference. Also, include _indicus_ Leach 1815 (Type locality: India, restricted to Madras [=Chennai]).
Species.Distribution: W Ghats including Dangs, E Ghats north at least till Maredumilli (but mostly south of Godavari river), certain hilly pockets in the Deccan, C Indian hills extending till the Mt. Abu region in the northwest and Satpuras, Pench, and Nawegoan on the southeast. Historically, entire SW coastal plains.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Ortygornis
Genus.Author: Reichenbach
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Avium systema naturale. Das natürliche system der vögel mit hundert tafeln grösstentheils original-abbildungen der bis jetzt entdecken fast zwölfhundert typischen formen. Vorlaüfer einer iconographie der arten der vögel aller welttheile

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _prepositus_ Koelz 1954 from Kotla, Kangra, Himachal, _paganus_ Koelz 1954 from Sihor, Saurashtra, and _tita_ Koelz 1954 from Ramanujganj, Surguja.
Subspecies.Distribution: Across northern India, except the high and trans Himalaya and NE India; south till about Maharashtra, Telangana, and Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Distribution roughly north of a line connecting Pune and Kakinada (AR2001).

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Distribution: S Peninsula from about Maharashtra, Telangana, Andhra and down south till S Tamil Nadu. Absent in most of western coastal plains except in certain patches like around Palakkad gap.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle générale des pigeons et des gallinacés, accompagné de planches anatomiques
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _ridibundus_ Koelz 1954 from Kalnahi, Uttar Pradesh.
Species.Distribution: Terai region and plains from W Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, N Bengal, Assam and adjoining E Arunachal. Historically in Meghalaya, Manipur, and Tripura.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Notes: See (Kaestner 2022) for its occurrence in NC Manipur.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte

Subspecies.Distribution: NW India with specimens from Ambala and Sirsa (both Haryana), Kachchh, Rudramala, and Bhavnagar (all Gujarat).
Subspecies.Notes: Specimens in the museums have not been specifically examined for this subspecies; but listing here based on their current tags and locations.They are from Kachchh (AMNH #14868, FMNH #411696, #41465-68, BNHS#13731, BNHS#13742, BNHS#20166, BNHS#20283), Bhavnagar (BNHS#13744), Rudramala (BNHS#19683), Sirsa (BNHS#19274), and Ambala (BNHS#13715). RA2012 & AR2001 do not specifically list India, or Indian states in its range.

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _parkerae_ Van Tyle & Koelz 1936 from Arsu (Kullu, Himachal).
Subspecies.Distribution: Foothills of W Himalaya from Kashmir till Uttarakhand, N India, south till Deesa (Gujarat), Gwalior (Madhya Pradesh), Jharkhand, S W Bengal, Sambalpur and Chilika Lake (both Odisha).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Notes: Boundary between subspecies arbitrarily fixed at 20°N.

Subspecies.Author: Jardine & Selby
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of ornithology
Subspecies.Distribution: Southern peninsula from Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh to Telangana, N and C Karnataka, and S Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Historical distribution included S Karnataka and probably C Tamil Nadu as well but no recent records there.

Genus.Name: Tetraogallus
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Genus.Taxonomy: Type taxon is not _Lophophorus nigelli_ Jardine & Selby

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Aves expeditionis P.K. Kozlowi per Mongoliam et Tibetiam orientalem 1899-1901
Subspecies.Distribution: Mishmi hills (NE Arunachal).
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies _centralis_, not always recognised, is putative in NE Arunachal (RA2012). AR2001 includes Mishmi hills in its range without a reference.

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen & Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: N Sikkim and NW Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Gray

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Distribution: Plains of E India – mostly S W Bengal, Assam, adjoining E Arunachal, Meghalaya. and Manipur. Sporadic records from the country including a recent one from SW Karnataka. Historically reported as more widespread but absence of specimens make assessment difficult.

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is., Kamorta Is. and Trinkat Is. (last two in C Nicobar group).

Genus.Name: Coturnix
Genus.Author: Bonnaterre

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes extralimital subspecies are not recognised and hence considered monotypic.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus

Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Mostly N and NW India including Punjab, Haryana, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra. Also, W Bengal and Assam in E India. Sporadically in C India and further south.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Intergrades with Japanese Quail reported from Manipur (AR2001). Status compounded by Rain Quail. Purportedly a breeding visitor or resident in N Punjab and Jammu & Kashmir (see RA 2012).

Species.Author: Temminck & Schlegel

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: From the Himalayan foothills, south through W and C India through Deccan till the tip of the peninsula. Absent in most of SW coast, E India, high Himalaya, and Thar desert except for a few scattered records.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Alectoris

Subspecies.Author: Latham

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: Restricted to Chitradurga region of C Karnataka.

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats and associated hills (e.g., Servarayan hills) from Mumbai till the southern tip.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, ROM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: C India from Satpuras (Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh), Chhattisgarh, east till the border of Odisha, as well as NE Andhra (Lambasingi).
Subspecies.Notes: No recent authentic records. Occurrence in Bihar, Odisha, and SW Bengal require corroboration.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Bases of the hills in the SE portion of the Manipur plains.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Historically restricted to the Manipur valley.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Khasi, Naga, and Cachar hills not authenticated. No authentic record since 1929.

Subspecies.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: Historically from the grassy plains of NE Bengal and Assam north of Brahmaputra till about Goalpara (C Assam).
Subspecies.Notes: Reports further east of Goalpara not authenticated. No authentic record since 1907.

Genus.Name: Ophrysia
Genus.Author: Bonaparte
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Gleanings from the menagerie and aviary at Knowsley Hall
Species.Distribution: Historically, restricted to certain pockets in Nainital and Dehradun districts.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, NML, RMNH, AMNH

Genus.Name: Phoenicopterus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Greater Rann of Kachchh and Bhavnagar (both Gujarat). Non-breeding: Most of the western half of the country from Rajasthan-Gujarat till Tamil Nadu. Straggling to the W coast, nearly absent east of Bihar and Odisha. Subject to widespread nomadism.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, LKO

Genus.Name: Phoeniconaias
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis

Species.Author: Geoffroy Saint-Hilaire
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin des Sciences par la Société Philomathique de Paris
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Rann of Kachchh. Non-breeding: Mainly Gujarat, NW Maharashtra and around Sambhar Lake (Rajasthan). Stragglers elsewhere including Haryana/Delhi, remaining Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Odisha, remaining of Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, MCZ, ROM

Genus.Name: Tachybaptus
Genus.Author: Reichenbach
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Avium systema naturale. Das natürliche system der vögel mit hundert tafeln grösstentheils original-abbildungen der bis jetzt entdecken fast zwölfhundert typischen formen. Vorlaüfer einer iconographie der arten der vögel aller welttheile

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Adumbratiunculæ. Avium variarum praecedenti elencho insertarum, sed quæ in Systemate Naturæ Illustr. Linnæi nondum extant

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: IOC and eBird/Clements restricts _capensis sensu stricto_ Salvadori 1884 to Africa and regional birds are under this taxon. See Mlíkovský (2010) for a review.
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire country from Kashmir in the north till southern tip; both W and E India including all NE hill states. Reported from S Andaman Is. as well.

Subspecies.Author: Reichenow
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Ladakh.
Subspecies.Notes: Possibly some of the Ladakh birds may belong to this subspecies. Specimens in ZSI labelled as _poggei_ (ZSI 31299-300) are from Salt Lake, 24 Parganas, W Bengal and has not been examined.

Genus.Name: Podiceps
Genus.Author: Latham
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Supplement to the general synopsis of birds
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Harike (Punjab), Ramnagar (Uttarakhand), and Dighal (Haryana).
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens exist. All wintering birds presumed to be from the Asian nominate subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Boddaert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Leh (Ladakh), Pong (Himachal), Asan Barrage (Uttarakhand), Bharatpur (Rajasthan), Pariej, Nyari (both Gujarat), and Bhigwan (Maharashtra).
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens exist. Photo cannot be assessed for subspecies as they differ only in size. On range (Praveen _et al._ 2014), it is conceivable that all records were of the nominate subspecies as that appears to be the closest population. If and when the species is found in E India, possibility of a straggling _P. g. holbollii_ opens up.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Sporadically in Ladakh, Kashmir, W Gangetic Plains, S. Rajasthan, Gujarat, and Andhra Pradesh. Non-breeding: Entire N India from Gilgit, Ladakh and Kashmir till Gujarat in the west, extending east through Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains with its presence even in Arunachal, Meghalaya and Tripura; Odisha, Chhattisgarh, E Madhya Pradesh, and adjoining Maharashtra, NE Andhra and sparingly further south, exceptionally till Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu).

Subspecies.Author: Brehm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Handbuch der Naturgeschichte aller Vögel Deutschlands
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Gilgit, N Kashmir, and Ladakh. Winter: Spreading additionally to N India from Rajasthan, Gujarat and NW Maharashtra in the west till Sikkim, W Bengal, Assam, and Nagaland in the east. Straggler to Kelambakkam (Tamil Nadu).
Subspecies.Notes: Nests reported annually from Startsapuk Tso, E Ladakh. Whether any of those have resulted in successfully breeding is not known.

Genus.Name: Columba
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Lahore to Yārkand (etc.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab, and Himachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Strickland
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire country including Lakshadweep Is and Andaman & Nicobar Is. except for the range of other subspecies.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Mixing with feral pigeons has rendered identification of true wild Rock Pigeons impossible.However, true wild Rock Pigeons have been claimed from several parts of the country but no assessment carried out.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Buturlin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _C r. pallida_ Rothshild & Hartert 1893.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit through Ladakh, northern districts of Himachal and Uttarakhand as well as N Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit through Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, and also Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with the nominate subspecies in Sikkim.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the international border in extreme E Sikkim, Sela region and beyond in W Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: May occur further east in N Arunachal along the international border.

Species.Author: Bonaparte
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences
Species.Distribution: Non-breeding: Harike (Punjab), Thar, and W Rajasthan with stragglers to Little Rann of Kachchh (Gujarat). Historically much more widespread with range from Jammu & Kashmir reaching northern Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar.
Species.Specimens: UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir till Uttarakhand in the east. Straggler to Ladakh and reportedly N Bengal.

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalayan forests from Gilgit till Walong region in E Arunachal, also extending southeast to Nagaland, Manipur, Khasi hills (Meghalaya), and Murlen (Mizoram).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalayan forests from Uttarakhand, Sikkim, and N Bengal till Namdapha (E Arunachal), Cachar Hills, Nagaland, Manipur, and south till Phawngpui (Mizoram).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Sykes
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.TypeLocality: (Ghats of the Deccan [=Ghauts of the Dukhun])
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from N Maharashtra till southern tip of the ghats extending east to the hills of Biligirirangans, Shevarayan, Melagiri and disjunctly in hillocks of the Deccan in S Karnataka (Nandi hills, Thimmalapura).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Restricted to certain pockets in NE Assam and adjoining E Arunachal, Tripura, Odisha, and NE Andhra. Stragglers to C Assam, N and S W Bengal. Historically, possibly more widespread, in Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Cachar hills, Nagaland, and Manipur.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Taxonomy: Include _nicobarica_ from Walden 1874 from Trinket and Nancowry Is (C Nicobars); however AR2001 footnotes indicate that there might a reason to resurrect this subspecies.
Species.Distribution: Andaman & Nicobar Is. except smaller islands (e.g., Car Nicobar) and islets.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, ROM

Genus.Name: Streptopelia
Genus.Author: Bonaparte
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Recorded only from Gilgit and Shey (Ladakh).

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Gilgit and Ladakh, through Jammu & Kashmir till Uttarakhand. Non-breeding: Spreading to much of the peninsula in winter.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Movements not fully documented; more reports in Peninsula during passage migration.

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Features overlap with _agricola_ and it is usually difficult to assign a subspecies identity for specimens.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N Sikkim and Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences
Subspecies.Distribution: C India, up till Jharkhand and Odisha, also NE Ghats as well as S Karnataka. Range compounded by other subspecies and movements undocumented but possibly might account for some birds in southern peninsula.

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _meridionalis_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizoram and _khasiana_ Koelz 1954 from Mawryngkneng, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal, entire NE India and probably also S W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Frivaldszky
Species.OriginalPublicationName: A' Magyar Tudós Társaság Évkönyvei
Species.Taxonomy: Monotypic in the region. Paler/larger _stoliczkae_ of NW and darker/smaller _intercedens_ of the peninsula not given subspecies status as variation is largely clinal.
Species.Distribution: Throughout India except the W coast and dense forests of NE India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, USNM, TNHM

Species.Author: Hermann
Species.Taxonomy: Variaton clinal, not possible to assign every individual to a subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Hermann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Observationes zoologicae quibus novae complures, aliaeque animalium species describuntur et illustrantur
Subspecies.Distribution: Most of the country from Kashmir south till the tip of the peninsula, east till about W Bengal. Localised populations or stragglers in the SW coast and Odisha.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _humilior_ Hume 1874 from Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, W Bengal, NE India, and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Genus.Name: Spilopelia
Genus.Author: Sundevall
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Methodi naturalis avium disponendarum tentamen. Försök till fogelklassens naturenliga uppställning

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.AlternativeNames: Western Spotted Dove _S [c.] suratensis_ & _ceylonensis_, Eastern Spotted Dove _S [c.] tigrina_
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades extensively with _tigrina_ in Assam, subspecies boundaries uncertain. Quite likely also intergrades with the Sri Lankan endemic subspecies _ceylonensis_ Reichenbach 1851 along the broken land bridge of Dhanushkodi across the Palk strait. Differences only in morphometrics.
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire country excluding the driest parts of Thar and Kachchh, east till about Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Les Pigeons
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _edwardi_ Ripley 1948 from Chabua, Assam.
Subspecies.Distribution: Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram as well as E Arunachal.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Distribution: Most of the country except the high Himalaya, dry zones of Thar desert, SW coast, and NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus Hebdomadaires des Séances de l'Académie des Sciences
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit.
Subspecies.Notes: Probably the birds seen in extreme north of Kashmir might be this taxon.

Genus.Name: Macropygia
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: On the natural history and classification of birds
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , The birds of Australia

Species.Author: Wagler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Avium

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram. Historically, Himachal and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: Andaman Is. including Little Andaman Is. and a few other islets like Interview, Long, Havelock, and Neil Is.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Central (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompuka, Nancowry, and Kamorta) and South Nicobar Is. groups.

Genus.Name: Oena
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: On the natural history and classification of birds

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies assumed on range.

Genus.Name: Chalcophaps
Genus.Author: Gould
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Australia

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Common Emerald Dove, Grey-capped Emerald Dove; [Emerald Dove]

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _salimalii_ Mukherjee 1960 from Jenmalai (sic) = Tenmala, Kerala.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills from about Jammu, eastwards till E Arunachal, all NE hill states, S W Bengal, E Ghats, C Indian hills, and W Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Not reported from C India between Dangs/Nashik and Pench. Sri Lankan endemic subspecies _robinsoni_ Baker 1928 can occur in SE coast as a vagrant.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The type specimen is probably in ZMB.
Subspecies.Distribution: Andaman Is. including Little Andaman Is. Barren Is., and Narcondam Is. as well as the islets like Outram, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is., Central Nicobar Is. group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompuka, Nancowry, Trinket, Kamorta, and Katchall Is.), and S Nicobar group (Meroe Is. and Great Nicobar Is.).

Genus.Name: Caloenas
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: All Nicobar Is. group – Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompuka, Nancowry, Kamorta, and Katchal Is.), S Nicobar group (Meroe Is. and Great Nicobar Is.), Little Andaman Is., straggling to S and N Andaman but present in smaller islets (Outram, Havelock, Rutland, and S Sential Is.) including Narcondam Is and Barren Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM

Genus.Name: Treron
Genus.Author: Vieillot
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills from Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Tripura, S W Bengal, Odisha, C India, E Ghats, and along with W Ghats. Sporadic in Gangetic plains, SE and W coast as well as Deccan hillocks.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Whether the birds seen in SE coast, particularly around Point Calimere, are migrants from Sri Lanka is not known. If yes, then that would add the Sri Lanka endemic subspecies _leggei_ Hartert 1910 into the India's list. Subspecies identification completely based on morphometrics and hence specimens needed for establishing the taxon identity.

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Taxonomy: Tirumala (CE Ghats) birds show intermediate characteristics between _T. affinis_ and _T. pompadora_ (Sri Lankan endemic) and may relate to an undescribed taxon. In addition, Sri Lanka Green Pigeon could be crossing over to SE Tamil Nadu and may be expected around Point Calimere or Rameswaram Is.
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from N Maharashtra till the tip of the peninsula. East to Biligirirangans and Sirumalai, nomadic to Mysuru, Bengaluru, Chennai, and Puducherry. Disjunct population in Tirumala hills (Andhra).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: India Sporting Review
Species.Taxonomy: Subspecies _andamanicus_ Richmond 1902 not recognised here. As per ZSI registers, ZSI#26487 is designated as Leucotype by Roonwal and the remaining in the series as Syntypes. Verification required.
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman Is as well as the islets of N Reef, Interview, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Red Skin, Boat, and Rutland Is. Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompuka, Trinket, Nancowry, Kamorta, and Katchall Is.), and S Nicobar group (Little and Great Nicobar Is.) of islands.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, FMNH

Subspecies.Author: Rand & Fleming
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Fieldiana Zoology
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies not always recognised.
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Uttarakhand (recent) and Uttar Pradesh (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: Sondhi _et al._ (2016) photographic record from Uttarakhand and the single specimen (#4190) in the Lucknow museum from Kheri district, Uttar Pradesh (Reid 1888); both undoubtedly from the Nepal population.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and further east in all of NE hill states; sporadic in S W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes subspecies _nipalensis_ Hodgson 1836; sometimes the name given to the regional population.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, and all of NE hill states; also present in S W Bengal, Odisha, adjoining NE Ghats in Andhra and Telangana.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Region of intergradation uncertain as both subspecies co-occur in some areas – reported from Solan (Himachal), Gwalior and Pachmarhi (last two in Madhya Pradesh).
Subspecies.Distribution: Peninsular India south of Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and regions south of Gangetic plain – mostly in hilly tracts but wandering widely.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills, Indo-Gangetic plains, N Odisha, W Bengal, entire NE India except Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (SE Himalaya and hill ranges of Assam)
Subspecies.Distribution: Kumaon hills (Uttarakhand), Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan forests from Kashmir, E through Sikkim and N Bengal to all NE hill states. Nomadic and stragglers reported from Kolkata region (Bengal), Pachmarhi (Madhya Pradesh), Bilaspur (Chhattisgarh), and Sanjay Gandhi National Park (Maharashtra).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Genus.Name: Ducula
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies ranges arbitrarily kept at 20°N but subspecies may meet in N Odisha.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, east along Assam and all NE hill states. Historically in E Uttar Pradesh and Jharkhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats and associated midlands from Mumbai south till the tip of peninsula, Biligirirangans, entire E Ghats as well as adjoining C Indian hills, N Odisha, and adjoining Jharkhand.

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: All of Andaman Is. including Narcondam Is. and Little Andaman Is as well as all islets.

Species.Author: Pelzeln
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise der österreichischen Fregatte Novara um die Erde in den Jahren 1857, 1858, 1859. Zoologischer Theil
Species.Taxonomy: Not recognised as separate species by H&M4. Previous name _insularis_ Blyth 1858 from Nicobar Islands is now considered invalid (see AR2001).
Species.Distribution: Car Nicobar, C Nicobar group, and S Nicobar group of islands.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, FMNH

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Taxonomy: Formerly treated as conspecific with _D. badia_; but see Niranjana & Praveen (2021).
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from SW Maharashtra and Goa till southern tip of the Ghats in Kalakkad; sporadic in NW Ghats of Maharashtra.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, TNHM

Species.Author: Raffles
Species.AlternativeNames: Maroon-backed Imperial Pigeon _D. b. cuprea_ & _D. b. insignis_, Grey-headed Imperial Pigeon _D. b. griseicapilla_
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _carolinae_ Ripley 1953 from Phek, E Naga hills, Nagaland. Subspecies boundaries in NE hill states are not completely worked out. Birds in E Arunachal tend towards _griseicapilla_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N, Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Tripura. Probably W edges of Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram as well.
Subspecies.Specimens: UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Regional birds not typotypical but intergrades with _insignis_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Manipur, possibly Mizoram along the E edge.

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Species.Distribution: N, S and Little Andaman Is., Narcondam & Barren Is. as well as the islets of Havelock, N Cinque, and S Sential islands. Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompuka, Trinket, Nancowry, Kamorta, and Katchall Is.) as well as the S Nicobar group (Meroe, Trek, and Great Nicobar Is.).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, FMNH, MCZ, ROM

Genus.Name: Syrrhaptes
Genus.Author: Illiger
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Prodromus systematis mammalium et avium: additis terminis zoographicis utriusque classis, eorumque versione germanica

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Species.Distribution: E Ladakh, Spiti region (Himachal), and N Sikkim.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Occurred once historically in Gajner (Rajasthan).
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Genus.Name: Pterocles
Genus.Author: Temminck
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle générale des pigeons et des gallinacés, accompagné de planches anatomiques
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch Russland zur Untersuchung der drey Natur-Reiche
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Historically from Najafgarh (Delhi), Faruknagar (Haryana), Bikaner (Rajasthan), Naraina near Jaipur (Rajasthan), and Deesa (Gujarat) – possibly from Ludhiana (Punjab) and Jodhpur (Rajasthan).
Subspecies.Notes: No authentic record since 1902.

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: AR2001 treats it as a synonym of extralimital _erlangeri_ Neumann 1909.
Subspecies.Distribution: Most of the western half of the country from Jammu in the north, till the southern tip of the peninsula; avoids both E and W coast, W Ghats, and occurs only up to Bihar and Jharkhand in E India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Mantissa plantarum altera generum editionis VI et specierum editionis II
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _remotus_ Neumann 1934 from Kunaria, Kachchh, Gujarat.
Species.Distribution: Winter: Greater Rann of Kachchh (Gujarat) and around Desert National Park (Rajasthan); sporadically in Bikaner (Rajasthan) and Little Rann of Kachchh (Gujarat). Historically, in Punjab and Saurashtra (Gujarat) as well.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, FMNH

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novi Commentarii Academiae Scientiarum Imperialis Petropolitanae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _enigmaticus_ Neumann 1934 from the Rann of Kachchh. AR2001 includes _arenarius_ under the extralimital nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: E Rajasthan. Historically more widespread, with reports from Jammu, Punjab, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, and Madhya Pradesh. Claimed to have straggled as far as south as Karnataka – no verifiable records.

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: Western half of the country from Haryana and Rajasthan south till N Tamil Nadu and east till Chhattisgarh. Absent in W coast, W Ghats, most of E coast, and E India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD

Genus.Name: Ardeotis
Genus.Author: Le Maout
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle des oiseaux suivant la classification de M. Isidore Geoffroy-Saint-Hilaire avec l'indication de leurs mœurs et de leurs rapports avec les arts, le commerce et l'agriculture

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Restricted mostly to the Thar desert in W Rajasthan with small numbers in W Gujarat, Maharashtra, SC Andhra, and N Karnataka. Historically most of W and C India, east till Sambalpur (Odisha) and south till Aruppukottai (Virudhnagar, Tamil Nadu).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Chlamydotis
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Revue Zoologique, par la Société Cuvierienne

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Species.Distribution: Non-breeding: W Rajasthan and W Gujarat, Kashmir, Delhi (historical), and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Genus.Name: Houbaropsis
Genus.Author: Sharpe
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Distribution: W Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, and the flood plains of Brahmaputra in Assam and adjoining SE Arunachal. Historically more widespread in the duars of Indo-Gangetic, from Uttarakhand through Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, W Bengal through Assam and Arunachal in the Brahmaputra plains, apart from reports in N Garo foothills.

Genus.Name: Sypheotides
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Revue Zoologique, par la Société Cuvierienne
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Miller
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Icones Animalium: Various subjects of natural history, wherein are delineated birds, animals and many curious plants, with the parts of fructification of each plant, all of which are drawn and coloured from nature
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Patchily in Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, SC Andhra, and N Karnataka. Non-breeding: More widespread, not well known but some reaching even Kerala. Historically all throughout the W and C peninsular India, till Bihar and Odisha in the east and Tamil Nadu in the south.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Tetrax
Genus.Author: Forster
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A synoptical catalogue of British birds; intended to identify the species mentioned by different names in several catalogues already extant
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. No recent records. Historical records from Gilgit as well as Hujan, Hokersar, Wular, Haigam (all in Jammu & Kashmir), Gurdaspur (Punjab), and Saharanpur (Uttar Pradesh).
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Genus.Name: Centropus
Genus.Author: Illiger
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Prodromus systematis mammalium et avium: additis terminis zoographicis utriusque classis, eorumque versione germanica

Species.Author: Beavan
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: All of the major islands of Andamans including all islets.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Stephens
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: General Zoology, or systematic natural history
Subspecies.Distribution: From the Indus plains and Himalayan foothills of Kashmir, Jammu, and Punjab, W through Gangetic plains of Haryana, Uttarakhand foothills, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Bengal – all roughly north of Ganga; Sikkim foothills, and Assam roughly north of Brahmaputra as well as S Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam (South of Brahmaputra), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, Tripura, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Though species status has been suggested (RA2012), plumage details including that of juveniles, vocalisations and molecular affinities remains unstudied.
Subspecies.Distribution: From about Ambala in Haryana, south and east of the range of the nominate subspecies in the entire country, roughly south of Ganga till the southern tip of peninsula.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalayan terai from Uttarakhand through Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, W Bengal, Assam, and entire NE India. Disjunct in SW Karnataka, Kerala – from the midlands to the hills in the W Ghats, as well as adjoining Ghats in Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Taccocua
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _vantynei_ Koelz 1954 from Sasan (Junagadh, Gujarat).
Subspecies.Distribution: Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab, Himachal, Garhwal region (Uttarakhand), W Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, and Maharashtra.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _affinis_ Blyth 1846 from Rajmahal and Monghyr [=Munger] hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kumaon region (Uttarakhand), terai of Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, E Madhya Pradesh (?), Jharkhand, Odisha, W Bengal, W Assam, and adjoining Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux
Subspecies.Distribution: Range south of the nominate subspecies in Tamil Nadu, adjoining Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra, Telangana, S Maharashtra, possibly adjoining Odisha and Chhattisgarh.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, MNHN, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Phaenicophaeus
Genus.Author: Stephens
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: General Zoology, or systematic natural history
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Check-list of birds of the world

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: Southern peninsular India, mostly south of a latitude about Mumbai and Bhubaneswar till the tip of the peninsular but known to occur as north as Vadodara (Gujarat), Jalgaon (Maharashtra), and Mayurbhanj region (Odisha).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Population in Mishmi and Naga hills reportedly an intermediate with extralimital subspecies _saliens_ Mayr 1938 of SE Asia (AR2001) – but no typotypical _saliens_ specimens from the country known. Situation not examined further here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills from Uttarakhand till N Bengal and NE India apart from Sundarbans, Chota Nagpur plateau in Jharkhand, S W Bengal, N Odisha, and NE Ghats of Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and N Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Clamator
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Hills of Uttarakhand, east through Sikkim and N Bengal foothills, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura. Non-breeding: W Ghats in addition to parts of breeding range where some birds are year-round.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Hemprich & Ehrenberg
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Symbolae physicae seu icones et descriptiones corporum naturalium novorum aut minus cognitorum quae ex itineribus per Libyam Aegyptum Nubiam Dongolam Syrian Arabiam et Habessianiam publico institutis (etc.)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Only one trans-continental migrant subspecies is known to occur in India. This migrant population is either named _pica_ or _serratus_ (AR2001, RA2012). Payne (2006) designates the African migrant population as _pica_ and hence, the same is followed here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: N India, mostly north and west of a line connecting Mumbai and Darbhanga (Bihar) while also occurring sparingly in the remaining S India as well as E India.

Subspecies.Author: Boddaert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: S and W India extending to about central Maharashtra, Telangana, and Chhattisgarh with most of the population concentrating on the Coromandel coast. Non-breeding: All of the country extending into NE India including Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, and Nagaland.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Range limits of African migrant and regional populations unclear as they only differ in size (wing length).

Genus.Name: Eudynamys
Genus.Author: Vigors & Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: All of the country (including Lakshadweep Is.) except the high Himalaya. Non-breeding: Largely absent from Thar desert and extreme northern India (Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Punjab, Haryana, and Uttarakhand).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Seasonal movements remain undocumented.

Subspecies.Author: Cabanis & Heine
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Nearly year-round possibly breeding, in Andamans – hence the validity of _dolosus_ Ripley 1946, synonymised here, to be revisited.
Subspecies.Distribution: Andaman & Nicobar Islands including far flung Narcondam Is. and Barren Is. Possibly also occurs in extreme NE India along E Manipur and Mizoram.

Genus.Name: Chrysococcyx
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Hills of Uttarakhand (historical), Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Mizoram. Historically – stragglers reported from Adyar (Tamil Nadu) and Teresa Is., C Nicobar.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.Taxonomy: Year-round in Andaman and the population may relate to an undescribed subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Horsfield
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Assam plains and foothills, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur (?), Tripura, Andaman Is. Historically, it has straggled to Perambur (Tamil Nadu) and Nicobar Is.

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Indira point, Great Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Cacomantis
Genus.Author: Müller
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Verhandelingen over de natuurlijke geschiedenis der Nederlandsche overzeesche bezittingen, Zoologie
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Ornitologia della Papuasia e delle Molucche

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Foothills of W Himalaya from Uttarakhand till E Arunachal and all NE Indian states. W Ghats, E Ghats and C Indian foothills and straggling to other parts of peninsula and perhaps to Andaman Is. as well.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, LKO

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae

Subspecies.Author: Heine
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: E India from Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, and Kanha (Madhya Pradesh), ranging east including Bengal, Assam, and all NE Hills states. South through Odisha and NE Ghats of Andhra while it has historically straggled to Chennai.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Species.Author: Vahl
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Skrivter af Naturhistorie-Selskabet
Species.Distribution: Most the country from the foothills of Kashmir, W through W Himalaya and N India, W Rajasthan, and further south in all of the states, east till about W Assam at least, possibly further as well.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Surniculus
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: SW Indian birds sometimes assigned to the Sri Lankan endemic subspecies _stewarti_ Baker 1919. The type specimen from Nepal (NHMUK 1843.1.13.1008) would benefit from re-examination as the typical birds found in Nepal belong to the 'Square-tailed' group. If that be the case, then the name _dicruroides_ shall no longer apply to the 'Fork-tailed' group, which should then be referred to as _S. stewarti_ with the peninsular Indian population remaining undescribed.
Subspecies.Distribution: Peninsular India, up till Rajasthan, C Indian hills., W Ghats, NE Ghats while some birds found up till Himalayan foothills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Movements unstudied – some birds resident while largely migratory.

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Oberholser
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Smithsonian Miscellaneous Collections
Subspecies.Taxonomy: There is only one subspecies of Square-tailed Drongo Cuckoo in India (contra Birds of the World). Here, the subspecies _brachyurus_ Stresemann 1913 (Type locality: Bentong, Pahang, Malay States) is treated as a synonym of _barussarum_ (Type Locality: Tana Bala Island, Batu Islands).
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalayan foothills from Kashmir, Punjab, and Himachal E through Uttarakhand, Sikkim, W Bengal, and NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Genus.Name: Hierococcyx
Genus.Author: Müller
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Verhandelingen over de natuurlijke geschiedenis der Nederlandsche overzeesche bezittingen, Zoologie

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Himalayan hills from Kashmir (?), Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal till Assam and all NE hill states as well as S W Bengal. Non-breeding: Sparingly in C India, NE Ghats, and W Ghats; stragglers to Andaman Is. as well as Nicobar Is. (Great Nicobar Is., Tillongchong Is.).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Vahl
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Skrivter af Naturhistorie-Selskabet
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the country from Kashmir till the tip of the peninsula except the Himalayan region and NE India, east of central Assam (Guwahati region).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Reports further east in Assam, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram not validated. Whether the Sri Lankan endemic subspecies _ciceliae_ Philips 1949 has straggled to the SE coast of Tamil Nadu needs to be validated.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Hills of Sikkim, N Bengal, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram. Straggler to Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Cuculus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _assamicus_ Koelz 1952 from Kohima, Nagaland.
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Himalayan hills from Gilgit and Kashmir, east till Assam, Arunachal and other NE hill states like Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram. Passage: Across the entire country but mostly in W Ghats and E Ghats.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _fatidicus_ Koelz 1954 from Laikul, N Cachar.
Subspecies.Distribution: Hills across most of the country from Kashmir south till the tip of the peninsula except the Thar desert, Rann and parts of W Gujarat. Also, occurs in Andaman Is. and has occurred in Great Nicobar Is. as well.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Movements unstudied and compounded due to lack of vocalisation during non-breeding season.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Larger birds reported from Nicobar Is. may be of the northerly breeding Oriental Cuckoo _C. optatus_. Study required.
Species.Distribution: Himalaya from Gilgit and Kashmir, east till Arunachal as well as all NE hill states. Non-breeding: Occurs in Andaman Is., Central Nicobar Is. and Great Nicobar Is. Stragglers to peninsular India reported from Rajasthan, Bihar, and Gujarat.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.Taxonomy: Taxonomy of the Himalayan breeding birds are vexed. RA2012 considers them as _telephonus_, different from _subtelephonus_ of the northwest. AR2001 consider them as the nominate subspecies. Payne (2005) includes them under _bakeri_, or as intermediate between _subtelephonus_ and _bakeri_. Neither the nominate subspecies, nor _telephonus_ Heine 1863 have a contiguous range with the Himalayan population. We treat the extreme western birds as _subtelephonus_ and extreme eastern birds as _bakeri_ and most of the Himalayan population as intermediate. If the Himalayan population has consistent diagnosable characteristics, a new name may be required.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Restricted here to the northern breeding birds in Russia and N China – including _telephonus_ Heine 1863 (after H&M4).
