Subspecies.Distribution: Passage: Migrating through most of the peninsula in autumn entering through northeast and crossing the country in the west and southwest.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Labelled specimens exist but may not necessarily belong to the northerly breeding population due to nomenclature confusions. However, satellite tagged birds from this population have crossed India during migration.

Subspecies.Author: Zarudny
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornitologicheskii Vestnik
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalayan foothills from Gilgit east through Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal and E Himalaya of Arunachal and N Assam as well as sparingly in the peninsular India. Passage: Most of the country south of the breeding range, including Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Notes: True _subtelephonus_ possibly breeding around Gilgit and some passage birds in northwest of the country may belong to this subspecies. Labelled specimens exist, but have not been investigated.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Taxonomy: C Indian breeding population has pale as well as dark birds (like this subspecies) and hence subspecies uncertain.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: NE India including Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram; but possibly N in Assam and perhaps Arunachal. Passage: Across the peninsula while it also occurs in lowland Assam and has straggled to Great Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Satellite telemetry studies from China has demonstrated that birds belonging to this subspecies also crosses India on its passage to Africa.

Genus.Name: Batrachostomus
Genus.Author: Gould
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Icones avium, or figures and descriptions of new and interesting species of birds from various parts of the globe [world]

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Taxonomic status of subspecies _roonwali_ Dutta 2009 from N Karnataka [=N Kanara] and Kodagu [=Coorg] requires re-evaluation as overlapping characteristics exist and too few specimens were examined. Only the IOC accepts this subspecies, and here we treat it as a synonym of the nominate. Sri Lankan population may qualify as a distinct subspecies; in which case the name _roonwali_ would apply to the entire W Ghat population.
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from about Mumbai till the southern tip in Kanyakumari district but absent in the associated hills like Biligirirangans, Servarayan, and Sirumalai.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rupchandi_ Koelz 1954 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: From Sikkim and N Bengal, east through Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura (?).

Genus.Name: Lyncornis
Genus.Author: Gould
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Icones avium, or figures and descriptions of new and interesting species of birds from various parts of the globe [world]

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Genetically, quite close to _L. m. cerviniceps_ and hence may not warrant subspecies status (see Sangster _et al._ 2022).
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats, south of Palakkad gap in Kerala and Tamil Nadu – the eastern-most ridge is Perumparai, Palani hills (Tamil Nadu), and northern-most is Peechi and S Nelliampathies (Kerala). Reports further north in Palakkad gap may be stragglers.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Sri Lanka (Soysa _et al._ 2008) indicate its potential for vagrancy though exact subspecies identity could not be established.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Icones avium, or figures and descriptions of new and interesting species of birds from various parts of the globe [world]
Subspecies.Distribution: NE India from C and E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura (?). Straggler reported from Odisha.

Genus.Name: Caprimulgus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the country from about Delhi south through E Rajasthan, E Gujarat, Gangetic plains of Uttar Pradesh roughly south of Ganga, C Indian hills, E Ghats, Deccan hillocks, and W Ghats. Absent in Himalayan foothills, N Gangetic plains of Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, W Rajasthan, Kachchh, and NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Darker population from Mizo hills described as _memnon_ Koelz 1954 synonymised with this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalayan foothills from Uttarakhand through Sikkim, W Bengal, Odisha, and entire NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Temminck & Schlegel
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Japonica sive descriptio animalium, quae in itinere per Japoniam, jussu et auspiciis superiorum, qui summum in India Batava imperium tenent, suscepto, annis 1825-1830 collegit, notis, observationibus et adumbrationibus illustravit. Vol. 4. Aves
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Taxonomic status of Nicobar population uncertain.
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Andaman Is. and possibly Nicobar Is. (Kamorta Is. & Great Nicobar Is.).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: Extreme NW India (Gilgit, W Rajasthan, W Kachchh) during passage migration.
Subspecies.Notes: Listed for Kachchh (Abdulali 1969, BNHS #11673) but not by RA2012.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Passage: Mostly NW India, including Gilgit, W Rajasthan, and W Gujarat but stragglers have occurred in Gorakhpur (Uttar Pradesh, historical), Mumbai (Maharashtra, historical), and Lakshadweep Is. (presumably this subspecies).

Species.Author: Sykes
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: W India in Rajasthan, Gujarat and adjoining Maharashtra, straggling to W Bengal, C India, around Delhi, and Jammu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _noctuvigilus_ Koelz 1954 of Kangra (Himachal). Transition area of the western and eastern subspecies in NE India is uncertain.
Subspecies.Distribution: N and C India from Punjab and Himachal, east till C Assam, adjoining W and C Arunachal, and Meghalaya, extending south through S W Bengal, and NE Ghats of Odisha, Chhattisgarh, NE Andhra and Deccan hillocks in Telangana (e.g., Ananthagiri). Straggling to Gangetic plains and C India (e.g., Panna).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Peale
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Narrative of the United States Exploring Expedition during the years 1838, 1839, 1840, 1841, 1842 under the command of Charles Wilkes, U. S. N. Vol. VIII: Mammalia and ornithology. 1st ed.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _silvanus_ Koelz 1954 of Naga hills and _ambiguus_ Hartert 1896.
Subspecies.Distribution: Extreme NE India including Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman as well as the islets of Sound, Interview, Havelock, Alexandra, Jolly Buoy, Sound, and S Brother Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, MCZ

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian ornithology, containing fifty figures of new, unfigured and interesting species of birds, chiefly from the south of India
Subspecies.Distribution: S Peninsula from about N Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, and extreme S W Bengal till the tip of the peninsula.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Latham
Species.AlternativeNames: Common Indian Nightjar, Indian Little Nightjar
Species.Taxonomy: Treated as monotypic by H&M4 including _eidos_ Peters 1940 of Sri Lanka.

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Paler northwest population _gurgaoni_ Koelz 1939 and darker S Indian population, approaching _eidos_ Peters 1940 of Sri Lanka, included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the country south of Jammu, through W and C India till the tip of the peninsula; absent in W Rajasthan and most of Gangetic plains of Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and Jharkhand; east till about W Bengal and sporadic further east; has occurred in Upper Dibang valley (Arunachal), N Cachar (Assam), and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes the northern _monticolus_ group designated as an independent species (see Sangster _et al._ 2021). ZSI#35613 collected from 'Vicinity of Calcutta' by Jerdon in 1847 listed as a syntype. It is unclear if some of the details are in error and whether this is actually one of the specimens examined by Franklin in 1831.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the country from Jammu, through W and C India till the tip of the peninsula; E through the Himalayan foothills, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Migrant or breeding visitor in some parts but movements unclear.

Genus.Name: Zoonavena
Genus.Author: Mathews
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Australia

Species.Author: Tickell
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Foothills in Uttarakhand, and C India along the Satpura ranges, NE Ghats of Odisha and Andhra, W Ghats including midlands south of SW Maharashtra and Goa till the southern tip of the peninsula; east till Biligirirangans (SW Karnataka), Talamalai RF (Tamil Nadu) and Sirumalai (Tamil Nadu).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Genus.Name: Hirundapus
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Supplementum indicis ornithologici, sive systematis ornithologiæ
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Sikkim and Kerala
Subspecies.Notes: The regular occurrence of the nominate subspecies that breeds in C Siberia in our region, at least during migration, cannot be ruled out. Photographs from Sikkim and Kerala match the features of the nominate subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir west through Himachal and Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal – also sporadically in Assam, Nagaland, Mizoram, and S Andaman Is. – those may be birds in migration.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Gujarat and Tamil Nadu not assessed here.

Subspecies.Author: Biswas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ardea
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised (see IOC); whence the species treated as monotypic.
Subspecies.Distribution: Corbett, Uttarakhand as well as Sikkim and N Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: No Indian specimens but Uttarakhand report (Sharma & Khanolkar 2018) as well as birds reported from Sikkim & N Bengal may relate to this taxon.

Subspecies.Author: Oustalet
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Société Philomathique de Paris
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Assam, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.AlternativeNames: Brown-throated Needletail, Large Brown-throated Spinetail Swift
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: W Ghats and Andaman birds may belong to distinct subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam from about Guwahati in the east, adjoining E Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura; sporadically further W in NE Ghats of Odisha and N Andhra. Disjunctly in SW India, south of Goa till extreme S Kerala; extending further east towards the hilly transition zone in Deccan, almost till Mysore, plains in Tamil Nadu adjoining the W Ghats, sporadically in other parts of S peninsula. Also, in all major islands and islets of Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: No definite records known from Nicobars. Reports from W Bengal likely to be correct but not evaluated here.

Genus.Name: Collocalia
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Beavan
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes continues to be treated as a subspecies of extralimital _Collocalia esculenta_ (Linnaeus, 1758) (see HBW/BLI).

Subspecies.Author: Beavan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: All islands in the chain of Andaman & Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Aerodramus
Genus.Author: Oberholser
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: W India from Surat Dangs (Gujarat), W Maharashtra, Goa, coastal and hilly Karnataka including Biligirirangans, Kerala and adjoining Tamil Nadu in associated hill ranges in Nilgiris and Palanis – sometimes also reported off-shore waters in Arabian Sea.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Horsfield
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, Arunachal, and all the NE hill states.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. S Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Interestingly, no other reports after the type specimen was collected from Andaman Is. in 1873. Narcondam Is. report not evaluated.

Species.Author: Thunberg
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Kongliga Svenska Vetenskaps-Akademiens Handlingar

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman as well as associated islets around it like Paget, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), and Tarmugli Is. where they extensively breed as well as all C Nicobar group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompuka, Kamorta, Trinket, and Katchall Is.) and Great Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Tachymarptis
Genus.Author: Roberts
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Annals of the Transvaal Museum

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: See Abdulali (1965) for a detailed taxonomic analysis.

Subspecies.Author: Tschusi zu Schmidhoffen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologisches Jahrbuch
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: At least W Maharashtra probably more widespread in NW India.
Subspecies.Notes: AR2001 range statement of the nominate subspecies as Mt. Abu and Saurashtra may refer to this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh through Himachal, Uttarakhand, possibly Sikkim and N Bengal. Winter: C India and possibly further south.

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: NW Deccan and NW Ghats.
Subspecies.Notes: Specimens in the BNHS apart from the holotype are #11560, #19306, #19725, and #22809.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India south of Jog falls and SE Ghats.

Genus.Name: Apus
Genus.Author: Scopoli
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Introductio ad historiam naturalem sistens genera lapidum, plantarum, et animalium hactenus detecta, caracteribus essentialibus donata, in tribus divisa, subinde ad leges naturae

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir, Ladakh, and Himachal in the W Himalaya. Widespread in passage throughout the S peninsula and Lakshadweep. Sporadic elsewhere.

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Supplementum indicis ornithologici, sive systematis ornithologiæ
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Leader _et al._ (2020) did not distinguish the subspecies of the specimen in YPM but presumably is of this taxon. The specimens in BNHS are tagged as _A. p. kanoi_ Yamashina 1942 (Leader _et al._ 2020) – however, they were supposedly meant for the Tibetan breeding _salimalii_ Lack 1958. Now, we consider all regional specimens to be the nominate subspecies _pacificus_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Autumn Vagrant (?). Historically reported from Golaghat and Cachar (both Assam).

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: ZSI register lists 35614-15 both are 'Holotype' which must be an error and they must be Syntypes.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Ladakh till Arunachal as well as hills of Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur and Mizoram. Winter: Also, in SW India from Ratnagiri (W Maharashtra) south till Kerala at least.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _rupchandi_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizoram.
Species.Distribution: Garo and Khasi hills in Meghalaya, locally in hills of Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Gray
Species.AlternativeNames: Indian House Swift, House Swift (incl. _A. nipalensis_)

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir down S through N, NW, and W India and S through Tamil Nadu except SW India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Madarász
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annales Historico-naturales Musei Nationalis Hungarici
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: See Packert _et al._ (2012) for recommendation on keeping it under _A. affinis_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, W Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Range poorly worked out; where this taxon overlaps with Little Swift in E India is unknown.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam.
Subspecies.Notes: RA2012 considers this subspecies as hypothetical in E Assam. Specimens tagged as this subspecies from Cachar (AMNH#635631, YPM#042639) and Tripura (ZSI #38711-23) could be correct but not investigated.

Genus.Name: Cypsiurus
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: L'Écho du Monde Savant

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Animal Kingdom. Arranged in conformity with its organization, by the Baron Cuvier, with additional descriptions of all the species hitherto named, and of many not before noticed
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Include _palmarum_ Gray 1830 (No locality = Cawnpore [=Kanpur]).
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout Indian peninsula from the Himalayan foothills of Himachal, south till Kanyakumari; except the driest portions of Thar, east till about Assam and Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: The intergradation zone with _infumatus_ in Assam has not been worked out and Brahmaputra river kept as the dividing line for convenience reasons. Arunachal birds unassigned to any subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Sclater
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Hemiprocne
Genus.Author: Nitzsch
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Observationes de avium arteria carotide communi
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington

Species.Author: Tickell
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.TypeLocality: (Jungles of Borabhum and Dholbhum, EC India)
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _dryas_ Ripley 1950 from Juna Rajpipla, S Gujarat.
Species.Distribution: E Himachal, Uttarakhand foothills, N Bengal, east till about C Assam, hills of C India from E Rajasthan through Madhya Pradesh extending till NE Ghats; Deccan hillocks; W India from S Gujarat till the southern tip of the peninsula; SE Ghats and associated hills in Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Andhra. Stragglers occurring in intervening regions.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Genus.Name: Rallus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Memoirs of the Wernerian Natural History Society

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Zarudny
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Kashmir. Winter: NW India from Kashmir, Jammu, Ladakh, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, and Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, NW Maharashtra, and straggling to Goa and W Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: No Indian specimens located during my study but specimens from Kullu and/or Dehra Dun that is likely to be present in NHMUK (Sharpe 1894) has not been investigated. Three egg sets tagged as this from Kashmir (WFVZ, UBCBBM). The nominate subspecies could also occur.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Winter: W Bengal, Assam plains and adjoining Arunachal, Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, YPM

Genus.Name: Crex
Genus.Author: Bechstein
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologisches Taschenbuch von und für Deutschland (etc.)

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. During autumn migration in the trans-Himalaya (Gilgit, Ladakh, Spiti) as well as Great Nicobar Is. (Feb).

Genus.Name: Lewinia
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Swainson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Animals in Menageries. In: The Cabinet Cyclopædia conducted by the Rev. Dionysius Lardner
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat, coastal plains of W coast, entire S India roughly south of Bengaluru, E coastal plains, sporadically in EC India, W Bengal, Assam plains, Manipur valley, and Tripura.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _nicobariensis_ Abdulali, 1967 from Nancowry Is. (C Nicobar group) included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman as well as associated islets including Interview and Havelock Is. as well as Kamorta (C Nicobar group) and Great Nicobar Is. (S Nicobar group).

Genus.Name: Porzana
Genus.Author: Vieillot
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India but known mostly from NW Maharashtra, Gujarat, Kolkata, and Delhi regions. Sporadically from Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, Punjab, Rajasthan, Assam, E coast, C India, S Deccan, and SW coast – some of them possibly birds on passage.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Gallinula
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _indica_ Blyth 1842 included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India except the Himalayan range; but occurs in trans-Himalayan region of Ladakh and Spiti.

Subspecies.Author: Horsfield
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Several birds in S India also show a similar large frontal shield (compared to the birds in N India) and hence this feature may be clinal (see RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman including several islets like Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Jolly Buoy, and Rutland Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Only a single specimen from Port Blair identified as this subspecies (Abdulali 1969); but photos indicate this to be the dominant subspecies in the islands (S & Little). Currently, BNHS has three specimens identified as this subspecies from S Andamans (#21902, #23130-31).

Genus.Name: Fulica
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kashmir till Kanyakumari – also Assam plains, adjoining Arunachal, Manipur valley, and Tripura – as well as in Lakshadweep and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Genus.Name: Porphyrio
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Supplementum indicis ornithologici, sive systematis ornithologiæ
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Ladakh and Kashmir south till Kanyakumari, east through Brahmaputra plains, Manipur valley, and Tripura. Also, in Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Poliolimnas
Genus.Author: Sharpe
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Genus.GenusDesignationText: ; Type by original designation and monotypy

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Maguri (Assam) and Sippighat (Andamans).

Genus.Name: Gallicrex
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the Museum Asiatic Society

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: Indo-Gangetic plains, W Bengal, Assam plains, Manipur valley and other low-lying areas of NE India, Gujarat, EC India, W and E coastal plains, and S peninsula. Andaman & Nicobar Is. as well as Lakshadweep.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, ROM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Amaurornis
Genus.Author: Reichenbach
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Handbuch der speciellen Ornithologie

Subspecies.Author: Pennant
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Zoology
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir south till Kanyakumari and Lakshadweep Is, west till Gujarat and east till Assam, Arunachal, and NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman, Narcondam, Barren, and also islets of North Reef, Interview, Long, Havelock, Neil, Ross, Tarmugli, Alexandra, Red Skin, Jolly Buoy, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Though not recognised by AR2001, it has a distinctly whitish head and hence recognised here (Praveen & Khot 2023).
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised. Records from S Nicobar Is. placed under this for convenience, and may represent another subspecies as there are differences (Abdulali 1979).
Subspecies.Distribution: C Nicobar Is. (Tillangchong, Teresa, Kamorta, Trinket, Nancowry, and Katchal Is) – and S Nicobar Is. (Great Nicobar, Trek, Tries, and Meroe Is.).

Genus.Name: Rallina
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The genera of birds: comprising their generic characters, a notice of the habits of each genus, and an extensive list of species referred to their several genera

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: N, Middle and S Andaman Is. as well as smaller islets around including Interview, Long, Havelock, Neil, Rutland, South Sentinel as well as Little Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Raffles
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Species.Taxonomy: An undescribed _Rallina_ sp., most similar to this species, known as 'Great Nicobar Crake', is also known to exist in Great Nicobar Is. (Rajeshkumar _et al._ 2012).
Species.Distribution: Great Nicobar Is.

Species.Author: de Lafresnaye
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Revue Zoologique, par la Société Cuvierienne

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, Sikkim, W Bengal, SW India from Mumbai south till Kanyakumari, east to Assam valley and Nagaland; sporadic in rest of Indian subcontinent. Also, in Narcondam, Andaman & Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Zapornia
Genus.Author: Leach
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systematic catalogue of the specimens of the indigenous Mammalia and birds that are preserved in The British Museum (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _bakeri_ (Hartert, 1917) from Bhimtal (Uttarakhand) included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir south through the Himalayan foothills and Indo-Gangetic plains till W Bengal, Brahmaputra plains, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur valley, Mizoram, and Tripura; Gujarat, E coastal plains, EC and S India except southwest. Also Andaman Is. and certain islets.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes synonymised with the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India from about Mumbai south till S Kerala.

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Base of the Himalayan foothills in Kashmir through N India, NW India except Thar, Gujarat, C India, W Bengal, Brahmaputra plains, and Manipur valley, south till S Karnataka and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Notes: Migration details not worked out.

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annus I Historico-naturalis. Descriptiones avium musei proprii earumque rariorum, quas vidit in vivario Augustiss. Imperatorus, et museo excell. Comitis Francisci Annib. Turriani
Species.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat with sporadic reports from Gilgit, Rajasthan, W Maharashtra, and coastal Karnataka.
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Kashmir. Non-breeding: Throughout India including Assam plains and Manipur valley apart from Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, HYD

Species.Author: Walden
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam plains, Arunachal, Meghalaya, Nagaland, and Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH

Genus.Name: Heliopais
Genus.Author: Sharpe
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Historically known only from a few specimens from Namdapha region in E Arunachal, Upper Assam (Dibrugarh, Tinsukia), and Cachar region.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, YPM

Genus.Name: Leucogeranus
Genus.Author: Bonaparte
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Winter: Historically much of N India in select sites but recently only in Bharatpur. They completely stopped wintering after 2002.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, LKO

Genus.Name: Antigone
Genus.Author: Reichenbach
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Avium Systema Naturale. Das natürliche System der Vögel mit hundert Tafeln grösstentheils Original-Abbildungen der bis jetzt entdecken fast zwölfhundert typischen Formen. Vorlaüfer einer Iconographie der Arten der Vögel aller Welttheile

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Jammu south through Indo-Gangetic plains till about Bihar, C India east till N Chhattisgarh, E Madhya Pradesh. and E Maharashtra, west till W Gujarat and eastern edges of Thar in Rajasthan. Historically till N Bengal and W Assam.

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Historically, E Assam and Manipur valley.
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens traced to support this claim though Higgins (1934) recounts flocks in Manipur valley. The nearest present-day site of this taxon is c.350km N-NE at Indawgyi Lake in Myanmar. Reports of Cranes from Manipur, this as well as Hooded Crane _G. monacha_ Temminck, 1835 (see Karam & Shaikh 2020), have been difficult to evaluate in the absence of independently verifiable evidence; but may well have been true.

Genus.Name: Grus
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes considered under the genus _Anthropoides_ (see eBird/Clements) which is otherwise not recognised by other authorities.
Species.Distribution: Winter: Base of W Himalaya, Indo-Gangetic plains east till about Lucknow, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra and south till about Ballari in Karnataka – straggler further east and south.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: Gangetic plains, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra and adjoining W and N Madhya Pradesh, N Bengal and Assam plains while straggling to other parts of the country, east and south.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, UMMZ, MCZ, USNM

Species.Author: Przevalski
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Mongoliya i strana tangutov: trekhletneye puteshestviye v vostochnoy nagornoy Azii
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Ladakh and N Sikkim. Winter: Historically in Ziro but also in Zemithang and Sangti in Arunachal, straggling to Assam plains.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, FMNH

Genus.Name: Esacus
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux

Species.Author: Cuvier
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Le règne animal distribué d'aprés son organisation, pour servir de base a l'histoire naturelle des animaux et d'introduction à l'anatomie comparée. Nouvelle édition, revue et augmentée
Species.Distribution: Throughout India except Thar region and high Himalaya; extending east along Assam plains and Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Species.Distribution: Most islets around Andaman as well as N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, USNM

Genus.Name: Burhinus
Genus.Author: Illiger
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Prodromus systematis mammalium et avium: additis terminis zoographicis utriusque classis, eorumque versione germanica

Species.Author: Salvadori
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Atti della Società Italiana di Scienze Naturali e del Museo Civico di Storia Naturale in Milano
Species.Taxonomy: Follows H&M4 in dating it as 1865 (contra Aimassi 2022, see also Praveen & Jayapal 2023). Subspecies _mayeri_ Koelz 1939, from Londa (N Karnataka), synonymised with the nominate subspecies and hence treated here as monotypic.
Species.Distribution: Throughout India except Himalaya, W Ghats and NE Indian hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Himantopus
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Throughout peninsular India, including Himalaya where it is found at least during migration, Assam plains of both Brahmaputra and Barak, Manipur valley, Tripura, Lakshadweep, and Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Recurvirostra
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: NW and N India from Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Gujarat (breeds in Kachchh), Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains, and along the W and E coast while straggling throughout the country during migration.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Ibidorhyncha
Genus.Author: Vigors
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalayan riverine tracts in Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, Assam, and Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Haematopus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Buturlin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornitologicheskii Vestnik
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Regional birds considered _buturlini_ Dementiev 1941, which breeds in Turkmenistan and S Kazakhstan. Treated here as a junior synonym.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W coast from Gujarat till S Kerala; E coast from about Kakinada (Andhra) south till Toothukudi (Tamil Nadu). Rare further north in the coasts of Odisha and W Bengal. Sometimes also inland during migration.
Subspecies.Notes: Satellite telemetry studies required to see if birds from the range of true _longipes_ winter in India.

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: May occur in W Bengal as birds likely to be this subspecies have been found in Sundarbans of Bangladesh (Chowdhury & Melville 2018).

Genus.Name: Pluvialis
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: Both W and E coast, Kachchh and a few large inland rivers; as well as Lakshadweep and Andaman Is. During migration, occurs sporadically throughout India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Brehm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Handbuch der Naturgeschichte aller Vögel Deutschlands
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes subspecies not recognised (see Cramp _et al._ 1983, IOC); whence the species is monotypic.
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Only from Pong (Himachal) and Kachchh (Gujarat).
Subspecies.Notes: See Akthar & Tiwari (1991), Abhinav & Dhadwal (2013). Baker's Assam specimen is not locatable while Lucknow State Museum do not have Reid's specimen (Zarrin 2023). Based on RA2012, middle-east birds likely to occur in India (specimens from Pakistan) and hence this subspecies assumed here.

Species.Author: Müller
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Des Ritters Carl von Linné ... vollständigen Natursystems Supplements- und Register-Band über alle sechs Theile oder Classen des Thierreichs
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Kole (Kerala).

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: Winter: Both W and E coast, Kachchh, as well as along Brahmaputra and Ganga rivers and Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is. During migration, it occurs throughout India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Charadrius
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Lowe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat, coasts of Kerala, E coast around Chennai, straggling elsewhere in W and E coast, several inland records in N India, possibly most on migration but regular winter visitor to Pong (Himachal).

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir, Ladakh. Non-breeding: Along W and E coastal plains as well as Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains; Lakshadweep and Andaman Is. On passage elsewhere in the subcontinent.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Winter ranges and its overlap with _jerdoni_ is not well-worked.

Subspecies.Author: Legge
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Aegialitis minuta_ Legge 1880.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Himalayan foothills of Jammu and Punjab south till Kanyakumari, east at least till Brahmaputra plains, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Gray & Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the specimens and drawings of mammals, birds, reptiles, and fishes of Nepal and Tibet, presented by B. H. Hodgson, Esq., to the British Museum
Species.Distribution: N Bengal (Buxa), east through Assam and Arunachal (breeding), sporadically from Manipur and Cachar plains and historically up to W Uttar Pradesh.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, YPM

Genus.Name: Vanellus
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: N and NE India from Kashmir, Ladakh through Jammu till Rajasthan and Gujarat in the west and Arunachal, Assam, and Manipur valley in the east.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Species.Author: Lesson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Species.Taxonomy: Includes here _ventralis_ Wagler 1827 from Calcutta [=Kolkata].
Species.Distribution: W Ghats including Dangs, E Ghats north at least till Maredumilli (but mostly south of the Godavari river), certain hilly pockets in the Deccan, C Indian hills extending till the Mt. Abu region in the NW India and Satpuras, Pench, and Nawegoan on the south-east. Historically, entire SW coastal plains.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, MNHN, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, HYD

Species.Author: Boddaert
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Species.Distribution: Throughout India north till Jammu and Himachal, east till about C Assam and Tripura and the entire peninsula.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Winter: E India, Indo-Gangetic plains up till about Delhi, NE India including the plains of Brahmaputra and Barak rivers as well as Manipur valley, E coast, W coast from south of Mumbai region, NE Maharashtra, Andaman Is., and Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Boddaert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir and Ladakh – towards west and south till the extremities; east till Assam plains and Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Historically, intergrades with the nominate subspecies reported from Assam and Meghalaya along with typotypical _atronuchalis_. However, recent photographs from Assam or Meghalaya do not have any typical birds though a few intergrades exist from Assam, Manipur valley, and Tripura seems to be a zone of intergradation with some typical birds and several intermediates. Though there are no photos from Mizoram, subspecies is likely to be present based on its known range.
Subspecies.Distribution: Manipur valley, Mizoram, and Tripura.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Winter: Historically entire NW India reaching east till Bihar and south till S and E Maharashtra with vagrants elsewhere. Now locally in Gujarat and Rajasthan.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Lichtenstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise von Orenburg nach Buchara
Species.Distribution: Winter: Entire NW India (breeds locally in Gujarat), south of Jammu and roughly till a line connecting Lucknow to Mumbai. Stragglers reported elsewhere in east and south.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM

Genus.Name: Anarhynchus
Genus.Author: Quoy & Gaimard
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Voyage de découvertes de la corvette l'Astrolabe, exécuté par ordre du Roi, pendant les années 1826-1827-1828-1829, sous le commandement de M. J. Dumont d'Urville (etc.). Zoologie. Vol. 1

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Widely during passage, and occasionally during winter in Gujarat, Rajasthan, Lakshadweep, W coast as well as SE coast.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Digha-Shankarpur Estuary (W Bengal), Narcondam Is., Radhanagar creek (N Andaman), as well as a historical record from Andamans.

Species.Author: Wagler
Species.AlternativeNames: Mongolian Plover, Lesser Sand Plover (incl. _A. mongolus_)
Species.Taxonomy: Recent split (Wei _et al._ 2022). Regionally occurring _atrifrons_, _pamirensis_, and _schaeferi_ (last one considered tentative for India) retained under this species while the subspecies _stegmanni_ (tentative for India) included under Siberian Sand Plover _A. mongolus_ Pallas 1776, a separate species.

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: E coast (Point Calimere); and NW India during migration to E Africa, and possibly also along W coast and Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Included here based on mist-netted birds in Point Calimere (Balachandran & Natarajan 1992) as well as a colour-flagged bird from Kenya reported from W Gujarat (Balachandran _et al._ 2018). Recent satellite tracked bird took a route via NW India on its journey to Africa.

Subspecies.Author: Wagler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Along the trans-Himalayan lakes in Gilgit, Ladakh, Lahaul-Spiti, and Sikkim. Non-breeding: Along the seaboard of W and E coast as well as Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Rare inland during passage.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Meyer de Schauensee
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant (?). Only reported from Point Calimere.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies _stegmanni_ Portenko 1939 of _A. mongolus_ also reported from Point Calimere. More extensive ringing studies required in E coast specifically targeting subspecies identification using latest keys.

Subspecies.Author: Carlos et al.
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _crassirostris_ Severtsov, 1873.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat coast.
Subspecies.Notes: Possibly occurring in winter/passage in W India and included here based on a colour-flagged bird from Kenya reported from Gujarat (Balachandran _et al._ 2018).

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Ladakh. Winter: Throughout E and W coast as well as Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is. During migration, seen inland.
Subspecies.Notes: Confidence as to this subspecies based on the syntype.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Indus valley, Gujarat, extending till Bihar. Non-breeding: Throughout the peninsula till the southern tip and east along the Brahmaputra valley in Assam, Lakshadweep, and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM
Subspecies.Notes: All Andaman reports considered this taxon (media verified) though _C [a.] dealbatus_ Swinhoe 1870 has been reported from N Andaman (Bhopale 2010 – more media details unavailable and hence considered tentative). Nicobar reports not evaluated.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert & Jackson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Proposed as an independent species with a name 'Hanuman Plover' (Niroshan _et al._ 2023).
Subspecies.Distribution: Deccan including Maharashtra, Telangana, Karnataka, S Andhra, and coastal Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact northern limits of this subspecies uncertain.

Genus.Name: Rostratula
Genus.Author: Vieillot
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Throughout India including Assam plains, Manipur valley and Andaman Is. except some of the driest parts of Thar and high Himalaya.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Genus.Name: Hydrophasianus
Genus.Author: Wagler
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Species.Distribution: Throughout Indian peninsula from about Himachal south till the tip (patchily in Thar) as well as Brahmaputra plains, Manipur valley, and Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Metopidius
Genus.Author: Wagler
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Species.Distribution: Throughout Indian peninsula from about Punjab and Himachal south till the tip of peninsular (except W Thar) as well as Assam plains and Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Numenius
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout W and E coast apart from the coasts of Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Rare inland during passage.
Subspecies.Notes: See Roselaar (1998).

Subspecies.Author: Lowe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat and W coast; Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Some specimens of the nominate subspecies from the region likely to be of this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Tomkovich
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zoologicheskii Zhurnal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Recent description. Re-evaluation of specimens from the region required.
Subspecies.Distribution: Indian coast line.
Subspecies.Notes: A satellite tracked bird from Singapore made a stop-over in Odisha coast and bred in the transition zone between the nominate subspecies and this species.

Subspecies.Author: Scopoli
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Subspecies.Distribution: S W Bengal, Andaman & Nicobar Is., and NE India.
Subspecies.Notes: No definitive specimens identified (RA2012) but possible on migration. Currently listed specimens from various museums need re-examination and re-assignment to the right subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat and probably W coast; Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Past claims from W India unverified or now discounted (Abdulali 1970, AR2001). Currently listed specimens need re-examination and re-assignment to the correct subspecies. However, this subspecies is still likely during migration.

Subspecies.Author: Neumann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised but see Engelmoer & Roselaar(1998).
Subspecies.Distribution: W coast.
Subspecies.Notes: Likely during migration.

Subspecies.Author: Brehm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Handbuch der Naturgeschichte aller Vögel Deutschlands
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout W and E coast apart from the coasts of Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Occurs locally along large water-bodies in Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains as well as large inland lakes in NW India, C India, N Deccan as well as Manipur valley.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: All regional wintering birds assumed to be this subspecies but more critical examination, with ringing studies, required.

Genus.Name: Limosa
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Bom et al.
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New subspecies carved out of _taymyrensis_ Engelmoer & Roselaar 1998.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW Indian coasts.
Subspecies.Notes: Ring recovery of a Kachchh bird at Tyumen, S Russia (Balachandran _et al._ 1998) indicates a possible passage to the breeding grounds of this subspecies as this site is near to the migration stopover sites in Bom _et al._ (2021).

Subspecies.Author: Engelmoer & Roselaar
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Geographical variation in waders
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Entire coastal India including Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Retained here as tentative pending further investigations.

Subspecies.Author: Portenko
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Auk
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _anadyrensis_ Engelmoer & Roselaar 1998 treated as an intermediate population between this taxon and _baueri_ – and treated here under this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Nicobar Is. (Vagrant?).
Subspecies.Notes: On strength of Ri1982, adding here under this subspecies (previously under _baueri_). RA2012 treats Ripley's bird (BNHS #24227) as _anadyrensis_. Now, _baueri_ Naumann 1836 is restricted to the breeding birds in the Nearctic (Engelmoer & Roselaar 1997) and hence unlikely to be the Nicobar bird.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Punjab south through Delhi region, E Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India till Odisha, sporadically in Gangetic and Assam plains, Deccan, and southern peninsula.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Proposed as distinct species (RA2012) but see Van Gils _et al._ (2019).
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: C Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha, S W Bengal, Assam plains, and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Identity of the large swarms of autumn migrants in SC Kerala unresolved – but may belong to a population in the E Asian-Australasian flyway. Distribution in Andaman Is. and SW Bengal not supported by specimens but evidently this subspecies on range.

Genus.Name: Limnodromus
Genus.Author: Wied-Neuwied
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Beiträge zur Naturgeschichte von Brasilien

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Winter: Reported from Harike (Punjab), Basai and Bindawas (Haryana), Jamnagar (Gujarat), Kolkata region (W Bengal), Chilika (Odisha), Goa, Changaram (Kerala), Pulicat (Andhra) and Point Calimere (Tamil Nadu).
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Species.Author: Say
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Account of an expedition from Pittsburgh to the Rocky Mountains, performed in the years 1819 and '20, by order of the Hon. J. C. Calhoun, Sec'y of War: under the command of Major Stephen H. Long. From the notes of Major Long, Mr. T. Say, and other gentlemen of the exploring party
Species.Distribution: Winter: Across the country, possibly most birds on passage – from Sonipat, Sultanpur (both in Haryana), Bharatpur (Rajasthan), Jorhat (Assam), Khijadiya (Gujarat), Mumbai (Maharashtra), Camorlim (Goa), Arani (Tamil Nadu), and Kole (Kerala).

Genus.Name: Lymnocryptes
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Brünnich
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia borealis, sistens collectionem avium ex omnibus, Imperio Danico subjectis (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout the plains in India as well as Andaman Is. while absent in mountain chains and deserts.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Scolopax
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _ultimus_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizoram.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, and Ladakh, E through Himachal and Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, and Arunachal. Winter: Also, in the hills of Meghalaya, Cachar, Nagaland and Mizoram. Historically, also to the SW Ghats but now merely a straggler.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Gallinago
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Gleanings in Science
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Along the high as well as trans-Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, and Arunachal; sporadically in Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, and Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports elsewhere in the subcontinent not evaluated.

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Historically along the Himalaya from Himachal till Arunachal as well as in Meghalaya and Manipur. Wintering in Assam, S W Bengal, Bihar, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, along the W Ghats in a few localities from N Maharashtra till Ashambu hills in Tamil Nadu as well as SE Ghats. Now, only known from Sikkim, Mishmi Hills (Arunachal), and Narcondam Is. in the past ten years.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Supplement to the general synopsis of birds
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Historically to S India with four reports from Bengaluru (Karnataka), Chennai, Arakkonam and Nilgiris (all in Tamil Nadu).
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Historically from E Assam, Nagaland, Kolkata, and Mumbai region, and multiple sites in S India (Mysuru region, Nilgiris, Kannur in Kerala, and Chennai region).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, YPM

Species.Author: Bonaparte
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annali di Storia Naturale
Species.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat, Maharashtra and southern peninsular India, E India from Chhattisgarh, Odisha, through W Bengal and entire NE India. Sporadically along the Himalaya and its foothills as well as N India. Also, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Kashmir. Winter: Throughout the peninsula including NE India and Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Phalaropus
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Across Indian peninsula during passage (mostly spring) – reports from Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Maharashtra, and Telangana.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat and Rajasthan as well as SE coast and off-shore Arabian Sea. Vagrant elsewhere in the subcontinent.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, FMNH

Genus.Name: Xenus
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Güldenstädt
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Novi Commentarii Academiae Scientiarum Imperialis Petropolitanae
Species.Distribution: Winter: Entire Indian coastline including Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Also inland during passage migration.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, ROM

Genus.Name: Actitis
Genus.Author: Illiger
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Prodromus systematis mammalium et avium: additis terminis zoographicis utriusque classis, eorumque versione germanica
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with their synonyma and with an indication of the typical species of each genus. 2nd. ed.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Summer: W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, and Garhwal (Uttarakhand). Winter: Throughout India including Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Tringa
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India including Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Pulicat, Yedaiyanthittu (both Tamil Nadu) and Boat Is. (Andaman Is.).

Species.Author: Bechstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologisches Taschenbuch von und für Deutschland (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout peninsular India excluding high Himalaya extending to Brahmaputra plains and Manipur valley. Also, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India excluding trans and high Himalaya extending to Brahmaputra plains and NE hill states. Also, Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: W India.
Subspecies.Notes: No definitive specimens from India but many labelled so in museums.

Subspecies.Author: Buturlin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Opredelitel promyslovykh ptits
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India.
Subspecies.Notes: RA2012 includes this basis H&M3 but H&M4 do not include this subspecies for S Asia. However, a bird ringed from Bharatpur was recovered from Lake Kulundinskoye, S Siberia. Similarly, a bird ringed from Point Calimere was recovered from Lake Zaysan, E Kazhakhstan (Balachandran _et al._ 2018) – both within the breeding range of this subspecies on current knowledge. Recently, a satellite tracked bird from Bangladesh crossed Assam & Bhutan and reached the range of this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen & Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: In their original description, authors said to have examined five specimens in summer plumage from India (presumably Ladakh) as well as several more winter specimens. Stuart Baker's statement (Baker 1929, 1933) that it winters in E India is probably based entirely on the description by these authors. Hale (1971) remarks that the material examined by the authors included _ussuriensis_ and hence presumably some from India.
Subspecies.Distribution: E India.
Subspecies.Notes: Its breeding grounds are presumably in the Far East and hence likely to occur at least during migration.

Subspecies.Author: Hale
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society
Subspecies.Distribution: S W Bengal
Subspecies.Notes: RA2012 includes it basis H&M3 but H&M4 do not include this subspecies for S Asia. Breeding and wintering ranges are putative (Hale 1971). Accepted here as the original description of the subspecies included paratypes from Kolkata and Bengal (NHMUK#1970.9.2-4, 1880.1.1.4457) though exact range is unknown.

Subspecies.Author: Oberholser
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised (RA2012). Includes _meinertzhageni_ Theide 1963.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh, N Sikkim. Winter: Throughout India including coasts and inland wetlands as well as Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.

Species.Author: Nordmann
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise um die Erde durch Nord-Asien und die beiden Oceane, in den Jahren 1828, 1829 und 1830 ausgeführt. Naturhistorischer Atlas: Verzeichniss von Thieren und Pflanzen, welche auf einer Reise um die Erde gesammelt wurden
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Coasts of W Bengal and once to Maharashtra.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Adumbratiunculæ. Avium variarum praecedenti elencho insertarum, sed quæ in Systemate Naturæ Illustr. Linnæi nondum extant
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout peninsular India except high Himalaya, extending to Brahmaputra plains and Manipur valley. Also, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Gunnerus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Beskrivelse over Finmarkens Lapper, deres Tungemaal, Levemaade og forrige Afgudsdyrkelse, oplyst ved mange Kaabberstykker
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India excluding high Himalaya. Also, Lakshadweep and Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Arenaria
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
