Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Regional _rectirostris_ Gould, 1843 included here. If recognised, the typotypical nominate subspecies only reported from Kachchh (Gujarat), Uttar Kannada (Karnataka), and Harike (Punjab) – last two being ring recoveries – though can occur more widely. _leucophea_ Gould 1848 (Type locality = India) is also a synonym of _rectirostris_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Gilgit and Ladakh till the southern tip as well as NE India. Also, occurs in Lakshadweep Is, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Extralimital migrants augment regional population.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Meyen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nova Acta Physico-medica Academiae Caesareae Leopoldino-Carolinae Naturae Curiosum
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Jammu south and east including Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, TNHM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Extralimital migrants may be involved and some birds in NW may be from the range of the nominate subspecies.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _imperialis_ Baker 1928 from Sikkim terai, Bhutan duars.
Species.Distribution: Historically from N Bengal (and/or Sikkim) east till Arunachal, Upper Assam, Nagaland, and Mizoram while now confined to sites in Namdapha, Kamlang, and Walong regions in E Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Cretzschmar
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Atlas zu der Reise im nördlichen Afrika von Eduard Rüppell. Erste Abtheilung. Zoologie. Vögel
Species.Distribution: Reported only from Sundarbans, where they are probably breeding.
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Genus.Name: Plegadis
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Species.Distribution: Throughout India from Ladakh and Kashmir as well as Brahmaputra plains, Manipur valley and Tripura; sporadic in EC India and have occurred in Lakshadweep and Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, FMNH, ROM, LKO

Genus.Name: Threskiornis
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Appendix to a list of the genera of birds

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Species.Distribution: Throughout India except Kashmir, trans and high Himalaya and most of E Himalaya.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, MNHN, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, TNHM

Genus.Name: Pseudibis
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The zoological miscellany

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Species.Distribution: Throughout the peninsula from south of the Himalayan foothills till the southern tip and east till W Assam. Only stragglers to SW India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM

Genus.Name: Platalea
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from about Punjab and Himachal down south; east till about W Bengal and straggling to Brahmaputra plains in Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM
Subspecies.Notes: Ring recoveries indicate extralimital population is involved (Balachandran _et al._ 2018).

Genus.Name: Pandion
Genus.Author: de Savigny
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India in the low country from Jammu & Kashmir, east and south till the extreme tips of the country including islands of Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Breeding in W Himalaya and elsewhere not investigated; regularly known to over-summer widely in the country.

Genus.Name: Elanus
Genus.Author: de Savigny
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1

Species.Author: Desfontaines
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire de l'Académie Royale des Sciences. Avec les Mémoires de Mathématique & de Physique

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir south till the tip of the peninsula and east through NE India – including lowland Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura; but not reported from Mizoram). Reported from Lakshadweep.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Gypaetus
Genus.Author: Storr
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Alpenreise vom Jahre 1781

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, and W Arunachal.

Genus.Name: Neophron
Genus.Author: de Savigny
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rubipersonatus_ Zarudny & Härms 1902 which is the name given to the Himalayan breeding population of the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: NW Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand – as well as Rajasthan, Kachchh, and Uttar Pradesh during winter.
Subspecies.Notes: Winter numbers augmented by extralimital visitors.

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India south of the Himalaya and east of NW India – including C India, Deccan; sparingly elsewhere in south and east as well as in NE India; and all the way till the southern tip of the peninsula. Formerly more widespread in S India.

Genus.Name: Pernis
Genus.Author: Cuvier
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Le règne animal distribué d'après son organisation, pour servir de base a l'histoire naturelle des animaux et d'introduction à l'anatomie comparée

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Hybrids with Oriental Honey Buzzard also occur.
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Pure birds reported from Porbandar (Gujarat), Nalgonda (Telangana), Kasaragod (Kerala), Madurai, Ramanathapuram, and Tirunelveli (all three in Tamil Nadu).

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Taczanowski
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Faune ornithologique de la Sibérie orientale
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Verified reports from Mhow (Madhya Pradesh), Bhandara and Nanded (Maharashtra), Patna (Bihar), Mangpoo (N Bengal), and Charidaur (Assam).

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir south till the tip of the peninsula and east including all NE hill states. Passage migrant through Himalaya including trans-Himalaya. Reported regularly from Andaman & Nicobar Is though subspecies is uncertain.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Aviceda
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: On the natural history and classification of birds
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , On the natural history and classification of birds

Subspecies.Author: Legge
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Central W Ghats from Chikmagalur till Wayanad.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports south of Wayanad in the W Ghats do not have specimen or media support.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Disjunctly in NE Ghats from W Bengal south till Maredumilli, east through Chhattisgarh to Kanha in C India. Sporadic in other parts of C India. Also, Great Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: N Bengal, Sikkim, along Assam, and all NE hills states. Non-breeding: SW India mostly in Kerala, while other reports from peninsular India are during passage.

Subspecies.Author: Dumont
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised. If _leuphotes sensu stricto_ Dumont 1820 is not the breeding subspecies in SW India, then all birds are from the population (of _syama_); and hence that subspecies is not needed. Revision required.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding (historical) in SW India.

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali & Grubh
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman apart from Havelock Is. as well as Kamorta (C Nicobar group) and Great Nicobar Is. (S Nicobar group).
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens from Nicobar Is. but believed to be this subspecies.

Genus.Name: Sarcogyps
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: L'Écho du Monde Savant

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.AlternativeNames: King Vulture, Black Vulture, Pondicherry Vulture
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Species.Distribution: Historically throughout India but presently in N, C, and W India apart from C Assam and SW Karnataka, NE Tamil Nadu, and adjoining Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, LKO

Genus.Name: Aegypius
Genus.Author: de Savigny
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Species.Distribution: Winter: Along the Himalaya, Rajasthan, Gujarat, and C India apart from N Bengal and C Assam. Vagrants to S India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, MCZ, USNM

Genus.Name: Gyps
Genus.Author: de Savigny
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Historically throughout India but presently along the Himalaya, Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India, NW Maharashtra, Assam plains as well as SW Karnataka, NE Tamil Nadu, and adjoining Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Species.Distribution: Historically throughout India from the base of the Himalayan foothills except E and NE India and extreme S India but now confined, locally, to Rajasthan, Gujarat, NW Maharashtra, C India as well as S Karnataka, and NE Tamil Nadu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, FMNH, USNM

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The genera of birds: comprising their generic characters, a notice of the habits of each genus, and an extensive list of species referred to their several genera
Species.Distribution: Historically along the Himalayan terai from Uttarakhand till Assam but now confined to parts of Himalayan foothills of Himachal, Uttarakhand, Assam as well as adjoining Arunachal foothills.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, FMNH

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: My scrapbook: or rough notes on Indian oology and ornithology
Species.Distribution: Himalaya from Ladakh and Kashmir till Arunachal. Winter: NE India, Rajasthan, Gujarat and C India, and sparingly further south.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Hablizl
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Neue Nordische Beyträge

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: My scrapbook: or rough notes on Indian oology and ornithology
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout N peninsula from Kashmir, through Himachal, Uttarakhand, and Uttar Pradesh terai; NW India including Rajasthan and Gujarat; C India and Assam plains; sporadic in Maharashtra, Telangana and further south and east.
Subspecies.Notes: Breeding in Kashmir not validated (Naoroji 2006) despite acceptance in AR2001 and RA2012. Some are birds known to over-summer in N and NW India.

Genus.Name: Spilornis
Genus.Author: Gray
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Richmond
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Species.Distribution: S Nicobar group of Is (Great Nicobar, Little Nicobar, Menchal, and Pulo Milo).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Jammu south through the Himalayan ranges and Indo-Gangetic plains east through N Bengal, Sikkim into Assam, Arunachal, and NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: 25°N latitude set as a southern demarcation line for this subspecies (AR2001).

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _albidus_ Temminck 1820 from Pondicherry [=Puducherry], and _minor_ Hume 1873 from Raipoor [=Raipur].
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat, C Indian highlands, W Bengal and hills of peninsular India including W Ghats, E Ghats, and hillocks of Deccan.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Specimens in the S Nicobar Island group, previously reported as _S c. malayensis_, may relate to an undescribed subspecies (RA2012) – but is closest to this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman apart from islets of Interview, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Alexandra, Boat, Jolly Buoy, and Rutland Is. Disjunctly in the S Nicobar group (Great Nicobar Is., Kondul, Menchal, Pilo Milo Is.).

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Teressa, Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal Is. in the C Nicobar group.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: N, Middle and S Andaman Is. including islets of Interview, Outram, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Alexandra, Boat, and Rutland Is. as well as Little Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, ROM

Genus.Name: Circaetus
Genus.Author: Vieillot
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir south through till the southern tip of the peninsular except SW coast. Also, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and sporadically elsewhere in NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: In winter, an influx of migrants from elsewhere noted.

Genus.Name: Nisaetus
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Legge
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Taxonomy: Despite Gjershaug _et al._ (2008) arguing for a species status, some taxonomies do not follow it.
Species.Distribution: W Ghats south of SW Maharashtra till the southern tip of Ghats in Kalakkad (Tamil Nadu) and Neyyar (Kerala); east till Biligirirangans (S Karnataka) as well as Palani hills (Tamil Nadu).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and NE hill states; sporadically wintering till C India.

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Subspecies.Distribution: Peninsular India – Gujarat, E Rajasthan, C Indian highlands, Chota Nagpur plateau, NE and SE Ghats, Deccan hillocks, W Ghats from Surat Dangs south till Kanyakumari district (Tamil Nadu).

Subspecies.Author: Horsfield
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Formerly considered a separate species (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills and terai from Himachal, east through Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, W Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and NE hill states.

Subspecies.Author: Tytler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is, as well as Narcondam, Havelok, Neil, Boat, and Rutland Is.

Genus.Name: Lophotriorchis
Genus.Author: Sharpe
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , The fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Birds. 1st ed.

Subspecies.Author: de Sparre
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Magasin de Zoologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states. Disjunctly in EC Indian hills and NE Ghats, and a third disjunct population along the W Ghats from about Mumbai south till Kanyakumari district and extending east into SE Ghats till about Sirumalai, Servarayan hills and the hills of mid-Kaveri basin and sparingly till Tirumala hills.

Genus.Name: Ictinaetus
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: S Indian birds (not named) smaller than N Indian birds.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Jammu through Himachal, Uttarakhand, sporadically in the terai region of N India, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all the NE hill states. Hills of peninsular India from E Rajasthan, S Gujarat, C Indian highlands, NE Ghats, W Ghats from Surat Dangs till its southern tip, SE and CE Ghats, as well as Deccan hillocks.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, TNHM

Genus.Name: Clanga
Genus.Author: Adamowicz
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Revue et Magasin de Zoologie Pure et Appliquée

Species.Author: Lesson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Voyage aux Indes Orientales par le Nord de l'Europe, les provinces du Caucase, la Géorgie, l'Arménie et la Perse (etc.). Zoologie
Species.Distribution: Throughout India south of Jammu & Kashmir but patchily distributed with noticeable large gaps of absence in NC India and much of Odisha.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, LKO

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India except in extreme NE in the states of Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram as well as trans Himalaya.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, LKO

Genus.Name: Hieraaetus
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Classification der Säugethiere und Vögel

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Summer: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Winter: Throughout the Indian peninsula and NE India. Straggler to Narcondam Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Aquila
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalayan foothills from Kashmir, through Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, along the Indo-Gangetic plains till Bihar; Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India, peninsular India through Deccan, and S Tamil Nadu. Rare in E India. Absent along the western coastal zone and W Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Exceptionally migrates to C Asia as evident from satellite tracking from Gujarat (Ram _et al._ 2022).

Subspecies.Author: Cabanis
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: NW India.
Subspecies.Notes: A poorly differentiated subspecies (see Clark 2005) but may occur in NW India during migration (see RA2012).

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The correct spelling of the protonym genus is _Circæëtus_ and not _Circaëtus_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, and the entire northern peninsula from Gujarat till W Bengal and Assam. Also, in Arunachal, Meghalaya, Manipur valley, and Tripura. Further south through S Deccan; sporadically in W coast.

Species.Author: de Savigny
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1
Species.Distribution: Winter: W Himalaya excluding trans-Himalaya, entire NW India reaching W Madhya Pradesh and NW Maharashtra, N Bengal and Brahmaputra plains – straggling to rest of C India, E India and further south.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveaux Mémoires de la Société Impériale des Naturalistes de Moscou
Subspecies.Taxonomy: _A. c. daphanea_ Severtsov 1888 supersedes _A. intermedia_ Severtzov, 1872. Includes _hodgsoni_ Ticehurst, 1931 of Ri1961.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu through Himachal, Uttarakhand, and rarely in the adjoining plains of Haryana in winter. Also, Sikkim and Arunachal. Stragglers reported in winter from E Gujarat and Thar (W Rajasthan).

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Mémoires de la Société Linnéenne de Paris
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the peninsula from Kashmir, south till Kanyakumari and east till Sikkim/N Bengal, Sporadic in NE and SW India though occurs in Assam, Manipur valley, and Kerala.

Genus.Name: Butastur
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Franklin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Throughout India from Jammu south till the tip of the peninsula; east till S W Bengal and sporadically till W Assam.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Tengnoupal district, Manipur.

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Narcondam Is., C Nicobars (Kamorta Is.), and Great Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Circus
Genus.Author: de Lacépède
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Discours de l'ouverture et de clôture du cours d'histoire naturelle donné dans le Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle, l'an VII de la République, et tableaux méthodiques des mammifères et des oiseaux
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Manuel d'ornithologie, ou Description des genres et des principales espèces d'orseaux

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India from Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kashmir south till the tip of the peninsula and east till extreme E Assam. Also, reported from Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, TNHM

Species.Author: Kaup
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Species.Distribution: Winter. Plains of NE India (mostly Assam, but also adjoining Arunachal as well as Manipur), West Bengal but sparingly further west and south in Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Andhra, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: ZSI

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Species.Distribution: Winter: Along the Himalaya from Ladakh and Kashmir through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim till Arunachal. Adjacent N India in Punjab, Delhi region, Rajasthan straggling to Gujarat. Also, W Bengal, Assam, and NE hill states.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, LKO

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch Russland zur Untersuchung der drey Natur-Reiche
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India except Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir, and NE hill states where it is a straggler.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Pennant
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Zoology
Species.Distribution: Winter: W Bengal, Assam (breeding locally), and entire NE India extending west to Odisha and Chhattisgarh. Sporadically to Andaman Is and southern peninsula as well as straggling to N India till Uttarakhand, Delhi region, Rajasthan, and Gujarat.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: N India from about Delhi region, entire NW India covering Rajasthan and Gujarat, C and S India. Sporadic in E India including Jharkhand, W Bengal, and Odisha.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Accipiter
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Bengal Sporting Magazine
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rufitinctus_ McClelland 1840 from the 'banks of Brahmaputra, Assam'.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalaya of Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal as well as Assam and all NE hill states. Locally in EC India and NE Ghats till about Nallamala hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Auk
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India from SW Maharashtra till the tip in Kanyakumari; east till Nilgiris and Palanis.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports further east of Nilgiris in SE Ghats not evaluated.

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Izvestiya Imperatorskago Obshchestva Lyubitelei Estestvoznaniya, Antropologii i Etnografii
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter Straggler? Known only from specimens from Delhi and Mumbai regions.
Subspecies.Notes: Specimen (#12630, #12645) in BNHS from Mumbai (Abdulali 1969).

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir south through N, C, W, and E India south till Kanyakumari with the exception of SW India. Also, Assam, Arunachal, and NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS
Subspecies.Notes: Migration not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes this subspecies is restricted to Sri Lanka whence Kerala birds are assigned to _dussumieri_.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India, mainly Kerala.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: NE India.
Subspecies.Notes: No definitive specimens but could occur. Birds from NE India (specimens in NHMUK) were historically assigned to this subspecies (AR2001) but challenged by RA2012.

Subspecies.Author: Gurney
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal Is. (all in C Nicobar group).

Species.Author: Severtsov
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported once from Chavakkad (C Kerala).

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Species.Distribution: Winter: Andaman & Nicobar Is. Straggler to the mainland (Mizoram and coastal Andhra).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, USNM

Species.Author: Temminck & Schlegel
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Japonica sive descriptio animalium, quae in itinere per Japoniam, jussu et auspiciis superiorum, qui summum in India Batava imperium tenent, suscepto, annis 1825-1830 collegit, notis, observationibus et adumbrationibus illustravit. Vol. 4. Aves

Subspecies.Author: Stepanyan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornitologiia
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Andaman Is (N, S, Little, and Havelock) as well as Nicobar Is (Kamorta, Nancowry, and Great Nicobar Is.). Straggler to E Arunachal, E Assam, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Regional specimens believed to be this subspecies though several authors consider it a synonym of the nominate (Mees 1981).

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Bengal Sporting Magazine
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _kashmiriensis_ Whistler & Kinnear 1936 of W Himalaya included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Winter straggler to the plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs till S Kerala and east till Biligirirangans and Palanis; locally in C Indian highlights and E Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Mees
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: Middle and S Andaman Is. as well as Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Little known and exact range uncertain (Mees 1981). Specimens previously identified as Nicobar Sparrowhawk from the islands of Great Nicobar and Kamorta (C Nicobars) have been identified as this taxon (see RA2012).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Entire peninsula from Kashmir till S Tamil Nadu, more concentrated on the western half of the peninsula and vagrant to E Andhra, Odisha, S W Bengal, and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: My scrapbook: or rough notes on Indian oology and ornithology
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Non-breeding: In adjacent plains including Assam, all NE hill states.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Menzbier
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Uchenia Zapiski Imperatorskovo Moskovskii Univ. Otdel Estestvennoistoricheskii
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Also, in Nagaland and Manipur. Sporadically winters in the peninsula as south as Pune (Maharashtra) and Mayurbhanj (Odisha).
Subspecies.Notes: Likely breeding in the Himalaya though no breeding records. Records from S India likely misidentifications.

Genus.Name: Milvus
Genus.Author: de Lacépède
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Discours de l'ouverture et de clôture du cours d'histoire naturelle donné dans le Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle, l'an VII de la République, et tableaux méthodiques des mammifères et des oiseaux

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Sight reported only from Ranikhet, Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Notes: No photographs exists; accepted based on written description (Naoroji & D'Silva 1988). This observation is of the nominate subspecies. The only other subspecies, _fasciicauda_ Hartert 1914, is probably now extinct (Garcia-del-Rey. 2011).

Subspecies.Author: Boddaert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Subspecies.Distribution: Kachchh.
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens either from India or Pakistan. Nearest specimens are from Afghanistan (Copenhagen Museum). The species is said to possibly winter in Kachchh (Ali 1945). However, satellite telemetry data from the country, till date, are all for _lineatus_ that breed in central Asia.

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India including Lakshadweep and S Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, TNHM, GMC
Subspecies.Notes: Movements not worked out properly but certainly involve extralimital migrants from other regions like SE Asia.

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Inner and trans Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Winter: Entire N Peninsula from Gujarat in west till W Bengal in the east as well as Assam and NE hill states of Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Tripura. Extending regularly south till about Goa, N Karnataka, and Telangana and locally further south till about Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu).

Genus.Name: Haliastur
Genus.Author: Selby
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the generic and sub-generic types of the class Aves, birds, arranged according to the natural system; with separate lists, distinguishing the various quarters of the globe in which they are to be procured

Subspecies.Author: Boddaert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from about Jammu and Himachal, down south till the tip of the peninsula. East through Brahmaputra plains in Assam and Manipur valley but sporadic in C India. Also, in Lakshadweep and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Haliaeetus
Genus.Author: de Savigny
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Breeding (Winter): Across the Himalayan foothills from Jammu & Kashmir through Himachal and Uttarakhand, N Bengal and Sikkim along the Assam plains, and sparingly in select sites in Rajasthan, Odisha, and Tripura. Historically more widespread in N India till Gujarat, Bihar and Madhya Pradesh, and in NE India as well.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes considered monotypic.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Restricted to the N subcontinent from Kashmir through Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains, Rajasthan, and Gujarat till about NW Maharashtra. Stragglers elsewhere.

Genus.Name: Icthyophaga
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: L'Écho du Monde Savant

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Entire E coast as well as W coast from Mumbai south till Mahe including certain nearby off-shore islands as well as Andaman, Narcondam, and Nicobar Is. Stragglers elsewhere including far inland.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ROM

Species.Author: Müller & Schlegel
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Verhandelingen over de natuurlijke geschiedenis der Nederlandsche overzeesche bezittingen, Zoologie

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: S Indian population, discovered in this century, not sampled taxonomically.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the base of Himalaya from E Himachal, Uttarakhand to the Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal. Disjunctly in SW India – in the W Ghats south of Goa and SE Ghats in Kaveri basin. Winter stragglers elsewhere in the subcontinent and NE India.

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Species.Distribution: Terai region in Uttarakhand, W Bengal, Assam plains and adjoining Arunachal and Nagaland, C India, W Ghats from SW Maharashtra till C Kerala and SE Ghats of Karnataka along Kaveri.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM

Genus.Name: Buteo
Genus.Author: de Lacépède
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Discours de l'ouverture et de clôture du cours d'histoire naturelle donné dans le Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle, l'an VII de la République, et tableaux méthodiques des mammifères et des oiseaux

Subspecies.Author: Pontoppidan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Den Danske Atlas eller Konge-Riget Dannemark (etc.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Leh, Ladakh.
Subspecies.Notes: Assumed the nominate subspecies on range for this observation (Choldan 2021).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Eurasian Buzzard, Steppe Buzzard/Desert Buzzard _B. [b.] vulpinus_
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Gloger
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Das Abändern der Vögel durch Einfluß des Klima's: nach zoologischen, zunächst von den europäischen Landvögeln entnommenen Beobachtungen dargestellt, mit den entsprechenden Erfahrungen bei den europäischen Säugthieren verglichen, und durch Thatsachen aus dem Gebiete der Physiologie, der Physik und der physischen Geographie erläutert
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Ladakh, Kashmir, and east along W Himalaya and also further in N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states. NW India of Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, and NW Maharashtra as well as the Satpura ranges; further south, along the W Ghats and SE Ghats with many sporadic sightings in the rest of peninsular India.
Subspecies.Notes: Breeding reports in Kashmir not validated. Identification compounded with both Himalayan Buzzard _B. refectus_ in the Himalaya and Eastern Buzzard _B. [japonicus] burmanicus_ in NE India.

Species.Author: Portenko
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Species.Taxonomy: Resident form (_refectus_) and migrant form from Manchuria (known as _burmanicus_), though nearly inseparable, sometimes treated as different taxa. Alternate treatments where the migrants are treated as a subspecies of _japonicus_ also exists. Includes here _plumipes_ Hodgson 1836, considered a dark morph of the present species.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh and Kashmir through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal; as well as Assam and NE hill states in winter. Straggler to the northern plains and peninsular India.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ

Subspecies.Author: Cretzschmar
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Atlas zu der Reise im nördlichen Afrika von Eduard Rüppell. Erste Abtheilung. Zoologie. Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout the subcontinent from Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kashmir; south through the southern peninsula, where sporadic, at least till about Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu) and Bengaluru (Karnataka). East through Brahmaputra plains of Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and Manipur valley apart from Andaman and Narcondam Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM
Subspecies.Notes: Breeding reports from Kashmir, Himachal and Garhwal (AR2001) not evaluated.

Species.Author: Temminck & Schlegel
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Japonica sive descriptio animalium, quae in itinere per Japoniam, jussu et auspiciis superiorum, qui summum in India Batava imperium tenent, suscepto, annis 1825-1830 collegit, notis, observationibus et adumbrationibus illustravit. Vol. 4. Aves
Species.Distribution: Summer: Ladakh (Breeding). Winter: Along the Himalaya from Ladakh, Kashmir, through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, and Sikkim till W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: ZMA

Genus.Name: Tyto
Genus.Author: Billberg
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Synopsis faunae Scandinaviae, complectens animalia Sveciae Norvegiae que hucusque detecta

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, and Manipur valley. Historically, further W in Uttarakhand terai, N Bengal, Meghalaya, in hills of C and E peninsula as well as SW Ghats.
Subspecies.Notes: Little known or possibly in decline due to degradation of grassland habitats.

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annus I Historico-naturalis. Descriptiones avium musei proprii earumque rariorum, quas vidit in vivario Augustiss. Imperatorus, et museo excell. Comitis Francisci Annib. Turriani

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: A single global species _T. alba_ (Scopoli, 1769) no longer tenable and has been split into multiple species of which the 'Eastern' group _T. [alba] javanica_ (Gmelin, 1788) occurs in India. However, some taxonomies (e.g., eBird/Clements) still follow a single global species approach, and hence followed here as well.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India except the high and trans Himalaya and Thar desert. Present in Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal but local elsewhere in NE India. Lakshadweep Is (introduced).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as a subspecies of _T. alba_ (see HBW/BLI).
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman Is. and the islets of East, Thornhill, Paget, Interview, Viper, Ross, and Cinque Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK

Genus.Name: Phodilus
Genus.Author: Geoffroy Saint-Hilaire
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Annales des Sciences Naturelles

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Robinson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim, W through Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur (?), Tripura, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers

Subspecies.Author: Hussain & Reza Khan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats from Goa south till Kalakkad in S Tamil Nadu.

Genus.Name: Otus
Genus.Author: Pennant
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Zoology

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is and the islets of Interview and Havelock.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: My scrapbook: or rough notes on Indian oology and ornithology
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the W Himalaya from about Kashmir through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rupchandi_ Koelz 1952 from Kohima, Nagaland.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal; as well as Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: N Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: Standard references (AR2001, RA2012) do not include India in its range but AR2001 suspects this to be the subspecies found in Gujarat.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _stewarti_ Koelz, 1939.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills from Jammu, Indo-Gangetic plains, NE Rajasthan through Bihar till W Bengal including N Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _lettoides_ Blyth from Coromandel, _malabaricus_ Hume from Coonoor and W Ghats, _griseus_ Jerdon from E Ghats, and _jerdoni_ Walden from W Ghats (see Ticehurst 1922).
Subspecies.Distribution: C India from Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, NE Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, NE Ghats till W Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact demarcation of this with the nominate subspecies and _gangeticus_ not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Pennant
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Zoology
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs, south till the tip of the peninsula. Also, SE Ghats possibly till Nallamala hills and locally in Deccan.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: My scrapbook: or rough notes on Indian oology and ornithology
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya of Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Notes: Vocalisation in AR2001 may refer to _O. b. gangeticus_ Ticehurst 1922.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _manipurensis_ Roonwal & Nath, 1949 from '6 miles' north of Imphal, Manipur and _alboniger_ Koelz, 1952 from Hmuntha, Mizo hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: N and S W Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and NE hill states. Very locally in Chota Nagpur region (Jharkhand), Odisha, and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM

Species.Author: Rasmussen
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Species.Taxonomy: Its presence in Teresa Is. in C Nicobar Is. group may relate to an undescribed taxon.
Species.Distribution: Great Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: E Rajasthan, Gujarat, and Mumbai region.

Subspecies.Author: Loudon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat and Rajasthan.
Subspecies.Notes: Retained here as tentative pending further investigations.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _exiguus_, _obsoletus_ and _semenowi_ recognised by Cramp (1985) are now suspected to be individual variations (RA2012). Both _brucei_ Hume 1872 and _semenowi_ Sarudny & Härms 1902 have been listed for India (H&M4) – but wintering birds likely have a single taxon and _brucei sensu stricto_ has the type locality in Maharashtra. On the status of _exiguus_ Mukherjee 1958 described from a single specimen in the BNHS, see Abdulali (1972).
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India from Gilgit, Ladakh, Delhi region, W Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Maharashtra, and sporadically in SW India from Goa S through Karnataka, Kerala, and adjoining Tamil Nadu.

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.AlternativeNames: Scops Owl; Walden's Scops Owl _O. [s.] modestus_

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _khasienssi_ Koelz 1954 from Mawphlang, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Jammu through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura. Also, in E Rajasthan, C Indian highlands, and E Ghats till Nallamala and Tirumala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs south till Kanyakumari district, SE Ghats till about Melagiri and Servarayan hills.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes the name (erroneously) used to refer to _O. alius_ Rasmussen 1998. The NHMUK type specimen (#1886.2.1.444) of this subspecies is differently plumaged than all other available specimens (NHMUK#1887.11.11.100, ZSI-BS3013) as well as photographs from C Nicobars. RA2012 considers both plumages to belong to this taxon. More investigation desirable to see if they certainly belong to the same taxon or not.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kamorta, Nancowry, Trinket, and Katchal Is. (C Nicobar group).

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman as well as islets of Long, Havelock, and Neil Is.

Genus.Name: Bubo
Genus.Author: Duméril
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Zoologie analytique, ou méthode naturelle de classification des animaux, rendue plus facile à l'aide de tableaux synoptiques
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Zoologie analytique

Species.Author: Franklin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from the outer ranges of Himalaya in Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand though N, C, and W India south to Kanyakumari and east till the W parts of W Bengal. Very local in SW coastal plains.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Though AR2001 lists birds from Gilgit, Kashmir, and Ladakh under _turcomanus_ Eversmann 1835, their footnote in p.273 indicates that treatment to be incorrect.
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal), and also Kashmir.
Subspecies.Notes: Extralimital subspecies _omissus_ Dementiev 1933 or _nikolskii_ Zarudny 1905 may occur as winter vagrants in Gilgit or Kachchh respectively.

Subspecies.Author: Bianchi
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: N Arunachal, N Sikkim (?).
Subspecies.Notes: See Singh (1995), Sangha _et al._ (2007) for reports from N Arunachal; subspecies assumed on range.

Genus.Name: Ketupa
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Neumann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as a synonym of the nominate subspecies (e.g., H&M4, IOC).
Subspecies.Distribution: Sundarbans and lowland Assam (historically).
Subspecies.Notes: Specimen in AMNH (#631424) from Tinsukia district, Assam. See Sharma _et al._ (2015) for breeding details from Sundarbans.

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]

Subspecies.Author: Zarudny
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologisches Jahrbuch
Subspecies.Distribution: NW India.
Subspecies.Notes: No reports of the species from the Thar desert. RA2012 is non-committal and just states 'NW'. No evidence of the occurrence of _semenowi_ in NW India.

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _hardwickii_ Griffith 1829 from Futteghur [=Fatehgarh].
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from about Jammu and lower Himachal through the N subcontinent, except most of Thar and Rann; through C India and hills of peninsular India but very local in Deccan and Coromandel coast; E through Assam and adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Foothills as well as inner Himalaya in Uttarakhand, W and E Arunachal, locally in Assam, Garo and Khasi hills in Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ

Species.Author: Latham
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes included under _Bubo_.

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Foothills of Uttarakhand, terai of Uttar Pradesh, Delhi region, E Rajasthan, Gangetic plains (historically at least), C India till about N Telangana, E through Assam, and historically at least in Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ
Subspecies.Notes: Status further south in E Tamil Nadu (Sugathan _et al._ 1987) unclear.

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes included under _Bubo_.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _pectoralis_ Jerdon 1840; but S Indian population is intermediate between the nominate subspecies and Sri Lankan _blighi_ Legge, 1878.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan ranges from Uttarakhand, E through N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura. Disjunctly in W Ghats south of SW Maharashtra to its southern tip, extending into E Ghats of Melagiri and Servarayan. Locally in Surat Dangs, Mumbai region, C Indian highlands as well as CE and NE Ghats.

Genus.Name: Glaucidium
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalayan foothills from Kashmir east through Himachal and Uttarakhand as well as W Sikkim and adjoining N Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zoologica: scientific contributions of the New York Zoological Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergradation zone with the nominate subspecies on the west and _rufescens_ on the SE not completely worked out. Considerable individual variations reported (Abdulali 1972).
Subspecies.Distribution: E Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, and adjoining Assam.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Meghalaya, adjoining Assam, southeastern parts of N Bengal (?), Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Jungles of Borabhum and Dholbhum, E India)
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan foothills of Himachal, Uttarakhand, through Indo-Gangetic plains till W Bengal, including N Bengal; south through E Rajasthan, W Gujarat, and Surat Dangs; C India, E Ghats reaching the eastern outcrops of W Ghats in the Nilgiris and Palanis as well as W Ghats of Maharashtra. Absent in Deccan, Thar, and coastal plains of E India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India, coasts and hills, from south of Goa till the southern tip of Kerala and Nagarcoil region of Kanyakumari district.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Taenioptynx
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis

Subspecies.Author: Burton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _garoense_ Koelz 1952 from Tura, Garo hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, west through Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Tripura, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Genus.Name: Athene
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with their synonyma and with an indication of the typical species of each genus. 2nd. ed.

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout northern subcontinent from Jammu south till about a latitude passing through Mumbai (fixed for convenience) – also extends east to Assam and adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam, E Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Range restricted by Ripley (1948). Possibly this subspecies is more widespread and occurs in Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _fryi_ Baker 1919 from Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire southern peninsular India, south of the latitude of Mumbai.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annus I Historico-naturalis. Descriptiones avium musei proprii earumque rariorum, quas vidit in vivario Augustiss. Imperatorus, et museo excell. Comitis Francisci Annib. Turriani

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: True _bactriana_ Blyth 1847 does not occur within our limits. Birds in Ladakh intermediate or approaching _ludlowi_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya zone of Ladakh, Spiti (Himachal), Sikkim, N Bengal, and NW Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: See Limparunpatthanakij _et al._ (2014) for the Arunachal report.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Distribution: Historically from NW Maharashtra, S Madhya Pradesh till Bansa (W Chhattisgarh) and Khadial (W Odisha). Now restricted to the C India from about SE Gujarat and NW Maharashtra patchily in the Satpura range till Melghat region (NC Maharashtra and SW Madhya Pradesh). Exceptionally to Mt. Abu region (SW Rajasthan).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ, USNM

Genus.Name: Strix
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Zone of intergradation with the nominate subspecies not worked out.
Subspecies.Distribution: Northern peninsula from Delhi region (exceptionally Punjab), eastern through Bihar and W Bengal, west through E Rajasthan and NE Gujarat, and south till about C India.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Distribution: Kathiawar (Gujarat).

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Revue Zoologique, par la Société Cuvierienne
Subspecies.Distribution: Southern peninsular India from about Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha all the way south till Kerala and Tamil Nadu.

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _connectens_ Koelz 1950 from Amrasti (sic) = Amravati, Bastar, Chhattisgarh.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs all the way till S Tamil Nadu; locally in C Indian highlands, NE Ghats as well as SE Ghats reaching till Bengaluru.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, and all the NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Scully
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Tentatively, this taxon is considered a part of _S. aluco_ group and under _S. nivicolum_ (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit and Kashmir till Kishtwar.
Subspecies.Notes: Not known to occur in S Kashmir and Himachal.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The darker E Himalayan population not ascribed to any subspecies. Includes _obrieni_ Koelz 1954 from Phawngpui [=Blue Mountain], Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya in Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, Arunachal, Nagaland, and Mizoram.

Genus.Name: Asio
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Rong (Ladakh), Gurias (Kashmir). Non-breeding: Northern subcontinent including Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, and Uttarakhand. Rajasthan and Gujarat in the northwest; Sikkim, N Bengal, and Arunachal in the east, and once straggled to Tamil Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Pontoppidan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Den Danske Atlas eller Konge-Riget Dannemark (etc.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India from Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kashmir down south and east through the peninsula as well as Assam plains and adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur in NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Aegolius
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Regional birds reassigned to this subspecies in Cramp _et al._ (1985) though Ri1982 and AR2001 include the regional specimens under _caucasicus_ Buturlin 1907. Originally the regional specimens were described as _juniperi_ Koelz 1954 from Kyelang, Himachal.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit and trans-Himalaya of Lahaul-Spiti in Himachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Three known specimens from Koelz. Specimens in FMNH (#246482) and UMMZ (#143328). See Abhinav _et al._ (2023) for an argument on the missing third specimen (FMNH #230238).

Genus.Name: Ninox
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science

Species.Author: Beavan
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S and Little Andaman Is as well as Havelock Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, USNM

Species.Author: Raffles
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan foothills from about Jammu south through Indo-Gangetic plains extending through Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and Assam north of Brahmaputra. C Indian hills, NE Ghats extending further south, possibility till CE Ghats. Sporadically in E Rajasthan and C Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies intergrades. Mumbai is probably an intermediate zone while specimens of this subspecies have been recorded even from Chennai region.

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Subspecies.Distribution: S India along the W Ghats from about Mumbai through S Deccan and SE Ghats.
Subspecies.Notes: Taxonomic affinity of the Surat Dangs population unclear but may possibly belong to this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar Is. (Trinket, Kamorta, and Katchal).

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised and included under _isolata_ Baker 1926.
Subspecies.Distribution: Great Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _innominata_ Hume 1876 from Cachar.
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam south of the Brahmaputra as well as Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Tripura, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Taxonomy: Type locality given as Kamorta Is. in C Nicobars must be incorrect (RA2012). This is in need of a revision.
Species.Distribution: N, Middle and S Andaman Is. and the islets of Havelock and Neil Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI

Genus.Name: Harpactes
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Zoological Illustrations
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Pennant
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Zoology

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats south of SW Maharashtra till S Tamil Nadu; limited eastward extension towards the spur hills of Nilgiris and Palani hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: Chota Nagpur plateau, NE Ghats, Satpuras, and possibly disjunctly in Surat Dangs south to about Mumbai.
Subspecies.Notes: The W and E population of this subspecies are not connected and may potentially represent independent lineages. Reports from CE Ghats (AR2001) not evaluated.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _hodgsoni_ Gould 1838, which is the name given to the Himalayan population. If that name were to be recognised, only the population in Mizoram and Tripura shall belong to the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand (historical), N Bihar, Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, W Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Mayr
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised and sometimes subsumed under either _hodgsoni_ Gould 1838 of Nepal or the nominate.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam and E Arunachal.

Species.Author: Kinnear
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Species.Distribution: N Bengal and adjoining Sikkim and Arunachal from Eaglenest region in the west till the Upper Noa-Dihing valley in the east as well as in E Nagaland.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Upupa
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies identification is difficult and multiple subspecies can occur in a given locality in winter. The breeding birds of W Himalaya and N India sometimes recognised as _orientalis_ Baker 1921 (new name for _U. indica_ Reichenbach), which is an intermediate form between the nominate subspecies and the _ceylonensis_. Eastern form _saturata_ also included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, and Arunachal. Winter: Entire peninsula at least in N, C, W, and NE India, and possibly straggling to S India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Reichenbach
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Handbuch der speciellen Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Foothills of Himalaya and much of the subcontinent. Non-breeding: Dispersing widely in the subcontinent, reaching Lakshadweep and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon

Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura as well as adjoining parts of Assam.

Species.Taxonomy: The W Ghats _cavatus_ Shaw 1811 and the Himalayan _homrai_ Hodgson 1832 synonymised with the nominate subspecies and hence the species is treated as monotypic.

Disjunctly in W Ghats from roughly south of Bhimashankar and Mumbai till southern tip of the W Ghats in Kanyakumari district (Tamil Nadu) – east till Varusanadu, Palani, and Nilgiri hills.

Stragglers elsewhere in NW and C India.

Possibly a disjunct population in W coastal region and W Ghats from about S Gujarat (historical) and Mumbai south till S Tamil Nadu as well as east to SW Deccan and along the Kaveri in Tamil Nadu.

Straggles inland through most rivers, as well as on forest streams in W Ghats while it occurs in Assam and all NE hill states during passage migration.
