Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _birmanus_ Neumann 1910 included here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Extreme NE India.

Species.Author: Linnaeus

Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: NW India including Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Rajasthan, and Gujarat. Non-breeding: Vastly augmented by migrants through Ladakh, entire NW India, N and W Madhya Pradesh, N and W Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, and Kerala.

Species.Author: Linnaeus

Species.Taxonomy: Follows H&M4 for dating as 1767 (contra 1766). See also Dickinson _et al._ (2011) and Praveen & Jayapal (2023).
Species.Distribution: Summer: W Himalayan foothills from Jammu through Uttarakhand, N, NW, and C India excluding Thar, W Bengal, Assam plains, Manipur valley, Tripura and locally in Deccan and SW India. Winter: Disperses throughout S Peninsula as well as Andaman, Narcondam, and Nicobar Is.

Species.Author: Linnaeus

Species.Distribution: Summer: Kashmir and Ladakh. Winter: Locally in SC India between Bengaluru-Mysuru-Coimbatore-Salem quadrilateral; though passage migrants augment the population in autumn and spring; stragglers in other parts of the peninsula.

Disjunctly (resident) in W Ghats from Mumbai till the southern tip of the peninsula.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Connectivity of different populations and their movements remain unstudied.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Loudon & Tschusi zu Schmidhoffen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologisches Jahrbuch
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir. Non-breeding: Mostly NW subcontinent in Punjab, Delhi region, Rajasthan, and Gujarat on migration but spilling over to Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, and stragglers further south and east. Also, has occurred in Lakshadweep and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Himalayan foothills from about Kashmir further south till about C India and the latitude of Mumbai and east till W Bengal and Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Assam could be of _C affinis_.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Distribution: The peninsula south of the latitude of Mumbai, as well as Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies distribution is rather arbitrary and they intergrade.

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim east through Assam and all NE hill states. Winter: Influx of migrants to S W Bengal. Straggler further west to N Bihar.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Eurystomus
Genus.Author: Vieillot
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Spelling not '_cyanicollis_' as in AR2001. Includes _calonyx_ Sharpe 1890 with Type locality as 'Himalayan terai from Kumaon to Darjeeling and upper Assam'. Sometimes considered a synonym of _oriental sensu stricto_ Linnaeus 1766.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Himachal, Uttarakhand, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports outside the range indicate migration; probably of the E Palearctic population of this subspecies. Situation not studied.

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats from Kodagu (SW Karnataka) till S Kerala. Also, rarely in adjoining Tamil Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Taxonomic status of the Nicobar population unknown.
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as Narcondam Is. and the islets of Inglis, Outram, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Red skin, and Rutland is. Also, in Great Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, ROM, USNM

Genus.Name: Psilopogon
Genus.Author: Müller
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Tijdschrift voor Natuurlijke Geschiedenis en Physiologie

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from about Rangna Fort in Kolhapur (SW Maharashtra) till the southern tip of the W Ghats in Kanyakumari district (Tamil Nadu); east till Nilgiri, Palani, and Varushanad hills and not any further.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Müller
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Des Ritters Carl von Linné ... vollständigen Natursystems Supplements- und Register-Band über alle sechs Theile oder Classen des Thierreichs

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _luteus_ Lesson 1830 from Pondicherry [=Puducherry] and _confusa_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir south till the tip of peninsula and east till E Arunachal and all NE hill states. Absent in trans-Himalaya and driest parts of Thar.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.Taxonomy: Previously lumped along with extralimital _P. duvaucelii_ (Lesson, 1830).

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rubustirostris_ Baker 1896 from N Cachar hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim (?), N Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and all of NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Boddaert
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, and all of the NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Intergradation zone with _clamator_ [syn. _mayri_] not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Mayr
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The subspecies _mayri_ Ripley 1948 described from a single specimen from Mishmi hills. The only difference noted in this being the yellow-tipped nape feathers which was also observed in the field for many birds. However, this is a feature present in several photographs from Arunachal – from Dafla hills in W Arunachal to Namdapha in E Arunachal – including the intervening Mishmi hills from where the type of _mayri_ was described. At least one photograph from Chin hills also seems to have yellow nape feathers. Hence, _mayri_ is considered a synonym of this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Assam and NE Arunachal.

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rana_ Ripley 1950 of W Himalaya which is recognised by AR2001. Also includes _kutru_ Mukhurjee 1952 from Chahala, Similipal, Odisha.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the sub-Himalayan foothills from E Himachal, Uttarakhand, terai region of N Uttar Pradesh and N Bihar, W Bengal, Chota Nagpur plateau of Jharkhand, and N Odisha; further east into Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: W India south of about Mumbai till about C Karnataka; SE and CE Ghats of Telangana, S Andhra, S Karnataka, and N Tamil Nadu. Also, eastern slopes of SW Ghats till about Palakkad gap.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (On the Ganga river between Kolkata and Varanasi, and in the Vindhyan hills between Varanasi and Garha Mandla [=Gurrah Mundela] on the Narmada river)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _kangrae_ Whistler & Kinnear 1934 from Ranital, Kangra, Himachal. Intergradation zone with _inornatus_ fixed arbitrarily as the Godavari river; and the nominate subspecies arbitrarily at Palakkad gap.
Subspecies.Distribution: Northern subcontinent from Jammu south through Indo-Gangetic plains till W Bengal, E Rajasthan, E Gujarat till about Mumbai, C India, NE Ghats of Odisha, and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Subspecies.Distribution: Eastern slopes of SW Ghats south of Palakkad gap and adjoining SE Ghats in Tamil Nadu till the southern tip of the Ghats in Kanyakumari distict.

Species.Author: Boddaert
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton
Species.Distribution: SW India including coasts and W Ghats, all hills of SE Ghats till about Horsley hills, eastern slopes of W Ghats in Karnataka and north till Toranmal (NW Maharashtra) in Satpura ranges.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, adjoining Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rubescens_ Baker 1896 from the 'Highest ranges in the east of the Cachar hills'.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the Himalayan foothills from Kashmir east through Himachal, Uttarakhand, northern parts of Uttar Pradesh, N and E Bihar, W Bengal, SE Jharkhand, N Odisha, Sikkim, and entire NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Indicator
Genus.Author: Stephens
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: General Zoology, or systematic natural history

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _fulvus_ (Ripley 1951) from Nagaland, subsumed under the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and Nagaland.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies validity debated due to lack of adequate specimens (RA2012, IOC). Media from Uttarakhand attributed to this subspecies by range.

Genus.Name: Jynx
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.Taxonomy: Winter specimens impossible to assign to a subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Non-breeding: Throughout the Indian subcontinent from Jammu south till S Deccan and east possibly to Sikkim and W Bengal; reports further south are almost entirely during passage migration.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Loudon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: On range, this subspecies is more likely in India than the nominate subspecies. Ringing studies required.
Subspecies.Distribution: W India.
Subspecies.Notes: Some of the passage migrants through W India must surely involve this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Hesse
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Sporadically in E India (E Bihar) and NE India including Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states (not reported from Nagaland).

Subspecies.Author: Vaurie
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, and Himachal (?). Non-breeding: Presumably subcontinent.
Subspecies.Notes: Winter distribution little known.

Genus.Name: Picumnus
Genus.Author: Temminck
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Burton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _simlaensis_ Ticehurst 1933 of W Himalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _avunculorum_ Hartert 1912 of W Ghats (Type locality: Kotagiri, Nilgiri hills).
Subspecies.Distribution: Disjunctly in three pockets (1) Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura (2) NE Ghats of Odisha, NE Andhra, and adjoining Chhattisgarh (3) NW Ghats south from about WC Maharashtra till S Tamil Nadu as well as outcrops like Biligirirangans.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Intergradation zone not worked out and much variation exists (Abdulali 1974). It also does not make biogeographical sense to consider the population of W Ghats and the Malay peninsula to be under the same subspecies while the Himalayan form is different.

Genus.Name: Sasia
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand (?), N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and Meghalaya. Disjunctly in Satkosia (Odisha).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens (RA2012) or recent sight reports from Uttarakhand. Meghalaya birds from Garo and Khasi hills are included here, but require investigation.

Subspecies.Author: Hesse
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _querulivox_ Baker 1926 from Tripura [=Tipperah] hills and _ferruginea_ Koelz 1952 from Kohima, Naga hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Cachar (?), Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar birds included here tentatively.

Genus.Name: Hemicircus
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: On the natural history and classification of birds

Species.Author: Lesson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Centurie zoologique, ou choix d'animaux rares, nouveaux ou imparfaitement connus (etc.)
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _cordatus_ Jerdon 1840 from Forests of Malabar and in the Wynaad [= Wayanad].
Species.Distribution: Main population is from Surat Dangs, Khandesh to Mumbai region and scarce further south till extreme SW Maharashtra from where continuous distribution till the southern tip of W Ghats in Kanyakumari. Disjunctly in NE Ghats of Odisha, NE Andhra and adjoining Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and W Bengal as well as Cachar and Manipur hills, historically at least.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Yungipicus
Genus.Author: Bonaparte
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ateneo Italiano
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _brunneiceps_ Baker 1926 with type locality as Udaipur-Jodhpur road, near Jelwara [=Kelwara?], Rajasthan.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan foothills from Jammu east through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, Bihar till W Bengal. Also, Gangetic plains (locally), E Rajasthan, adjoining Gujarat, and northern parts of C India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ
Subspecies.Notes: Intergradation zone with _hardwickii_ not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: C India, W Ghats from Surat Dangs till about Kodagu, E Ghats including SE Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Malherbe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Revue et Magasin de Zoologie Pure et Appliquée
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Birds in the eastern outcrops of the W Ghats in S Tamil Nadu likely this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats south of Kodagu till the southern tip including Nilgiris and Palani hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Malherbe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Société d'Histoire Naturelle du Département de la Moselle
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _gigantisculus_ Koelz 1952 from Mawryngkneng, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Nagaland.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Malherbe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Revue et Magasin de Zoologie Pure et Appliquée
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, east through Himachal and Uttarakhand – sparingly further south in the terai.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergradation zone in Cachar and Nagaland. Mizo birds are typotypical.
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Tripura, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Assam reports of _Y. nanus_ may be of this subspecies.

Genus.Name: Leiopicus
Genus.Author: Bonaparte
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ateneo Italiano

Species.Author: Latham
Species.AlternativeNames: Yellow-fronted Pied Woodpecker, Mahratta Woodpecker, Yellow-fronted Woodpecker

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Supplementum indicis ornithologici, sive systematis ornithologiæ
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _aurocristatus_ Tickell 1833 of Chota Nagpur plateau.
Subspecies.Distribution: Surat Dangs. C India, Jharkhand, W Bengal, E Ghats, south through Deccan hillocks, and W Ghats, mostly on the leeward side; locally in W coastal plains and but mostly absent in E coastal plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Biswas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Taxonomy: See Abdulali (1951) who argues the type locality is within the range of the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout northern subcontinent from Jammu through Indo-Gangetic plains till about N Bihar, south till about N Madhya Pradesh, E Rajasthan, and Gujarat.

Genus.Name: Dendrocoptes
Genus.Author: Cabanis & Heine
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Conspectum avium Picinarum

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _brunnifrons_ Vigors in Gould 1831 with type locality as 'Hilly districts of India' = Shimla. Often considered polytypic by recognising _incognitus_ Scully 1879 from Nepal. This might occur in N Bengal or Sikkim adjoining Nepal border.
Species.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir till Uttarakhand.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Dendrocopos
Genus.Author: Koch
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: System der baierischen Zoologie (etc.)
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: Himachal and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Localities in Ladakh and Kashmir remain untraced.

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _sikkimensis_ Ticehurst & Whistler 1924 from Sikkim, _haemorrhous_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur and _henoticus_ Koelz 1954 from Mawryngkneng, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar records not investigated.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir through Jammu, Himachal, adjoining Punjab and Haryana, and Uttarakhand.

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _humei_ Koelz 1954 from Mawryngkneng, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bihar, W Bengal, S and E Jharkhand, NE Ghats of Odisha, and Andhra; east through N Bengal, Sikkim into Assam, Arunachal, and all the NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from CE Ghats not evaluated.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as polytypic and in that case the regional population belongs to the nominate subspecies.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes considered monotypic.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _fumidus_ Ripley 1951 from Mt Japvo [=Japfü], Naga hills and _diatropus_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizo hills.

Subspecies.Author: Baker

Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Kashmir, Jammu, W Himachal.

Subspecies.Author: Jardine & Selby
