Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, and Sikkim. Winter: Throughout India (with the exception of Thar), west till Gujarat, south till Kanyakumari, and east till W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, MYS

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _stevensi_ Baker 1918 from Darjeeling.
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Short distance migrant that spreads to the plains after breeding. Presence of sooty form of Ashy Drongo like _mouhoti_ Walden, 1870 from SE Asia likely in E India; reports not evaluated properly.

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: Middle and S Andaman Is. as well as Havelock and Narcondam Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Not possible to assign every individual to _leucogenis_ or _salangensis_; available specimens from Andaman Is are of this subspecies and hence other sight and photographic reports are tentatively parked here. However, both subspecies could potentially occur there.

Subspecies.Author: Reichenow
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nomenclator Musei Heineani Ornithologici
Subspecies.Distribution: Chizami (Nagaland), Barha RF (Madhya Pradesh), W Bengal (a few times), and Tripura (twice).
Subspecies.Notes: Well-identified records from the mainland are from Nagaland (though the specimen in ZSI could not located) and Madhya Pradesh (see Williams & Yadav 2018). Other reports are parked here but could have been _leucogenis_ as well; though some photographs from W Bengal are very likely of this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Himachal, NW Haryana, S Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Delhi region, E Rajasthan, Gujarat (except Kachchh), Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, W Bengal, Odisha, Telangana, and Andhra; W Ghats from Surat Dangs further south till about Nilgiris; S Karnataka, eastern slopes of SW Ghats, SE Ghats and sporadic in SW coastal plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts
Species.Distribution: Breeding: E Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, Sikkim, N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal. Non-breeding: Spreading also to S W Bengal, N Odisha, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura. Straggling to Madhya Pradesh, NE Andhra, and Narcondam Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Subspecies.Distribution: E Himachal, Uttarakhand, W Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states; extending south through the NE Ghats of Odisha till S Chhattisgarh and NE Andhra; also, further west sporadically through C Indian highlands till Kanha; disjunctly in the W Ghats and coastal midlands from about Mumbai south till Kanyakumari but also in the transition zone in the Deccan Karnataka as well as most of the SE Ghats hillocks reaching Tirumala hills in CE Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, LKO

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bihar, W Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _londae_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Jammu, through Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Haryana, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bihar, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states; extending south to S W Bengal, Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, E Madhya Pradesh, NE Maharashtra, E Ghats of Andhra and Tamil Nadu, N Telangana, and S Karnataka; W Ghats from Surat Dangs, through Mumbai region, Goa, till the southern tip in S Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Movements not mapped but certainly migratory in parts of S India.

Subspecies.Author: Beavan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. including islets of Interview, Long, Outram, Nicholson, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Alexandra, Tarmugli, and Rutland Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM
Subspecies.Notes: Middle Andaman birds parked under this.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N Andamans.
Subspecies.Notes: Restricted to N Andamans and Coco islands while middle Andaman birds are intermediate (Abdulali 1977). The only listed specimen (ZSI#35196) is from Austin Is., Mayabundar, Middle Andamans and hence need reassessment.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bihar, sporadic in Gangetic plains, N Bengal, S Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and adjoining Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: C India from NE Maharashtra and E Madhya Pradesh, through Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, N Telangana, Odisha, NE Andhra till Godavari river; extending further east through S W Bengal, Tripura, Meghalaya, Cachar, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Intergradation zone with _grandis_ not clear; intergrades with the nominate subspecies in NE Ghats.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _malabaricus_ Lathan 1790 from Malabar.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs till the southern tip of the Ghats including the W Coastal plains and midlands as well as the Deccan transition zone in Maharashtra and Karnataka. Also, extends east through SE Ghats and CE Ghats up till Tirumala and Kadapa.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of Interview, Long, Outram, Nicholson, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Alexandra, Tarmugli, Boat, and Rutland Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, ROM, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar group (Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal) and S Nicobar group (Little and Great Nicobar Is.).
Subspecies.Notes: No specimens from Car Nicobar Is. but subspecies is presumably the same.

Genus.Name: Hypothymis
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis

Species.Author: Boddaert
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton

Subspecies.Author: Hartlaub
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Abhandlungen herausgegeben vom Naturwissenschaftlichen Verein zu Bremen
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _sykesi_ Baker 1920 from Deccan, which itself is a new name for _Muscicapa caeruleocephala_ Sykes 1832. Also, includes _similis_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalayan foothills from Jammu (straggler), SE Himachal, adjoining Haryana, Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, sporadic in Gangetic plains, N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, all NE hill states, Jharkhand, S W Bengal, E Rajasthan (sporadic), Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana (locally), W Ghats, E Ghats, Deccan (locally), W coastal plains, and E coastal plains (sporadic).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Includes two populations, a northern migratory one and a resident one in the W Ghats. The latter not diagnostic enough to merit subspecies status. Details of migration not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Beavan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Narcondam, N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of N Reef, Interview, Long, Outram, Inglis, Herny Lawrence, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Alexandra, Tarmugli, Boat, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Author: Oberholser
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Bianchi
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annuaire du Musée Zoologique de l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de St.-Pétersbourg
Subspecies.Taxonomy: S Nicobar group distinct but no subspecies named (RA2012). Includes _calocara_ Oberholser 1911 from Nankauri I. [=Nancowry Is.], C Nicobar group.
Subspecies.Distribution: C Nicobar group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompoka, Trinkar, Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal Is.) and S Nicobar group (Meroe and Great Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Terpsiphone
Genus.Author: Gloger
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Notizen aus dem Gebiete der Natur- und Heilkunde
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported mostly from S Andaman and once in Middle Andaman.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Salomonsen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Sikkim (historically at least), Arunachal. Winter: N Bengal plains (historically at least), Brahmaputra plains of Assam, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Andaman Is. and Great Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Great Nicobar Is. breeding white morph with long tail streamers may be an undescribed subspecies (RA2012). AR2001 included these birds under _nicobarica_ Oates 1890 which clearly is incorrect.

Subspecies.Author: Oates
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Birds. 1st ed.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The type locality is variously documented as "Andaman and Nicobars" or "Nicobars" (AR2001) but I restrict it to Trinkat Is., C Nicobars where the type specimen came from. The taxa do not occur in Andaman group of islands nor in Great Nicobars.
Subspecies.Distribution: C Nicobar group (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompoka, Kamorta, Trinkar, Nancowry, and Katchal Is.).

Subspecies.Author: Swainson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Naturalist's Library
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Gilgit (sporadic), Ladakh (sporadic), Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, adjoining Punjab, and N Haryana. Winter: Spreading to most of the subcontinent reaching west till Gujarat, east till W Bengal, and south till Kerala and Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Gujarat, E Rajasthan, Delhi region, Gangetic plains south of Ganga river, C India, Jharkhand, S W Bengal, NE Ghats of Odisha, Andhra, W Ghats, and Deccan at least till S Karnataka and N Tamil Nadu; sporadic further south in Kerala and S Tamil Nadu. Winter: Spreads further south in the entire subcontinent till the tip of the peninsula.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Lanius
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , The Zoological Journal

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Non-breeding: W Rajasthan, Gujarat (mainly Kachchh) as well as Gilgit and Ladakh.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, MCZ

Species.Author: Schalow
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Species.OriginalPublicationReference: 23. Jahrgang, Vierte Folge, 3. Band, II. Heft, No. 130 p.148-150
Species.Taxonomy: Gujarat birds are mostly intermediate with _L. isabellinus arenarius_ Blyth, 1846 (RA2012) but see Ganpule (2018) on the presence of pure forms in Kachchh. The morph _karelini_ has also been reported.
Species.Distribution: Non-breeding: W Rajasthan, Kachchh, Saurashtra, Delhi region, as well as Gilgit and Ladakh.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, FMNH

Species.Author: Hemprich & Ehrenberg
Species.AlternativeNames: Pale Brown Shrike, Rufous-tailed Shrike (incl. _L. phoenicuroides_)

Subspecies.Author: Hemprich & Ehrenberg
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Symbolae physicae seu icones et descriptiones corporum naturalium novorum aut minus cognitorum quae ex itineribus per Libyam Aegyptum Nubiam Dongolam Syrian Arabiam et Habessianiam publico institutis (etc.)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Previously, birds belonging to _arenarius_ were assigned to _isabellinus_ (see R&A 2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: See Ganpule (2017) for possible birds found in Gujarat.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India from Jammu, Punjab, Haryana, adjoining Himachal, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh, adjoining Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, NW Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Goa, N Karnataka, and NW Telangana; has straggled to S Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala. Also reported on passage from Kashmir, Gilgit, and Ladakh.

Subspecies.Author: Stegmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: One photographed in Gujarat possibly of this subspecies (Ganpule 2017).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Philippine Shrike _L. c. lucionensis_, Japanese Shrike _L. c. superciliosus_

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Delhi region, through Gangetic plains till W Bengal; C India till extreme E Rajasthan and Gujarat; Sikkim and entire NE India as well as entire S India. Also, S Andaman and Great Nicobar Is. at least – probably more widespread there as well.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS

Subspecies.Author: Stegmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies poorly differentiated, intergrading with the nominate subspecies and often considered an intermediate population of the former with _lucionensis_ (H&M4).
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: S India and Andamans at least.
Subspecies.Notes: Very few identified specimens but doubtlessly more widespread than _lucionensis_ as evident from photographs in Macaulay Library. Specimens catalogued as this only in the USNM; from Andhra Pradesh (USNM#391662) and Tamil Nadu (USNM#95714, USNM#99463).

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Supplementum indicis ornithologici, sive systematis ornithologiæ
Subspecies.Distribution: Baghownie (Bihar) and Shyamkhola (W Bengal) – once each.
Subspecies.Notes: W Bengal record identified from photographs (Chatterjee & Sen 2007) while the Bihar specimen by Inglis is termed as 'lost' (RA2012). USNM has two specimens tagged as this subspecies; a 19thC specimen with no details except India (USNM#28517) and another from Biligirirangans, Karnataka (USNM#58700) in 1934 by R Morris. Ali & Whistler (1942), in their account of Mysuru survey, did not cover this species and hence it is worthwhile to investigate the correct identification of both the specimens.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: S India – including S Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala; S W Bengal and Andaman Is – sporadic elsewhere.
Subspecies.Notes: Identification as to this subspecies or _confuscus_ is not always straightforward – records may have been compounded.

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Voyage aux Indes Orientales par le Nord de l'Europe, les provinces du Caucase, la Géorgie, l'Arménie et la Perse (etc.). Zoologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: E Arunachal, E Assam, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Valenciennes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from Kashmir, Ladakh (sporadic), Himachal, south till Kanyakumari district, west till Gujarat and east till Bihar and W Bengal – sporadic or local in W coast and E coast.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, MNHN, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: See AR2001 for re-restricting the type locality from Lucknow to Shimla-Almora district
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Non-breeding: N subcontinent including Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, W Bengal, and south till E Maharashtra (Nagpur) but sporadically till Belagavi (N Karnataka).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _kathiawarensis_ Koelz 1952 from Jamwala, Junagadh.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat (including Kachchh), Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Andhra, and south till Tamil Nadu and Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Local movements not mapped well.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand (sporadic), Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Nagpur (historical, once), W Bengal, Odisha (sporadic), NE Andhra (sporadic), Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh (sporadic), Jharkhand, W Bengal, Odisha (once), Madhya Pradesh (historical, once), Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Exact breeding and non-breeding ranges not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes considered as a hybrid swarm of _tephronotus_ x _erythronotus_ (Whistler & Kinnear 1933).
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Ladakh, Jammu, Himachal, and Punjab.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Cabanis
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit (twice), Kashmir (once), and Ladakh (three times).
Subspecies.Notes: Reidentification of Gilgit specimen by Charles Vaurie as _leucopterus_ Severtsov 1875 has been challenged in AR2001 and is considered this subspecies. However, the specimen (by Scully?) is lost. See Gyalpo _et al._ (2022).

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised and considered a junior synonym of _homeyeri_ (see IOC).
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit.
Subspecies.Notes: Apart from the lone Gilgit specimen that is considered here as _L. e. homeyeri_, there are no other claims documented.

Subspecies.Author: Cassin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Rajasthan, Kachchh, and Delhi region (once).

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from Himachal and Punjab, west till Gujarat, east till W Bengal, and south till S Tamil Nadu – local in most regions except W India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Shey (Ladakh), Ludhiana (Punjab), and Mumbai (Maharashtra).

Species.Author: Lichtenstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Verzeichniss der Doubletten des zoologischen Museums der Königl. Universität zu Berlin nebst Beschreibung vieler bisher unbekannter Arten von Säugethieren, Vögeln, Amphibien und Fischen
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Kaanjan (Gujarat).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Revue et Magasin de Zoologie Pure et Appliquée
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Alibaug (NW Maharashtra).
Subspecies.Notes: Assumed to be of this subspecies. See Nandgaonkar (2013).

Genus.Name: Garrulus
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _azureitinctus_ Koelz 1951 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal (till Walong region), Nagaland, Manipur (W and C), and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Mizoram may also be of _haringtoni_ Rippon 1905 that occurs in Mt. Victoria, Chin hills, Myanmar.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: AR2001 includes it as a synonym of _interstinctus_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Khasi hills (Meghalaya).
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies threatened with no recent reports.

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: E Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: Photographs likely of this subspecies.

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Gilgit (locally), Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Straggler to N Bengal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Urocissa
Genus.Author: Cabanis
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Lakshadweep Is population has been suggested to belong to _maledivicus_ Reichenow 1904 (eBird/Clements); but this has not been validated. They tend to get extinct in some islands only to reappear after sometime (Aju _et al._ 2021); source population of such birds is unknown but probably are ship-assisted from the mainland.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India, south of Himachal, west till Kachchh, east till all NE hill states and south till N Tamil Nadu. Introduced in Andaman & Nicobar Is and Lakshadweep Is (multiple islands including Minicoy Is.).

Subspecies.Author: La Touche
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _lepcharum_ R. & A. Meinertzhagen 1926 from Gangtok, Sikkim. See Paynter (1962) for details. Erstwhile museum specimen assignment might need revision.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The name _nipalensis_ Hodgson 1837 preoccupied and hence revisited (Dickinson 2009).
Subspecies.Distribution: Indo-Gangetic plains from Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, W Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Postilla
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes not recognised and included under _planorum_ [= _nipalensis_] (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Patkai hills and foothills of Mishmi hills in E Assam and E Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: Most of the subcontinent from E Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh, adjoining S Jharkhand, Maharashtra, Andhra (mostly absent in coastal plains), Karnataka (local in Deccan), and Tamil Nadu (mostly absent in coastal plains).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India (mostly Kerala).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Machlolophus
Genus.Author: Cabanis
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: Two disjunct populations (a) NW India from SW Haryana, E Rajasthan, Gujarat (N and W Kachchh regions) (b) Deccan from Davanagere (Karnataka) and Gandikota (Andhra) in the north till Satyamangala and Salem in the south – but mostly concentrated in the SE Ghats around mid-course of the Kaveri river.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.AlternativeNames: Black-lored Tit, Black-lored Yellow Tit; Yellow-cheeked Tit (incl. _M. aplonotus_)
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; also, sporadically around N Bengal, and possibly Sikkim.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.Taxonomy: All taxa under this sometimes treated as a subspecies of _M. xanthogenys_ (HBW/BLI).

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Type specimen lost (Sharpe 1892).
Subspecies.Distribution: E Rajasthan, N and E Gujarat, Surat Dangs, NW Ghats till Mahabaleshwar; C Indian highlands of N and NE Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh; Chota Nagpur plateau in Jharkhand, W Bengal, and NW Odisha; NE Ghats of Odisha and NE Andhra extending till CE Ghats in the Nallamala hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Isolated record in SE Ghats not evaluated but possibly of this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler & Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _xanthonotus_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka. It is unclear on what authority Mynall has been respelt as 'Mynali' in Eck & Martens (2006).
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from SW Maharashtra and Goa, south till the southern tip of the Ghats in Kanyakumari district. – limited eastward extension; absent in Biligirirangans though has been reported from Talamalai (NW Tami Nadu).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _xanthogenys_ Blyth 1847. ZSI register lists the syntypes (ZSI#35570-71) under this name.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and disjunctly in Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Unexpected distribution – where this subspecies wedges between the nominate subspecies population in the north (Arunachal) and south (Mizoram).
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: AR2001 includes Mizoram birds under this subspecies while RA2012 treats them as the nominate subspecies. Reports from Cachar (AR2001) not validated but likely to be correct.

Genus.Name: Remiz
Genus.Author: Jarocki
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Spis ptaków w gabinecie Zoologicznym Królewsko Warszawskiego Uniwersytetu znayduiących się a podług naynowszego systemu ustawionych

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Izvestiya Imperatorskago Obshchestva Lyubitelei Estestvoznaniya, Antropologii i Etnografii
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India – Punjab and Delhi region; as well as W Himachal (Pong), Uttarakhand (Asan Barrage), and Uttar Pradesh (Bijnor).
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies assumed based on photographs and range (Abhinav & Karuthedathu 2020).

Genus.Name: Alaemon
Genus.Author: Keyserling & Blasius
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Die Wirbelthiere Europa's. Erstes Buch: Die unterscheidenden Charactere

Species.Author: Desfontaines
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire de l'Académie Royale des Sciences. Avec les Mémoires de Mathématique & de Physique

Subspecies.Author: Salvadori
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Atti della R[eale] Accademia delle Scienze di Torino
Subspecies.Distribution: E Rajasthan and Kachchh.

Genus.Name: Ammomanes
Genus.Author: Cabanis
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (On the Ganga river between Kolkata and Varanasi, and in the Vindhyan hills between Varanasi and Garha Mandla [=Gurrah Mundela] on the Narmada river)
Subspecies.Distribution: Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, adjoining Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand and adjoining S W Bengal, Chhattisgarh, W Odisha, Maharashtra, Goa, Telangana, N Andhra, and N Deccan Karnataka.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Poorly differentiated subspecies; sometimes not recognised.
Subspecies.Distribution: C and S Deccan Karnataka, S Andhra, Tamil Nadu, and locally in C Kerala.

Species.Author: Lichtenstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Verzeichniss der Doubletten des zoologischen Museums der Königl. Universität zu Berlin nebst Beschreibung vieler bisher unbekannter Arten von Säugethieren, Vögeln, Amphibien und Fischen

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Though Kashmir is considered the type locality of this taxa, it has occurred nowhere close to it yet (except another NHMUK#1887.9.1.2789) and there must be some confusion as to the provenance of the specimen that Blyth used to describe.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Rajasthan (Thar).
Subspecies.Notes: Birds found in Thar desert (after Sangha 2002) assumed to be this subspecies.

Genus.Name: Eremopterix
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Das Thierreich in seinen Hauptformen systematisch beschrieben
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Bulletin de l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de St.-Pétersbourg

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The zoology of the voyage of H.M.S. Beagle, under the command of Captain FitzRoy, R.N., during the years 1832 to 1836

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised and treated as a junior synonym of extralimital subspecies _melanauchen_ Cabanis, 1851.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Rajasthan, Kachchh (sporadic), and once straggled to Delhi region (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Punjab and Haryana in AR2001 not verified.

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _siccata_ Ticehurst 1925 from Deesa, Gujarat.
Species.Distribution: Throughout India from Jammu, Himachal and Punjab south till the southern tip of peninsula; west till Gujarat and east till W Bengal; sporadic in W coastal plains.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Genus.Name: Mirafra
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as distinct from _M. javanica_ as _M. cantillans_ (see IOC). Includes _bangsi_ Koelz 1939 from Hosepete, N Karnataka.
Subspecies.Distribution: Locally in W India from SW Kashmir (historical), Punjab (once), Delhi region, Rajasthan, W Gujarat, N Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh (Bhedaghat, historical), SE Andhra, N Karnataka (Hubballi & Hosapete region, historical), S Karnataka (Mysuru region) till N and C Tamil Nadu.

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Along the Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains from Jammu, Punjab, through S Uttarakhand, Haryana, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh, N Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Odisha, Assam, E Arunachal; as well as all NE hill states.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Sympatric with Bengal Bushlark in W Bengal with no signs of intergradation.
Species.Distribution: W Bengal, Jharkhand, Odisha, S Chhattisgarh, E Maharashtra (Nagpur region), Telangana, Karnataka (except N), Andhra, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _sindiana_ Ticehurst 1920 that occurs in W Punjab, W Rajasthan, and Kachchh (RA2012) as well as _furva_ Koelz 1951 from Sihor, Kathiawar. The type specimen by Jerdon is listed from the southern part of the Indian Peninsula which was interpreted as Carnatic region (SE coastal plains) by Sharpe. Jerdon listed his specimens as _M. javanica_ and Blyth quoted Jerdon's descriptions while describing this species. Apart from the listed type from NHMUK, three syntypes (ZSI#35359-61) are listed in ZSI register from Ramanathapuram, Tamil Nadu; which is in the Carnatic region. Currently, the species is very local in Carnatic. Investigation required as to why the type locality has been specified as the northern part of the Peninsula; which AR2001 revised as 'Northern Deccan'.
Species.Distribution: Throughout the Indian subcontinent from Jammu, south through Delhi, west to Gujarat and east to W Bengal and W Odisha; south till SE Andhra and SC Karnataka; locally in Tamil Nadu. Absent from W coastal and E coastal plains as well as W and E Ghats.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, HYD

Genus.Name: Eremophila
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Ghorbani _et al._ (2018) includes this subspecies under the 'Mountain Horned Lark' clade (or Black-necklaced) _E penicillata_; separate from the 'Himalayan Horned Lark' (or Tibetan) clade _E longirostris_ where the other two (_elwesi_ and _argalea_) are also included. There is consistent support for this split (e.g. Alström _et al._ 2023) and hence is a likely revision for the future.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit.
Subspecies.Notes: A single report from Delhi could have been this subspecies – has straggled once to Rawalpindi (AR2001).

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _deosai_ R. & A. Meinertzhagen 1926 from Deosai plateau in Baltistan following Vaurie (1951). Another new subspecies _deosaiensis_ Khan 1999, also described from Deosai plateau, has not been accepted by any authority. Ghorbani _et al._ (2018) suggests to treat _deosaiensis_ as a synonym of this subspecies, as Vaurie had already examined other specimens from the same site. This population, however, has not been genetically sampled by any studies but purportedly belongs to the same clade as _elwesi_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Baltistan, Zanskar, Rupshu, Lahaul-Spiti, and Rohtang pass.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Uttarakhand sight records may pertain to this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Oberholser
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Poorly differentiated form and doubtfully separable from _elwesi_ (see Whistler 1932 for a full treatment)
Subspecies.Distribution: N Ladakh beyond Murgo and Aksai Chin.
Subspecies.Notes: Intergrades with _longirostris_ between Saser La till Murgo (see Whistler 1932); hence the Indian territory past Murgo till the official border belongs to the range of this subspecies. Specimens examined by Whistler could not be located but probably are in the NHMUK. Notably, Vaurie (1951) did not analyse the specimens from the range of this subspecies as he did not have any specimens.

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _longirostris_ in C & E Ladakh along the Indus valley from Leh till Tso Kar (see Vaurie 1951).
Subspecies.Distribution: E Ladakh (Pangong Tso and Chushul region), N Sikkim, NW Arunachal – straggling to S Sikkim and Assam (once).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Calandrella
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Leisler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annalen der Wetterauischen Gesellschaft für die gesammte Naturkunde

Subspecies.Author: Eversmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Société Impériale des Naturalistes de Moscou
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _orientalis_ Sushkin 1925 listed presumptively for S Asia as its winter range in IOC. Not recognised in eBird/Clements, and perhaps may not be a distinct subspecies. Strevander _et al._ (2016) did not sample that population to understand its true affinities.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Punjab, Himachal, Haryana, Delhi region, W Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, N Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, and N Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from E and S India are likely misidentifications of Mongolian Short-toed Lark.

Species.Author: Sykes
Species.AlternativeNames: Eastern Short-toed Lark, Sykes's Short-toed Lark
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Winter: S peninsula from Maharashtra, SE Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and S W Bengal – till the southern tip of the peninsula; sporadic or possibly in migration from N India including Ladakh, Himachal, Punjab, Delhi region, Bihar, Sikkim as well as Assam and Arunachal. Also reported from Andaman Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Lahore to Yārkand (etc.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Gilgit, Kashmir, and Ladakh. Winter: Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, and N Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Ladakh, and N Sikkim (historical). Winter: Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, S W Bengal, S Sikkim, N Bengal and sporadic further east in Assam and Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Melanocorypha
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Ménétries
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue raisonné des objets de zoologie recueillis dans un voyage au Caucase et jusqu'aux frontières actuelles de la Perse
Species.Distribution: Winter: E Himachal (Pong), Punjab, Uttarakhand (locally), Delhi region, S Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat; sporadically Gilgit (passage, historically at least), N Maharashtra (once), and Goa (once).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _holdereri_ Reichenow 1911, which is the subspecies assigned for birds in E Ladakh.
Species.Distribution: Ladakh, N Sikkim.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH

Genus.Name: Alaudala

Species.Author: Homeyer
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Species.OriginalPublicationReference: 21. Jahrgang, Vierte Folge, 1. Band, III. Heft, No. 123 p.197

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Sirsa (Haryana) and Gilgit.
Subspecies.Notes: Records of definitive _persica_, which is the regionally occurring form of _heinei_, are only based on two historical specimens examined in the past by competent taxonomists. However, those specimens remain to be located and are not present in NHMUK.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _vauriei_ Koelz 1954 from Palasbari, Assam.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Indo-Gangetic plains from Punjab, till W Bengal; extending to Brahmaputra plains through Assam and E Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _krishnakumarsinji_ Vaurie & Dharmakumarsinhji 1954 from Bhavnagar (Ganpule & Alström, 2022).
Subspecies.Distribution: Jammu, Punjab, Himachal, E Rajasthan (?), and Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: Photographs from Rajasthan not assessed to subspecies level – but this taxon expected there.

Genus.Name: Alauda
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Illustrations of British ornithology

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Punjab, Haryana, Uttarakhand (sporadic), Delhi region, N Uttar Pradesh (sporadic), and NW Rajasthan.

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Izvestiya Imperatorskago Obshchestva Lyubitelei Estestvoznaniya, Antropologii i Etnografii
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _punjaubi_ Whistler 1936 described from Firozpur, Punjab on the Sutlej river. Includes also _dharmakumarsinhjii_ Abdulali 1976 from Bhavnagar, Gujarat; which is sometimes recognised as a subspecies (see IOC).
Subspecies.Distribution: Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat, and Uttar Pradesh till about C Bihar.

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen & Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _guttata_ Brooks 1872 from Kashmir.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal), and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised and subsumed under the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Coastal and midland Kerala as well as SW Ghats including outcrops like Nilgiri and Palani hills in W Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Bianchi
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annuaire du Musée Zoologique de l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de St.-Pétersbourg
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: N Sikkim. Non-breeding: N Bengal, S Sikkim, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and E Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Wintering population in NE hill states believed to be this subspecies; however, _vernayi_ is also possible.

Subspecies.Author: Mayr
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Likely in winter in NE India. Situation not investigated.

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Assam, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Telangana, Karnataka, and Andhra down till E and C Tamil Nadu.

Genus.Name: Galerida

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
