Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: As per eBird/Clements taxonomy, these records could be of _iwanowi_ Loudon & Zarudny, 1903 which is treated here as a junior synonym of the present subspecies. See Abdulali (1975) for the details of the specimens (BNHS#9287,#18341) in the BNHS.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit (once) and Delhi (once) – both historically.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit (historical).

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, S Himachal, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar (historical), N Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat; has straggled to E Maharashtra (once).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Species.Taxonomy: Suggested to be treated as conspecific with _G. cristata_ (Alström _et al._ 2023). Includes _propinqua_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka.
Species.Distribution: W edge of the peninsula from S Gujarat through Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, and W Tamil Nadu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, TNHM, MYS, LKO

Species.Author: Sykes
Species.AlternativeNames: Tawny Lark, Deccan Crested Lark, Sykes's Crested Lark
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: W India from Gujarat, E Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Telangana, Deccan Karnataka till Mysuru and Bengaluru region; local in E Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh (around Raipur), N Tamil Nadu (around Coimbatore, Satyamangala, and Tiruvannamalai); straggler to Kerala coast.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Orthotomus
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Pennant
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Zoology

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _londae_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Jammu, south through Indo-Gangetic plains till Uttar Pradesh and W Bihar, east through E Rajasthan and Gujarat, C India, and S peninsula till the southern tip in Kanyakumari.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Uttar Pradesh, N Bihar, W Bengal, Assam, Meghalaya, and Cachar; also extending through Odisha to NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Arunachal (Mishmi hills and further east), Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _latebricola_ Koelz 1954 from Dimapur, Nagaland.
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Sikkim, N Bengal reports not verified.

Genus.Name: Prinia
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.AlternativeNames: Brown Hill Warbler, Striated Prinia (incl. _P. striata_)
Species.Taxonomy: As previously considered, _catharia_ Reichenow 1908 is no longer considered a form found in India. See Alström _et al._ 2019 for further details on taxonomy and distribution.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, W and WC Arunachal, and adjoining Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _assamica_ Baker 1924 from Shillong and _nebulosa_ Koelz 1952 from Cherrapunji. However, the former may be a valid taxon, restricted to Meghalaya, with the latter as its junior synonym.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Arunachal (Walong region), E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Moore
Species.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal till about Mishmi hills.
Species.Specimens: AMNH, MCZ, USNM, LKO

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Species.Taxonomy: Formerly considered a subspecies of _P. atrogularis_ (see H&M4). Presence of this or _atrogularis_ in Walong and Namdapha regions not established.
Species.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Anderson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Arunachal in Walong, Namdapha till Vijoynagar as well as E Naga hills (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: An old specimen (NHMUK#1895.7.14.1570) by Godwin-Austen from 'E Naga hills' was considered the first evidence of its presence within India.

Species.Author: Moore
Species.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Species.Distribution: Kumaon and Dehradun regions (Uttarakhand) and Solan district (Himachal). Straggles to Chandigarh (Sukhna). Historically in Garhwal region (Uttarakhand), N Bengal, almost reaching Assam.
Species.Specimens: AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _cleghorniae_ Blyth 1867 from northwest of Delhi. ZSI#35497-98 also listed as Jerdon's Syntypes from the same type locality.
Species.Distribution: Western half of the subcontinent – from Jammu in the north through N India, east till Bihar, entire Rajasthan and Gujarat, south through WC India and Deccan till Tumakuru (Karnataka) and Chittoor (Andhra) districts avoiding entire W and E coastal plains and the ghats.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _austeni_ Baker 1924 of Naga hills and _assamensis_ Baker 1924 _Nomen nudum_.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Disjunctly, at least historically, in Odisha (Similipal) and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Franklin's Wren Warbler, Ashy-grey Wren Warbler

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Prinia gracilis_ Franklin 1831 of Mirzapur district. Includes _pallidior_ Koelz 1950 from Kathiawar.
Subspecies.Distribution: From Indo-Gangetic plains in Punjab, through Haryana, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and S W Bengal; E through E Rajasthan and Gujarat; C India including Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh as well as Maharashtra, Goa, N Karnataka, and Telangana.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, along the NE Ghats in Andhra till SE Odisha.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Streaked Wren Warbler, Graceful Prinia (incl. _P. gracilis_)
Species.Taxonomy: All taxa under this sometimes continues to be treated as a subspecies of extralimital _P. gracilis_ Lichtenstein, 1823 (HBW/BLI).

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N India from Jammu south through Indo-Gangetic plains and terai till about Bihar in the east; N Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan (including Thar) and Gujarat.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal and the Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining E Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: W Rajasthan, Gujarat.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Indo-Gangetic plains from Jammu, Punjab, adjoining Himachal, Uttarakhand, Delhi region, N Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar till W Bengal.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Ghats of Odisha and presumably adjoining Andhra.

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _palniensis_ Koelz 1939 from Kodaikanal, Palani hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, and entire S India except SW coastal strip of Karnataka and Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Indus plains of Kashmir, Jammu, Punjab, adjoining Himachal, and Haryana.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact boundaries of subspecies are conjectural.

Subspecies.Author: Delessert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Revue Zoologique, par la Société Cuvierienne
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _Prinia flaviventris flaviventris_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gangetic plains from Delhi region, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, S W Bengal, NE Odisha, N Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N India from Kashmir and Jammu, south through entire Indo-Gangetic plains and E Rajasthan, Gujarat (excluding Kachchh), C India including N Maharashtra, east till Bihar, Jharkhand, and NW Odisha.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal, Assam.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Meghalaya, Manipur (both in AR2001) and Cachar not verified.

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: S Peninsula from W Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, and C Odisha till the southern tip of the peninsula at Kanyakumari.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nests and eggs of Indian birds: rough draft
Subspecies.Distribution: Indus plains of Kashmir, Jammu, Punjab, and adjoining Himachal; Uttarakhand, Haryana, Delhi region, N Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat (except S).

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, S Gujarat, Maharashtra, Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, and south till the tip of the peninsula (excluding SW).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _macroura_ 'Franklin' = Jerdon 1840.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India from SW Karnataka, Kerala, and adjoining Ghats in Tamil Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.

Genus.Name: Cisticola
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Rafinesque
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Caratteri di alcuni nuovi generi e nuove specie di animali e piante della Sicila con varie osservazioni sopra i medesimi

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _malaya_ in Manipur (AR2001).
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the peninsula from Kashmir, south till Karnataka and Tamil Nadu; west till Rajasthan and Gujarat except the driest portions of Thar; east till Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: Kerala, Tamil Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Lynes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: C Nicobar Is. (Teresa, Kamorta, Nancowry, Trinket, and Katchal) and historically also from Car Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Great Nicobar Is. report not verified.

Species.Author: Vigors & Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Subspecies.Distribution: Kumaon terai (Uttarakhand), N Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur valley.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: CW Ghats from about Bababudan Hills, Karnataka till Vellarimala in Wayanad, Kerala.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports further south of Wayanad in Nilgiris, Palani hills, east in Biligirirangan hills, and north in Ahmednagar (Maharashtra), Balaghat and Sagar (both Madhya Pradesh) not validated. Interestingly, its type locality is Nilgiris where it is no longer found.

Genus.Name: Arundinax
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Jharkhand, W Bengal, Assam, Arunachal and all NE hill states as well as W Maharashtra, SW India roughly south of Goa, E Ghats, S Deccan, and sporadically everywhere else including N peninsula, Gujarat, and C India.

Subspecies.Author: Stegmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Poorly defined subspecies (Kennerley & Pearson 2010) and hence not always recognised.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Assam, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: See AR2001, RA2012 where the possibility of its occurrence is discussed though impossible to defintively ascribe a subspecies status.

Genus.Name: Iduna
Genus.Author: Keyserling & Blasius
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Die Wirbelthiere Europa's. Erstes Buch: Die unterscheidenden Charactere

Species.Author: Lichtenstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise von Orenburg nach Buchara
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughtout Peninsular India from Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and W Bengal, south till Kanyakumari. Sporadically in Indo-Gangetic plains, Rajasthan but more regular during passage migration.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, MYS

Species.Author: Sykes
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India from about Delhi region, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, W Bengal, and entire southern peninsula; during migration across the northern peninsula.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, HYD

Genus.Name: Acrocephalus
Genus.Author: Naumann & Naumann
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Naturgeschichte der Land- und Wasser-Vögel des nördlichen Deutschlands und angränzender Länder, nach eignen Erfahrungen entworfen, und nach dem Leben gezeichnet
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Winter: S W Bengal, Assam, Manipur valley, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Stragglers in Ladakh and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: ZSI

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Madarász
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Vorläufiges über einen neuen Rohrsänger (Lusciniola mimica)
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India in the Indo-Gangetic plains from Jammu, through Punjab, adjoining Himachal, Haryana, Delhi region, N and C Uttar Pradesh, Bihar (Saran), Madhya Pradesh (Sehore), adjoining Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Gujarat, and NW Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Notes: Bihar record in AR2001 untraced.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Shey (Ladakh) and N Kerala.

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Taxonomy: Subspecies _capistratus_ (Severtsov, 1873) included under this. Recent findings (Hering _et al._ 2015) indicate that the species is monotypic.
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India from Kashmir and Ladakh, south through Delhi region till about Gwalior, west through Rajasthan (including Thar) and Gujarat, south till S Kerala, and east through Brahmaputra plains of Assam and Arunachal, and all NE hill states (not reported from Nagaland).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.AlternativeNames: Blunt-winged Paddyfield Warbler, Blunt-winged Reed Warbler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as monotypic.

Subspecies.Author: Witherby
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _hokrae_ Whistler 1930 from Hokra jheel, Kashmir.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit and Kashmir. Non-breeding: Unknown.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Assam valley. Non-breeding: Extending to N Bengal, Meghalaya, Manipur as well as straggling to S W Bengal and Odisha.
Subspecies.Notes: Records from SW Bengal and Odisha are tentatively assigned to this subspecies.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Winter: Entire peninsula from N India from Kashmir till the southern tip in Kanyakumari; sporadically in W Rajasthan and Kachchh but abundant during migration. Also, NE India in Assam, adjoining Arunachal and all NE hill states. Also reported from Lakshadweep Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Oberholser
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Species.Taxonomy: New name for _macrorhynchus_ Hume 1971 from a site 'not far from Rampoor [=Rampur]', Mussoorie, Uttarakhand.
Species.Distribution: Non-breeding: Kolkata, Gujarat; historically from Gilgit, Shimla, Bhadwar (both Himachal) and Mussoorie (Uttarakhand) – all during passage migration.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Non-breeding: Ladakh and S W Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: Ringing records presumably of this subspecies (Delany _et al._ 2013). Details of S W Bengal ringing record remains unpublished but the details at the ringing site recorded as to this species.

Species.Author: Temminck & Schlegel
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Japonica sive descriptio animalium, quae in itinere per Japoniam, jussu et auspiciis superiorum, qui summum in India Batava imperium tenent, suscepto, annis 1825-1830 collegit, notis, observationibus et adumbrationibus illustravit. Vol. 4. Aves
Species.Distribution: Winter: S W Bengal, Assam, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, USNM

Species.Author: Hemprich & Ehrenberg
Species.AlternativeNames: Indian Reed Warbler / Indian Great Reed Warbler _A. [s.] brunnescens_
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Symbolae physicae seu icones et descriptiones corporum naturalium novorum aut minus cognitorum quae ex itineribus per Libyam Aegyptum Nubiam Dongolam Syrian Arabiam et Habessianiam publico institutis (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: N subcontinent from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, south till about C India, and east till W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Exact boundaries of the subspecies not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Brahmaputra valley in Assam and adjoining Arunachal. Also, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura. Winter: Extending to Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Nicobar reports not evaluated but probably correct.

Subspecies.Author: Legge
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: RA2012 includes S India breeding birds also in this subspecies while AR2001 restricts it to Sri Lanka.
Subspecies.Distribution: S Peninsula across the entire region except the Ghats. Breeds locally.
Subspecies.Notes: No specific specimens from peninsular India located that are attributable to this subspecies. Investigation required.

Genus.Name: Helopsaltes
Genus.Author: Alström, Cibois, Irestedt, Zuccon, Gelang, Fjeldså, Andersen, Moyle, Pasquet, & Olsson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: ZSI#18813 from Kolkata is also listed as a 'type'.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Bengal, Assam, Manipur valley, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Also, in southern peninsular India mostly along the SW coast but sporadically in Deccan and in SE coast.

Subspecies.Author: Meise
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Abhandlungen und Berichte des Königlichen Zoologischen und Anthropologisch-Ethnographischen Museums zu Dresden
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: S India.
Subspecies.Notes: May occur (RA2012) but winter range not established (Kennerley & Pearson 2010). On range, some birds wintering in S India could be from this population.

Subspecies.Author: Sushkin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Boston Society of Natural History
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: AR2001 lists Andaman & Nicobar Is specimens as this subspecies. RA2012 did not definitely include this subspecies for our region. Abbott's Kamorta specimen (USNM 178748) listed as _minor_ David & Oustalet 1877, was probably _centralasiae_.

Genus.Name: Locustella
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Manuel d'ornithologie, ou tableau systématique des oiseaux qui se trouvent en Europe (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Winter: Andaman & Nicobar Is, locally in S W Bengal with historical records from Uttar Pradesh.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, W Arunachal. Non-breeding: Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Species.Author: Boddaert
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Table des planches enluminéez d'histoire naturelle de M. D'Aubenton

Subspecies.Author: Seebohm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gujarat, W Ghats, C Indian highlands, SE Ghats, S W Bengal, and in passage across N India.

Subspecies.Author: Sushkin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Boston Society of Natural History
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies not always recognised (Stepanyan 2003, Kennerley & Pearson 2010, IOC).
Subspecies.Distribution: N India.
Subspecies.Notes: It breeds in E Kazakhstan, W China and W Mongolia and hence may occur in our region.

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Gilgit, Baltistan, N Kashmir, and W Ladakh (Kargil district).
Subspecies.Notes: Wintering range unknown.

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Winter: C Assam valley, Meghalaya.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, YPM

Species.Author: La Touche
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Author: Stegmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal as well as Manipur valley.
Subspecies.Notes: See Eaton & Das (2014). Subspecies presumed on range; however, identification with respect to Spotted Bush Warbler can be done safely only by song. Identification of the old specimen in NHMUK#1949.Whi.1.13132 is debated (see RA2012) though Round & Loskot 1994) accepted it as _L. davidi_.

Species.Author: Sushkin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Boston Society of Natural History
Species.Distribution: Breeding: NW Himachal, Uttarakhand. Non-breeding: Lower down in Uttarakhand as well as Uttar Pradesh and further east in S W Bengal as well as Assam.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as monotypic (Alström _et al._ 2008, IOC).

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: S W Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal; also reported from Nagaland, Manipur, and Tripura.

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Based on Alström _et al._ (2015), who examined and sequenced the UMMZ specimens.

Genus.Name: Schoenicola
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Taxonomy: Plumage differences between northern and southern populations of the species (RA2012) probably related to individual, sexual or seasonal variations (Sant _et al._ 2019).
Species.Distribution: W Ghats and adjoining transition zone of the Deccan. Locally in NW Ghats of Nashik, Pune region, Belagavi but more contiguous from SW Karnataka till southern tip of SW Ghats in Kanyakumari district (Tamil Nadu). Isolated records from NE Ghats of Andhra, Chengalpattu and Point Calimere (both Tamil Nadu) indicate some movements.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds of the Peninsula of India arranged according to the modern system of classification; with brief notes on their habits and geographical distribution, and descriptions of new, doubtful and imperfectly described species (Supplement)
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Locally along the Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains as well as E Rajasthan, Gujarat and S W Bengal. Non-breeding: Widely, but very locally in the Indian subcontinent till the southern states of Kerala and Tamil Nadu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Genus.Name: Megalurus
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Indo-Gangetic plains from Jammu, SW Himachal, Punjab, Haryana, S Uttarakhand, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, W Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Also, locally in C India – from E Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, N Maharashtra, Jharkhand, and Odisha.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Pnoepyga
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The zoological miscellany
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _squamata_ Gould 1837 from Cachar and _vegeta_ Koelz 1954 from Kohima.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Martens & Eck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Species.Distribution: Himachal (Kullu and Sirmaur districts) and Uttarakhand.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _pygmaea_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Riparia
Genus.Author: Forster
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A synoptical catalogue of British birds; intended to identify the species mentioned by different names in several catalogues already extant

Species.Author: Gray
Species.AlternativeNames: Grey-throated Sand Martin, Asian Plain Martin

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _brevicaudata_ Horsfield 1840 from Assam.
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire N Peninsula and NE India – from Jammu, south till N Maharashtra; sporadic in Goa and Karnataka; west till Gujarat, east till Odisha and W Bengal extending further into Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal as well as Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Collared Sand Martin (incl. _R. diluta_), Bank Swallow, Common Sand Martin

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Entire Indian subcontinent including S India (sporadic) and Lakshadweep (once).
Subspecies.Notes: No regional specimens definitively attributable to this taxon though there are specimens identified at species level from Delhi, Sadiya (Assam), Dilkush (Cachar), Manipur, and N Bengal. Only ring recoveries can help here. All subcontinent birds are currently attributed to this subspecies with a large breeding range in Palearctic. See Abhinand (2018) for a review of its status in S India.

Subspecies.Author: Lönnberg
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Journal of the College of Science, Imperial University of Tokyo, Japan
Subspecies.Distribution: NE India.
Subspecies.Notes: No definitive specimens of this subspecies. Listing in museums tentative and follow their original designation. Presumably breeds in Brahmaputra river (AR2001) but not proven – though this or Pale Martin breeds in the sand banks of Brahmaputra and Ganga.

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe & Wyatt
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A monograph of the Hirundinidæ or family of swallows
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N India.
Subspecies.Notes: Large flocks of Pale Martins in N India (Thappar & Saggar 2022) during winter can only be substantiated by the wintering population; they look nearly identical to the local breeding population.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not recognised by AR2001 and included under the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Rivers of Indus valley in Jammu and Punjab. Non-breeding: N India (?).

Subspecies.Author: Stegmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Comptes Rendus de l'Académie des Sciences de l'URSS
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Known from Sadiya (Assam), Dilkhush (Cachar), W Khandesh (N Maharashtra), and Sehore (Madhya Pradesh). Possibly the entire N, C, and NE India and south till Maharashtra, Goa, Chhattisgarh, and S W Bengal.

Genus.Name: Ptyonoprogne
Genus.Author: Reichenbach
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Avium Systema Naturale. Das natürliche System der Vögel mit hundert Tafeln grösstentheils Original-Abbildungen der bis jetzt entdecken fast zwölfhundert typischen Formen. Vorlaüfer einer Iconographie der Arten der Vögel aller Welttheile
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue des oiseaux d'Europe offerts, en 1856, aux ornithologistes

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annus I Historico-naturalis. Descriptiones avium musei proprii earumque rariorum, quas vidit in vivario Augustiss. Imperatorus, et museo excell. Comitis Francisci Annib. Turriani
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, and Arunachal (sporadic). Non-breeding: E Rajasthan, C India (sporadic), E Odisha (historical), Khasi hills (Meghalaya, historical), NW Ghats from Surat Dangs till Goa; sporadic in CW Ghats of Karnataka and during migration, elsewhere in Deccan.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from Himachal and Punjab; west till Gujarat, south till the southern tip of the peninsula, and east till about Bihar, N and E Odisha, and.the western edge of S W Bengal.

Genus.Name: Hirundo
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , On the natural history and classification of birds

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from Kudremukh south through the Ghats till southern tip in Kalakkad; extending east along the outcrops of Nilgiri, Palani, and Varusanadu hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II

Subspecies.Author: Sparrman
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Carlsonianum, in quo novas et selectas aves, coloribus ad vivum brevique descriptione illustratas (etc.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Narcondam Is., N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of N Reef, Long, N Button, Henry Lawrence, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Boat, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Winter: Entire subcontinent except E India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Though no migration studies has been conducted, at-sea movement in Arabian sea during October indicate that extralimital W breeders also winter in India. Birds also over-summer in their winter range in the peninsula.

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NE India and sometimes in S W Bengal; sporadic elsewhere in the peninsula.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Claimed from Gujarat; but identification inconclusive from photographs (Patel & Parasharya 2018).

Subspecies.Author: Scopoli
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _ambigua_ Stresemann 1940 from Gangtok (ZMB#39.843), Sikkim.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: N Bengal, Sikkim and Arunachal. Winter: Entire NE India as well as in Peninsula till the southern tip; also reported from Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, ZMB, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Species.Author: Leach
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Narrative of an expedition to explore the river Zaire, usually called the Congo, in South Africa, in 1816, under the direction of Captain J. K. Tuckey (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Stephens
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: General Zoology, or systematic natural history
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the Indian subcontinent from Kashmir, Ladakh, Jammu, and Himachal – west till Gujarat, south till Kanyakumari but sporadic or local in SW coastal plains of C and S Kerala and E coastal plains of Tamil Nadu, Andhra and Odisha; east till S W Bengal and sporadic in N Bengal and Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Delichon
Genus.Author: Moore
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Common House Martin, European House Martin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Formerly, all specimens labelled as the nominate subspecies, which now is considered extralimital, wintering only in Africa (H&M4).

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, and Himachal. Non-breeding: Throughout the country with reports from Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, W Bengal, N Maharashtra, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, along the W Ghats from N Maharashtra through Karnataka till Kerala and SW Tamil Nadu; also, in SE Ghats in S Karnataka and N Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Lakshadweep not evaluated.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Mipi (Arunachal).

Species.Author: Bonaparte
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram. Stragglers to EC India, NE Andhra and hills of Kodagu in W Ghats.

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Subspecies.Distribution: Himachal (sporadic), Punjab, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, and Sikkim.

Subspecies.Author: Mayr
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _bartletti_ Koelz 1952 from Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact limits of this subspecies unclear; Sikkim and N Bengal birds tentatively assigned to the nominate subspecies and Arunachal birds to this subspecies.

Genus.Name: Cecropis
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Ornitologia della Papuasia e delle Molucche

Subspecies.Author: Laxmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Mantissa plantarum altera generum editionis VI et specierum editionis II
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _substriolata_ Hume 1877 from Cachar (Holotype: NHMUK#1887.2.1.880).
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NE India.
Subspecies.Notes: Included here basis RA2012. Specimens in NHMUK from 'Assam' and 'Bengal'. Trays not inspected.

Subspecies.Author: Temminck & Schlegel
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Japonica sive descriptio animalium, quae in itinere per Japoniam, jussu et auspiciis superiorum, qui summum in India Batava imperium tenent, suscepto, annis 1825-1830 collegit, notis, observationibus et adumbrationibus illustravit. Vol. 4. Aves
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NE India, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Several specimens from west of NE India need re-examination. Andaman & Nicobar birds tentatively parked here and photographs of heavily streaked swallows likely to be this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Himachal, Uttarakhand, adjoining plains as well as in N Bengal and Sikkim. Winter: Entire peninsula till Gujarat in the W and Kerala in the south.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: No peak summer records in Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: South of the Himalayan foothills from Punjab, Haryana, and Jammu region; south till Kerala and Tamil Nadu; west till Gujarat and in the east extending sporadically through the plains of Brahmaputra in Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Local movements need mapping.

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Manuel d'ornithologie, ou tableau systématique des oiseaux qui se trouvent en Europe (etc.)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _scullii_ Seebohm 1883 from Gilgit.
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kashmir.
Subspecies.Notes: Winters extralimitally in Africa but birds may be using the subcontinent during migration.

Species.Author: Schlegel
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Kritische Übersicht der europäischen Vögel
Species.Taxonomy: Not always recognised as a species and treated as a subspecies of _Cecropis daurica_ (BLI).

Subspecies.Author: Hall
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _khasica_ Koelz 1954 from Boko, Assam.
Subspecies.Distribution: C and E Assam, E Arunachal as well as all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Range confounded with _C. d. japonica_.Claims from Andamans not evaluated here.

Genus.Name: Petrochelidon

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine

Species.Author: Blyth

Species.Distribution: Throughout the subcontinent from Kashmir, Jammu, south till the southern tip of the peninsula; west till Gujarat and east till S W Bengal; sporadic in N Bengal and Assam.

Genus.Name: Alophoixus

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Birds. 1st ed.

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _viridulus_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizoram and _aureolus_ Koelz 1954 from Kohima, Nagaland.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: No recent reports from Sikkim.

Genus.Name: Alcurus
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, W and C Arunachal till about Abor hills; Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur.

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies probably not valid, see RA2012.
Subspecies.Distribution: Mishmi and Patkai hills in NE Arunachal and Nagaland.

Genus.Name: Iole
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Deignan
Species.AlternativeNames: Indian Olive Bulbul; Olive Bulbul (with _I. viridescens_)
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as a subspecies of extralimital _Iole viridescens_ Blyth 1867 (HBW/BLI).
Species.Distribution: Khasi (historical) and Garo hills (Meghalaya), Cachar, W Manipur (historical), W Mizoram, and Tripura.

Subspecies.Author: Oustalet
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouvelles Archives du Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris, Bulletin
Subspecies.Distribution: Moreh district, Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies identity unresolved but presumptively included as nominate.

Genus.Name: Hemixos

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Genus.Name: Acritillas

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies identity of Tirumala population unresolved. Includes _intensior_ Koelz 1939 from Kunjapani [=Kunjapanai], Nilgiri hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: CW and SW Ghats – from Goa south till Kanyakumari district. – also, in eastern outcrops (e.g., Biligirirangans) and SE Ghats (Melagiri, Servarayan, Kolli, and Pachamalai hills) and disjunctly in CE Ghats (Tirumala hills).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Genus.Name: Ixos

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie

Subspecies.Notes: Identity of the regional birds as this (N Yunnan breeders) or _leucothorax_ Mayr 1942 (Sichuan breeders) unresolved – possibly both occurs. However, all clear photographs are dark sooty in underparts that would eliminate the nominate subspecies. See Srinivasan _et al._ (2009), Lalmuansanga (2016).

Subspecies.Author: Sykes

Species.Taxonomy: Localty of ZSI #35398 designated as holotype says 'Travancore'.
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from SW Maharashtra till the southern tip of the Ghats – extending sparingly into the transition zone of Deccan in Karnataka as well as in the outcrops like Biligirirangans; locally in hillocks in SW coast.

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.Taxonomy: Formerly _atriceps_ Temminck 1822 but the move from _Pycnonotus_ to the genus _Brachypodius_ (Shakya & Sheldon 2017) renders _melanocephalos_ (Gmelin, 1788) to have priority, and cannot be regarded as a homonym of _Lanius collurio, var. ε melanocephalus_ Gmelin, 1788 (contra Oberholser 1917), and has been used since 1899. Though, recently moved further to _Microtarsus_, this priority argument stays.

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _cinereoventris_ Blyth 1845 from Tripura and _major_ Robinson & Kloss 1923 from Cachar.
Subspecies.Distribution: Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur (historical), Mizoram, and Tripura.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.TypeLocality: (Port Mouat and Mount Harriet, South Andaman Is.)
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as islets of Paget, Interview, Long, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Alexandra, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, LKO

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London

Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, TNHM, MYS, LKO

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Presumably expanding its range in C India.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: S Rajasthan (Mt. Abu region).

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _provincialis_ Whistler 1931 from Kumaon Bhabar.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gangetic plains and associated sub-Himalayan foothills from about extreme E Punjab till Bihar.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Washington Academy of Sciences
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of N Reef, Interview, Long, Outram, Nicholson, Havelock, Neil, Ross, Alexandra, Grub, Tarmugli, Red Skin, Boat, Jolly Buoy, Rutland, and N Cinque Is. Introduced in Nicobar Is – including Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar group (Teresa, Trinket, Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal Is.) as well as Great Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Deignan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Auk
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _pallida_ Baker 1917 from Deesa. Intergrades with _intermedius_ and _bengalensis_ in the north and the nominate subspecies in the south.
Subspecies.Distribution: NW and C India – from Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and NE Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _stanfordi_ in E Assam, _wetmorei_ in Odisha, _intermedius_ in Kumaon (Uttarakhand), and _humayuni_ in S Uttar Pradesh. Includes _pygaeus_ 'Hodgson' = Bonaparte 1850 from Assam, Bengal and _afer_ Koelz 1954 from Mawphlang, Khasi hills, Meghalaya. Birds in Cachar, Khasi hills and Manipur sometimes referred to as _primrosei_ Deignan 1949 (Type locality: Surma Tea Estate, Sylhet, Bangladesh).
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Deignan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Check-list of Birds the World
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Molpastes cafer saturatus_ Whistler & Kinnear 1932.
Subspecies.Distribution: Odisha, NE Andhra till about Godavari river.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _pusillus_ Blyth 1841 from Chingelput [=Chengalpattu], Chennai and _vicinus_ Ripley 1946 from Mysuru.
Subspecies.Distribution: Entrire S Peninsula from about Mumbai region, roughly south of the Godavari river.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Deignan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Washington Academy of Sciences
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _burmanicus_ Sharpe 1881 from 'Burmese countries, ranging from Cachar into Pegu'.
Subspecies.Distribution: Patkai hills of E Arunachal and E Assam, E Nagaland, E Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intermediates with _P. leucogenys_ known as '_humii_' known from W Punjab (Pakistan) and may occur in the Indian side as well.
Subspecies.Distribution: NW India from Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, W Uttar Pradesh, N Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, and NW Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Notes: Its presence in Maharashtra outside the NW region (Mumbai and Pune) not investigated – population there expanded recently and may have benefited from escapees.

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian zoology; chiefly selected from the collection of Major-General Hardwicke, F. R. S.
Species.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand and adjoining foothills region in Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh; N Bengal, Sikkim as well as extreme W Arunachal in Tawang region.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Phylloscopus
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis

Species.Author: Bechstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Der Naturforscher
Species.Taxonomy: Follows H&M4 for dating as 1793 (contra 1792 in Dickinson _et al._ 2011; seel also Praveen & Jayapal 2023).
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Startsapuk Tso and Hanle (both Ladakh).

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Notes: Records from Kashmir (AR2001) not evaluated. E Uttarakhand may get birds from _centralis_ Ripley 1950 population of W Nepal.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst

Subspecies.Taxonomy: The type specimen is probably lost.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Ladakh, Kashmir through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Include _pernix_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal. Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Winter: E India from W Bengal and Sikkim, E through Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Sporadic during migration in W Himalaya, and wintering locally in peninsular India till Tamil Nadu and Kerala. Also occurs in Andaman, Nicobar, and Narcondam Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Species.Author: Brooks
Species.AlternativeNames: Hume's Leaf Warbler, Mandelli's Leaf Warbler _P. [h.] mandellii_

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand as well as Sikkim and N Bengal. Non-breeding: Further south in the entire N Indian subcontinent; from Gujarat till W Bengal, C India, and south till S Karnataka while straggling to SW Ghats of Kerala and Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: East of Sikkim and N Bengal in Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Possible breeding in Arunachal (AR2001) not investigated.

Species.Author: Brooks
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, possibly Kashmir. Non-breeding: Indus plains of Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region extending east and south through Gangetic plains to W Uttar Pradesh, N Madhya Pradesh, and NE Rajasthan.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ

Species.Author: La Touche
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Species.Distribution: Winter: Khasi hills (Meghalaya).
Species.Specimens: UMMZ

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from E Ladakh.

Species.Author: Gray & Gray
Species.AlternativeNames: Pale-rumped Warbler, Pallas's Leaf Warbler (with _P. proregulus_)

Subspecies.Author: Gray & Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the specimens and drawings of mammalia and birds of Nepal and Thibet. Presented by B. H. Hodgson, Esq. to the British Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _newtoni_ Gätke 1889 from Darjeeling.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, adjoining Assam, and possibly all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal and Uttarakhand; straggling to Punjab, Delhi region, Uttar Pradesh in winter, and exceptionally to Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: See Trivedi & Mori (2020) for Gujarat record, which is accepted here.

Species.Author: Rothschild
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Species.Distribution: Winter: Walong region (Arunachal) and also reported from Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Brooks
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir and further east through Himachal and Uttarakhand. Non-breeding: W Ghats from about Mumbai and Nashik down south till about Pandalam hills at least; possibly further south. Also, locally in E Ghats and Deccan hillocks (e.g., Nandi hills) and remaining subcontinent during migration and concentrating around Uttarakhand.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir, Ladakh, N Himachal. Non-breeding: south of it is range from Punjab and Himachal through Delhi region and E Rajasthan into Gujarat; east till about S W Bengal and W Odisha and south till S Karnataka.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Martens et al.
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Vertebrate Zoology
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Martens _et al._ 2008 only included Kashmir birds in their analysis. The status of Uttarakhand breeding birds as this subspecies, and hence the wintering birds in peninsular India, is only conjectural.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh through Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand (?). Non-breeding: Peninsular India south of its breeding range extending through the hill ranges till the SW Ghats of Kerala and Tamil Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Original type locality, Borabhum and Dholbhum, has been now revised to Nepal and assigned a Neotype (see Martens _et al._ 2008).
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal. Non-breeding: south of its range in W Bengal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: How far west this population reaches during winter is not known.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Uttarakhand (rarely further W and in adjoining terai), N Uttar Pradesh, E Jharkhand, Odisha, Bihar, W Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and entire NE hill states apart from Andaman, Nicobar, and Narcondam Is. Stragglers widely in peninsular India up till C Kerala and S Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Abhandlungen und Berichte des Königlichen Zoologischen und Anthropologisch-Ethnographischen Museums zu Dresden
Subspecies.Taxonomy: RA2012 includes both _tibetanus_ Ticehurst 1937 and _weigoldi_ Stresemann 1923 under Dusky Warbler. However, Martens _et al._ (2008) moved both subspecies under Smoky Warbler – a treatment followed by most modern taxonomies. This also includes _mariae_ Ripley 1951 that has been reported from Manipur and Andamans (AR2001, RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NE India and Andamans.
Subspecies.Notes: We treat the presence of this population breeding in NE China as tentative in the region. This population was traditionally (AR2001) believed to refer to the 'Dusky Warbler' of E Himalaya and Andamans. Moving these wintering populations under 'Smoky Warbler' is untenable as all call recordings from both NE India and Andamans are of Dusky Warblers. It is likely that traditional taxonomy where _weigoldi_ is treated as the birds wintering in NE India and Andamans may be incorrect and all regional birds may belong to _fuscatus sensu stricto_. Until a definitive _weigoldi_ specimen from India is located through molecular analysis, we treat this subspecies as tentative. Specimens labelled as _weigoldi_ are in the BNHS (Andamans, Narcondam), FMNH (Garo hills, Assam), and UMMZ(Assam).

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal. Non-breeding: Adjacent terai and plains from about Delhi region, south till N Chambal valley, east through Gangetic plains and Brahmaputra plains of Assam, and adjoining Arunachal. Also reported from Nagaland, Cachar, and Manipur valley.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: See under _weigoldi_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Breeds north of the region in Tibet.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Winter: Thar desert of W Rajasthan – sporadically further east and has occured till Hardoi district, Uttar Pradesh.

Species.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Species.Distribution: Breeding: W Arunachal (Mandala) Non-breeding: Also, Sikkim, N Bengal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from S Kerala and Middle Andaman Is.

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh and NW Himachal, Non-breeding: Kashmir, Jammu, and sporadically in Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, and N Madhya Pradesh during migration.

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition

Subspecies.Author: Nilsson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Kongliga Svenska Vetenskaps-Akademiens Handlingar
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat.
Subspecies.Notes: May occur (See Ganpule 2016).

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies sometimes accorded species status.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Much of the country from Gilgit, Ladakh, N India including Thar desert, east till W Assam and W Meghalaya, sporadically further east during migration; C and S India till Goa, N Karnataka and Telangana – sporadic further south in S Karnataka, Andhra, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: La Touche
Species.AlternativeNames: Allied Flycatcher Warbler, White-spectacled Leaf Warbler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Author: Elliott & del Hoyo
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrated Checklist of the Birds of the World
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Grey-cheeked Flycatcher Warbler, Grey-cheeked Leaf Warbler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: N Bengal, Sikkim Arunachal, and Nagaland (?). Non-breeding: Adjoining foothills including Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ

Species.Author: Anderson

Species.Distribution: Breeding: E Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram. Non-breeding: Adjoining foothills including Assam as well as Cachar.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Non-breeding: south of its breeding range immediately in the sub-Himalayan foothills and south to about Delhi region as well as Assam and S W Bengal.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth

Subspecies.Author: Sundevall
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Physiographiska Sällskapets Tidskrift
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The eastern subspecies _obscuratus_ Stresemann 1929 might occur in Andaman & Nicobar Is. as well as NE India. It might sound identical to Two-barred Warbler and hence recordings, specificallly from Andaman & Nicobar Is., need more investigation.

Species.Author: Swinhoe

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Non-breeding: S W Bengal, Gujarat, W Ghats from about Mumbai till the southern tip of peninsula; sporadically in E Ghats, C Indian foothills, and Deccan hillocks. Also adjoining foothills in E Himalaya in Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Tripura. On passage elsewhere in the subcontinent.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Winter: Swaraj dweep [=Havelock Is.], Andaman Is.

Species.Author: Portenko
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Doklady Akademii Nauk SSSR
Species.Distribution: Winter: Andaman & Nicobar Is.

Species.Author: Blasius
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Naumannia
Species.Distribution: Winter: Andaman, Nicobar, and Narcondam Is.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, AMNH

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.AlternativeNames: Chestnut-headed Flycatcher Warbler, Chestnut-crowned Leaf Warbler

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _nagaensis_ Koelz 1951 from Kohima, Nagaland.
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Tickell
Species.AlternativeNames: Black-browed Leaf Warbler, Yellow-faced Leaf Warbler, Yellow-vented Leaf Warbler

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill state; sporadically in S W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Large Crowned Leaf Warbler, Western Crowned Leaf Warbler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya (Gilgit, Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand). Non-breeding: Gujarat, C Indian highlands, NE Ghats, W Ghats as well as Deccan hillocks. On migration, rest of the subcontinent in between and east till Garo hills in E Meghalaya.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir (sporadic), Himachal, and Uttarakhand; sporadic in Indo-Gangetic plains.
Subspecies.Notes: Records from peninsular India (AR2001) not evaluated.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Kumaon (Uttarakhand), N Bengal, and Sikkim; sporadic in Bihar, S W Bengal, and Odisha.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _harterti_ Baker 1913. Includes _terpsinus_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizoram. Also, includes _extimus_ Koelz 1954 from Karong, Manipur that was originally labelled as a subspecies of Eastern Crowned Warbler _P. occipitalis_ (see RA2012 on reidentification).
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.

Species.Author: La Touche

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes not recognised and included under the nominate subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Taxonomy: RA2012 considers this subspecies doubtful as no breeding season records have been traced.
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar record where it is limited to high peaks (Baker 1922) not investigated. See Sharma _et al._ (2021) for records from Manipur that are presumably of this subspecies on range.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand till about Mussoorie.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: E Uttarakhand (from Mussoorie), N Bengal, and Sikkim.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _muroides_ Koelz 1954 from Bamanigaon, Assam (FMNH#277599).
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal but descending to lowland Assam in winter; stragglers to Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Nagaland, Cachar, and Manipur not evaluated.

Subspecies.Author: Burton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _regia_ Koelz 1954 from Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Himachal and Uttarakhand, through N Bengal and Sikkim, Arunachal, adjoining Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _manis_ Koelz 1954 from Khasi hills and _mizorum_ Koelz 1954 from Mizo hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal – also reported from Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: _Phylloscopus subaffinis arcanus_ Ripley 1950 was a misidentified specimen of this taxon (see Alström _et al._ 1993).
Subspecies.Distribution: Locally in Kashmir and Himachal, more widely in Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and Assam.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised (RA2012). Includes _circumspectus_ (Koelz 1954) from Mawphlang, Khasi hills, Meghalaya. The entire Koelz collection from the type locality is in UMMZ and hence so would be the type specimen. Exact holotype number not obtained.
Subspecies.Distribution: Garo and Khasi hills in Meghalaya.

Subspecies.Author: Mayr
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _alexanderi_ Ripley, 1951 from Phek-Meluri Road, about 100km east of Kohima, Nagaland (probably near Khomi).
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Distribution: W Arunachal (Sela and Tawang region).
Subspecies.Notes: Photographs from Arunachal almost certainly this subspecies (see Praveen _et al._ 2019). Reports from Darjeeling not verified.

Species.Author: Przevalski
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zapiski Imperatorskoi Akademii Nauk

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal – till Lohit valley.

Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, W Arunachal, and very rarely in E Arunachal (Mishmi hills).
Subspecies.Notes: Overlap with _bonvaloti_ Oustalet 1892 nearly nil within India though the nominate subspecies occurs in Tibet along the Tsangpo bend. Mishmi hill birds are probably stragglers from that population, and not a breeding one.

Subspecies.Author: Oustalet

Subspecies.Distribution: Walong region only.
