Subspecies.Notes: One female collected from Kataklik, Ladakh (ZMA.AVES.44108) by J Sillem.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Hume’s Whitethroat _S [c.] althaea_, Desert/Small Whitethroat _S [c.] minula_
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Following Olsson _et al._ (2013), all taxa in this complex are treated as a single species. However, sometimes _althaea_ alone is accorded species status (RA2012) and this also found some support in Olsson _et al._ (2013).

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst & Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _halimodendri_ Sushkin 1904 possible in region but subspecies identification difficult. When _blythi_ is not recognised, all regional birds are assigned to _halimodendri_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout the subcontinent from Gilgit and Ladakh (at least on passage), N India, C India, east till W Bengal, west till Rajasthan and Gujarat, and south till N Karnataka but sporadic further S.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes accorded species status (see RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Rajasthan and Gujarat.

Subspecies.Author: Sztolcman
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Société Impériale des Naturalistes de Moscou
Subspecies.Distribution: Kachchh.
Subspecies.Notes: Possible in migration. One of the Kutch specimens from Bhuj (BNHS#5864), originally collected by Salim Ali, putatively identified as this subspecies by Vaurie (see Soman 1964).

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _affinis_ Blyth 1845 from 'S India' – but although this name is synonymized with _althaea_, most of the published material under the name '_affinis_' refers to _S curruca blythi_ (Whistler & Ticehurst 1933).
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir, and Ladakh. Winter: Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India, S India including Deccan, eastern edges of W Ghats, and E Ghats of Andhra and Odisha.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MYS, HYD

Species.Author: Cretzschmar
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Atlas zu der Reise im nördlichen Afrika von Eduard Rüppell. Erste Abtheilung. Zoologie. Vögel

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India, W Odisha, Deccan, south till Tamil Nadu; sporadic in Gangetic plains of Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and S W Bengal, as well as W coastal India. Passage further north including Gilgit.

Species.Author: Hemprich & Ehrenberg
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Symbolae physicae seu icones et descriptiones corporum naturalium novorum aut minus cognitorum quae ex itineribus per Libyam Aegyptum Nubiam Dongolam Syrian Arabiam et Habessianiam publico institutis (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Winter: Rajasthan and Gujarat. More widely in NW India during migration including Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Delhi region, and NW Maharashtra. Straggler in NW Bengal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ

Subspecies.Distribution: Passage migrant mainly through Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat but sporadically in Ladakh, Jammu, Delhi region, adjoining Uttar Pradesh, and W Maharashtra.

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Jerdon

Subspecies.Author: Hume

Subspecies.Distribution: N Uttar Pradesh (Dudhwa), N Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining E Arunachal, and Manipur valley.
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar reports not investigated.

Genus.Name: Fulvetta

Species.Author: Hodgson

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst & Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Notes: No specimens exist of the nominate subspecies from E Uttarakhand. Photographs from Pithoragarh are also of _kangrae_.

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland and Manipur.

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies expected in Mizo hills (see RA2012).

Subspecies.Author: Mayr
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Walong region and Upper Noa-Dihing valley of NE Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Western extremities of its distribution in Arunachal remains to be studied.

Species.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Species.AlternativeNames: Manipur Brown-headed Tit Babbler, Grey-hooded Fulvetta; Streak-throated/Grey-headed Tit Babbler (with _F. cinereiceps_ EL)

Subspecies.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: C Arunachal (Talle valley), E Arunachal (Mishmi hills, Vijoynagar region), Nagaland, and N Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: Barail range (Cachar) record in AR2001 not verified, but could occur.

Genus.Name: Paradoxornis
Genus.Author: Gould
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Extreme NE Bengal (historically), Brahmaputra plains in Assam and adjoining E Arunachal, Cachar plains (historically), and Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: David
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouvelles Archives du Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris, Bulletin
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _austeni_ Gould 1874 from Kuchai (Naga hills) and Shillong.
Species.Distribution: E Arunachal (from Anini and Walong region), Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Conostoma
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Genus.Taxonomy: Genus sometimes not recognised and treated under _Paradoxornis_ (see IOC).

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and rarely from W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Cholornis
Genus.Author: Verreaux
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Nouvelles Archives du Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris, Bulletin
Genus.Taxonomy: Genus sometimes not recognised and treated under _Paradoxornis_ (see IOC).

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, YPM

Genus.Name: Psittiparus
Genus.Author: Hellmayr
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Das Tierreich: eine Zusammenstellung und Kennzeichnung der rezenten Tierformen
Genus.Taxonomy: Genus sometimes not recognised and treated under _Paradoxornis_ (see IOC).

Subspecies.Author: Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The genera of birds: comprising their generic characters, a notice of the habits of each genus, and an extensive list of species referred to their several genera
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal till about Mishmi hills and lower basin of Lohit.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _schoeniparus_ Koelz 1954 from Karong, Manipur. RA2012 states the birds in Mizo hills may belong to subspecies _rasus_ Stresemann, 1940 from Chin hills that lacks black on throat; however photographs from Mizoram shows black on throat, though much reduced, and could be intergrades. Tentatively included under this taxon.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Noa-Dihing valley), S through Patkai hills, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Mitteilungen aus dem Zoologischen Museum in Berlin
Subspecies.Distribution: S Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies expected in Mizo hills (see RA2012) but see under _transfluvialis_.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Greater Rufous-headed Parrotbill/Greater Red-headed Parrotbill (incl. _P. bakeri_)
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Recently split from _P. bakeri_ (King & Robson 2008, RA2012); but may need further research in E Arunachal to clarify transition zones.
Species.Distribution: N Bengal (historically at least), W Arunachal extending east till Mishmi hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _psithyrus_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizo hills and _rufitinctus_ Koelz 1954 from Cherrapunji.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Arunachal from Walong, Namdapha, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Its presence in Mishmi hills, and the extent of hybridisation with White-breasted Parrotbill, if any, needs further investigation.

Genus.Name: Suthora
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim.

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Mishmi birds assumed to be this taxon.
Subspecies.Distribution: Talley valley and Mechuka [=Pachakshri] in Subansiri basin and Mishmi hills.
Subspecies.Notes: Its presence in Dafla hills of W Arunachal (AR2001, RA2012) not supported by any recent evidence; fact not further investigated. Several specimens from Mechuka (e.g., NHMUK#1937.1.17.855) from Ludlow's collection.

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.AlternativeNames: Orange Parrotbill, Orange Suthora, Nepal Parrotbill; [Ashy-eared Parrotbill, Orange-eared Parrotbill, Grey-breasted Parrotbill, Blyth's Parrotbill]
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts

Subspecies.Author: Fleming & Traylor
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Fieldiana Zoology
Subspecies.Distribution: E Uttarakhand, and Garhwal region (historical).

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim.
Subspecies.Notes: Range of the nominate subspecies does not extend west to Uttarakhand or east to N Bengal or Sikkim.

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _intermedia_ Kinnear 1944 from E Bhutan. Described from SE Tibet, but treated as a semi-stable hybrid population of _humii_ x _politis_ by Penhallurick & Robson (2009) – following Kinnear (1937). Migration (of one taxon) suggested as the reason for the presence of two subspecies (_crocotia_ and _daflaensis_ Godwin-Austen 1876 = _poliotis_) in the same region in W Arunachal (AR2001); but intergradation more likely the cause. NHMUK specimen from Shakti (Field collection #5007) tentatively assigned to this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Arunachal (Shakti).

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Tentatively includes _daflaensis_ Godwin-Austen 1876 from Toroputu peak, Dafla hills and _munipurensis_ Godwin-Austen & Walden 1875 from a site near Karakhul, Manipur hills. Type specimen lost (Sharpe 1894).
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, and N Manipur.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Taxonomy: May be a synonym of _ripponi_ Sharpe, 1905 of Chin hills, Myanmar (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Mizo hills.

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen
Species.AlternativeNames: Lesser Rufous-headed Parrotbill, Lesser Red-headed Parrotbill; Black-browed Parrotbill _S. atrosuperciliaris sensu stricto_

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A hand-list of the genera and species of birds
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Chleuasicus ruficeps_ Blyth 1845.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim.
Subspecies.Notes: Recent sight records from Sikkim may be this taxon; but recent status in India little known. NHMUK has specimens from Darjeeling and Sikkim.

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _rufina_ Koelz 1952 from Laikul, N Cachar.
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal and adjoining Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Presence in Manipur not investigated.

Genus.Name: Staphida
Genus.Author: Gould
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Hand-list of genera and species of birds, distinguishing those contained in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, W Arunachal including Dafla hills.
Subspecies.Notes: Eastern limits unclear; AR2001 states it occurs till Subansiri river while the western limits of _plumbeiceps_ starts from Dikrang valley at the base of Dafla hills.

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: C and E Arunachal, adjoining Assam and extending towards E and S Nagaland.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam south of Brahmaputra, Meghalaya, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Genus.Name: Yuhina
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _titania_ Koelz 1954 from Karong, Manipur.
Species.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst & Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya of Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, adjoining Punjab as well as Haryana, and extending to Uttarakhand.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _baileyi_ Baker 1914 from Tembang, Dirang valley.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal till Abor-Miri hills and adjoining Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Oustalet
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin du Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal from Mishmi hills through Noa-Dihing valley, Patkai hills including parts of E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Rothschild
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Species.Taxonomy: New name for _Siva occipitalis_ Blyth 1844. This nomenclature confusion with Rufous-vented Yuhina _Y. occipitalis_ makes assessment of historical records and specimens difficult. Included here is _atrovinacea_ Koelz 1954.
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur (historically).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Meghalaya records not verified.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Taxonomic identity of the birds from Nagaland and Manipur not evaluated.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal – but also recently from Nagaland, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Meghalaya not evaluated.

Genus.Name: Zosterops
Genus.Author: Vigors & Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Manuel d'ornithologie, ou Description des genres et des principales espèces d'orseaux

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Mishmi hills (Arunachal), Chaltlang, Reiek, and Murlen (last three in Mizoram).

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergradation zone with the nominate subspecies not worked out but believed to be the terai region.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, sporadically in Ladakh, through Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Temminck
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Lakshadweep birds sometimes (see IOC) suggested to be _egregius_ Madarász 1911, which is otherwise endemic to Sri Lanka. Includes _elwesi_ Baker 1922 from Sikkim, _cacharensis_ Baker 1922 from Gunjong in N Cachar, and _amabilis_ Koelz 1950 from Sasan, Junagadh, Kathiawar, Gujarat.
Subspecies.Distribution: N India from Punjab, Haryana, through Delhi region, Gangetic plains, W Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India, Bihar, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, all NE hill states, south through W Ghats and the transition zone, Deccan plateau, till about Kodagu, northern base of Nilgiris, Mysuru, and Bengaluru region. Also, in several atolls of Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _palniensis_ Koelz 1939 (4 skins in BNHS) here, but probably requires subspecies status based on its larger size and substantial genetic differences (see Robin _et al._ 2010).
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats from Kodagu till Agasthyamala hills in S Tamil Nadu; also outcrops like Biligirirangan, Nilgiri, Palani, Varusanadu, Sirumalai, and Alagarkoil hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Sirumalai and Alagarkoil birds included here rather than _salimalii_ based on geographical proximity. Exact eastern limits of this subspecies not analysed.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergradation points with the nominate subspecies on the west and south edge of its range unresolved.
Subspecies.Distribution: CE Ghats from Nallamala hills, through Kadapa, Tirumala, to SE Ghats of Koundiya (S Andhra), Jawadhu, Yelagiri, Kalvarayan, Servarayan, and Kolli hills – roughly the E Ghats between the rivers of Godavari and Kaveri.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, USNM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Andaman birds may constitute an undescribed subspecies. Taxonomic affinities of Nicobar birds with _palpebrosus_ vis-a-vis other SE Asian White-eyes, specifically _simplex_ Swinhoe 1861 and _auriventer_ Hume 1878 unresolved.
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is including islets of N Reef, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Boat, and Rutland Is. All three groups of Nicobar – including Car Nicobar Is.; Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompoka, Kamorta, Nancowry, Trinket, and Katchal Is. all in the C Nicobar group; and Great Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Timalia
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _arundicola_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, adjoining terai in Uttar Pradesh, S W Bengal, Odisha (locally), Brahmaputra plains of Assam and E Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur valley, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Dumetia
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the Museum Asiatic Society
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Franklin
Species.AlternativeNames: Rufous-bellied Babbler _D. h. hyperythra_, White-throated Babbler _D. h. albogularis_ & _abuensis_

Subspecies.Author: Franklin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: E Himachal, Punjab, along the sub-Himalayan tracts of Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh, Gangetic plains, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Chhattisgarh, E Maharashtra, Telangana, NE Karnataka, and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Its presence in N Bengal (AR2001) not verified.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _abuensis_ Harington 1915 of Mount Abu, SE Rajasthan and _navarroi_ Abdulali 1959 of Khandala, NW Ghats. Intergradation zones with the nominate subspecies in Jalna and Nallamala (AR2001).
Subspecies.Distribution: E Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka till C Karnataka till about Hampi, CE Ghats in Nallamala, further south till the southern tip of Tamil Nadu – avoids most parts of SW coastal strip where it occurs locally.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Pune region (locally), from SW Maharashtra, Goa till Palakkad gap including Nilgiri hills – also locally in W coastal plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM, MYS
Subspecies.Notes: Its presence in Biligirirangans not verified.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats south of Palakkad gap including Palani, Varusanadu, and Alagarkovil hills.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies identity of Alagarkovil hills not established but presumed to be this subspecies on range (Narayanan 2015).

Genus.Name: Mixornis
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Horsfield
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoological researches in Java, and the neighbouring islands

Subspecies.Author: Tickell
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Manbhum and Singhbhum Districts, Jharkhand [=Jungles of Borabhum and Dholbhum])
Subspecies.Taxonomy: As per RA2012, birds in the Assam plains are closer to _sulphurea_ Rippon 1900 of Myanmar. However, photographs do not seem to suggest this; individual variations exist. Includes _mayri_ Koelz 1951 from Sukna, Darjeeling district, N Bengal and _assamicus_ Koelz 1951 from Tura, Garo hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all hill states of NE India. Nearly disjunct in Chota Nagpur plateau of Jharkhand, adjoining W Bengal, NE Ghats of Odisha, S Chhattisgarh, and NE Andhra; a tiny disjunct population in extreme NE Tamil Nadu (Masinagudi) and SE Karnataka (Nagarhole – historically at least).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MYS
Subspecies.Notes: See Praveen _et al._ (2005) on the population from S India.

Genus.Name: Cyanoderma
Genus.Author: Salvadori
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Annali del Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Genova

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _chrysocoma_ Koelz 1954 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur.

Subspecies.Author: Rippon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _crocina_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizo hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: Mizoram only.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _ochrops_ Koelz 1954 from Kotla, Kangra district, Himachal.
Species.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, adjoining Punjab and Haryana, as well as Uttarakhand.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Taxonomic validity of _rufipectus_ Koelz 1954 questionable (RA2012) and often (e.g., AR2001) considered synonymous with the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal till Mishmi hills and Walong and adjoining Assam (e.g., Nameri). Also, SE Arunachal, C and E Assam south of Brahmaputra, and all the NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Previous reports from Odisha (AR2001) due to misidentified _C ambiguum_ (RA2012).

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Extralimital Rufous-fronted Babbler _Cyanoderma rufifrons pallescens_ (Ticehurst, 1932) of W Myanmar or intergrades with that may occur in Mizoram; further study needed.
Subspecies.Distribution: Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states; disjunctly in NE Ghats of Odisha (Similipal) and NE Andhra (Visakhapatnam hills).

Genus.Name: Spelaeornis
Genus.Author: David & Oustalet
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Les oiseaux de la Chine
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, W and C Arunachal (Talley valley).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Species.Author: Ripley
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Species.Distribution: Mishimi hills till Anini region in the north.
Species.Specimens: USNM

Species.Author: Verreaux
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouvelles Archives du Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris, Bulletin

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Arunachal in Dafla hills.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies assumed on range as this is found in Bhutan.

Subspecies.Author: Ripley et al.
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal in Upper Noa-Dihing valley.

Subspecies.Author: Oustalet
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin du Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle
Subspecies.Distribution: Mechuka [=Pachakshri] in Subansiri basin and Mishmi hills (Arunachal).
Subspecies.Notes: Ludlow & Kinnear (1944) reported this subspecies (Field #4020-24) from Pachakshri and hence included by RA2012 (though not in AR2001). Eastern and western limits of this taxon with respect to other subspecies is not worked out and Mishmi hills birds tentatively assigned here.

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen & Walden
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _nagaensis_ Ripley 1951 from Mount Japvo, Naga hills. Presence of this species in the Barail range, Cachar, requires further study. Baker (1892) described a new species as _Elachura haplonota_ from Hangrum, Barail range which he collected from its nest which Ticehurst (1939) synonymised with this species – and the specimen remains untraced in the ZSI collection. Population in Upper Noa-Dihing valley in SE Arunachal.was previously considered as Grey-bellied Wren Babbler _S reptatus_ Bingham 1903 but now believed to be a new taxon (Praveen _et al._ 2022). Only one specimen from India known (USNM #585851) of this population; the other purportedly in BNHS not locatable.
Species.Distribution: Naga and N Manipur hills.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Rippon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Species.Taxonomy: An NHMUK specimen similar to this taxon from SW Nagaland as per RA2012. Situation not further studied.
Species.Distribution: Murlen and Phawngpui in E Mizo hills.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ, FMNH

Species.Author: Moore
Species.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Species.Taxonomy: Its presence in adjoining Cachar unresolved.
Species.Distribution: Khasi hills and locally in W Jaintia hills in Meghalaya.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Pomatorhinus
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal till Mishmi hills and Lohit valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, MCZ, ROM, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _formosus_ Koelz, 1952 from Tura peak, Garo hills after Reddy & Moyle (2011); but if that subspecies is recognised, then only Mizoram birds will be considered _phayrei_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya (Garo and Khasi hills), Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _namdapha_ Ripley 1980 from Upper Noa-Dihing valley.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Namdapha and Noa-Dihing valley).

Species.Author: Walden
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal – in lower ranges of Dafla and Mishmi hills as well as Lohit valley – sporadically in intervening areas.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Namdapha region and Patkai hills), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal roughly till about Siang river in C Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _arquatellus_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizo hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal (Mishmi hills, Walong region, Noa-Dihing valley), Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Presence in Khasi and Cachar hills not investigated.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: C and E Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Populations west of Dafla hills in Arunachal (Talle valley, Mishmi hills, Mechuka, Lohit valley) have not been taxonomically sampled but parked here.

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _recter_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizo hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Upper Noa-Dihing valley, Changlang), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: SE Arunachal population tentatively parked here.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _pinwilli_ Sharpe 1883 from NW Himalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Jammu, Himachal, adjoining Punjab and Haryana, and extending east till W Uttarakhand (Garhwal region).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _assamensis_ Blyth 1847 from Khasi hills (restricted by Ripley 1961).
Subspecies.Distribution: E Uttarakhand (Kumaon region), N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal till about Siang river, W and C Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Tripura – disjointly in Sundarbans (S W Bengal).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: Mishmi hills, presumably also Lohit valley.
Subspecies.Notes: Eastern and western limits not worked out.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Namdapha region) and E Assam.

Subspecies.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact distribution not worked out but likely that the nominate or intergrades with the present subspecies also occur in Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Rajasthan (Mt. Abu region), E Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh till about Balaghat (Madhya Pradesh).

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: NW Ghats from Surat Dangs (Gujarat), W Maharashtra till about Goa and Londa (NW Karnataka) in the Ghats, extending to Deccan hillocks and Deccan transition zone in Karnataka, and entire S Karnataka including Kodagu, Biligirirangans, Mysuru, and Bengaluru regions – presumably further south to Melagiri, Satyamangala till Moyar valley and Thoppur pass. E Ghats from N Odisha (Similipal) till NE Andhra, Chhattisgarh, locally in Telangana, and E Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, MYS, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Range approximate – overlapping regions with _obscurus_ is insufficiently known. Contiguity of range from east to west and north to south are also unclear. Map in AR2001 incorrect for S India as it does not include any parts of Karnataka in its range (contra Ali & Whistler 1942).

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: CE and SE Ghats from Amrabad plateau, Nallamala, Kadapa, and Tirumala in Andhra, extending to Tamil Nadu through Yelagiri, Jawadhu, Selverayan, Kalvarayan, and Kolli hills.
Subspecies.Notes: Kalrayan and Kolli hills population not sampled taxonomically but geographically closer to this population than _travancoreensis_. Thoppur pass is likely to be limit for this population.

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Goa and N Karnataka till Kalakkad in S Tamil Nadu mostly along the western slopes – also including spur hills in Tamil Nadu like Nilgiris, Palanis, and Varusanadu hills; presumably in Sirumalai and Alagarkoil hills as well.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Both this and the nominate subspecies occur in the W Ghats in Karnataka, presumably also in Wayanad (Kerala), on either side and may be intergrading. Populations in Sirumalai and Alagarkoil are likely this subspecies as that is the nearest proximal population. Intergradation zone with the nominate subspecies, if exists, would be around Moyar gorge.

Genus.Name: Erythrogenys
Genus.Author: Baker
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin Scientifique publié par l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de Saint-Pétersbourg

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Lowland Assam in forests south of Brahmaputra from Guwahati till E Assam and adjoining SE Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Sporadic north of Brahmaputra – near Dafla hills (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: Its distribution in Manas (Assam) and Miri hills (AR2001) not evaluated. The specimen of Godwin-Austen (1876) most certainly came from the terai region between Dirkang and Buroi rivers in present day Assam (not Dafla hills of Arunachal).

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _ferrugilatus_ Hodgson 1836 from Nepal is considered an intergrade of this with _haringtoni_ (see Biswas 1962, AR2001, RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir through Jammu, Himachal, adjoining Haryana, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal (Dafla hills).

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _erythrotis_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur.
Species.Distribution: Arunachal (Miri hills, Mishmi hills, and Namdapha), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH

Genus.Name: Stachyris
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _coei_ Ripley 1951 from Mishmi hills which is often considered intermediate between the nominate and _coltarti_ Harington 1913 (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, W and C Arunachal till Mishmi hills, and the adjoining Assam south of it.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: RA2012 recommends a review of subspecies in NE India.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Noa-Dihing valley and Patkai hills), E Assam, C Assam south of Brahmaputra, Nagaland, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _ravida_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizo hills; however, both _ravida_ and _spadix_ are sometimes treated as synonyms of _coltarti_ (see AR2001, H&M4).
Subspecies.Distribution: Meghalaya, Cachar, Tripura, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Mandelli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Species.Distribution: N Bengal and W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen & Walden
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Taxonomy: ZSI#7694 from Thonga, Manipur collected by Godwin-Austen is listed as another syntype.
Species.Distribution: E Arunachal from Mishmi hills, Udayak pass and Walong region, upper Noa-Dihing valley, Cachar, Nagaland, and Manipur.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: SE Arunachal in Kamlang and Namdapha; locally in E Assam.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Graminicola
Genus.Author: Jerdon
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.AlternativeNames: Indian Grass Babbler; Rufous-rumped Grassbird/Rufous-rumped Grass Babbler/Large Grass Warbler (incl. _G. striatus_ EL)
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of India; being a natural history of all the birds known to inhabit continental India: with descriptions of the species, genera, families, tribes, and orders, and a brief notice of such families as are not found in India, making it a manual of ornithology specially adapted for India
Species.Distribution: N Uttar Pradesh, SE Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Gampsorhynchus
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _ahomensis_ Koelz 1954 from Nichuguard, Naga hills.
Species.Distribution: N Bengal (historical), Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland (historical at least), Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Genus.Name: Schoeniparus
Genus.Author: Hume
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Dusky Green Tit Babbler, Yellow-throated Tit Babbler
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _delacouri_ Yen 1936, suggested as a new name for _cinerea_ Blyth.
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _garoensis_ Koelz 1951 from Tura Mountain, Garo hills, Meghalaya and _wagstaffei_ Wynne 1954 (new name for _brunneicauda_ Sharpe 1883) from Shillong, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Mandelli
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal and lower Dafla hills - both historical
Subspecies.Notes: No recent records from India, but occurs in Bhutan. Distribution in Dafla hills based on Godwin-Austen (1876) who mentioned it as common at 900m and listed under this rather than _collaris_ follows RA2012. No recent reports from Pakke, Nameri or lower Eaglenest.

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Arunachal and E Assam and historically from Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar report (AR2001) not verified but likely to be correct.

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _certus_ Koelz 1952 from Shillong Peak, Khasi hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Arunachal from Udayak pass and Walong region, Upper Noa-Dihing valley (Vijoynagar region), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Old records from Dafla hills (Godwin-Austen 1876) and Kobo (Baker 1913) in Arunachal mentioned in AR2001 not evaluated. Baker's work p.273 (referenced in AR2001) does not have this species, but p.263 has _Pellorneum mandelli_ (a Puff-throated Babbler _P. ruficeps_ subspecies, as evident from the comparative text with _P. r. minus_) from Kobo, which could have been misinterpreted as this species due to the shared taxon name _mandelli_. However, Godwin-Austen had collected specimens from Dafla hills. RA2012 mentions 'several' records north of Brahmaputra from Bhutan to Arunachal, and recommends further study as an undescribed taxon might be involved. Others include Choudhury (2003), from Eaglenest.

Genus.Name: Pellorneum
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Boreali-Americana; or the zoology of the northern parts of British America: containing descriptions of the objects of natural history collected on the late northern land expeditions under command of Captain Sir John Franklin, R.N. Part second, the birds

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Palakkad gap, accepted for convenience in AR2001 as its northern limit is incorrect as it also occurs in forests in the Palakkad gap, contiguously to N Kerala – birds with identical richness in plumage found there as well. Leeward side of W Ghats including the spur hills like Nilgiris have the nominate subspecies. Includes _granti_ Harington 1913 from Mynall, S Kerala.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India including Malabar region of Kerala.

Subspecies.Author: Swainson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Boreali-Americana; or the zoology of the northern parts of British America: containing descriptions of the objects of natural history collected on the late northern land expeditions under command of Captain Sir John Franklin, R.N. Part second, the birds
Subspecies.Distribution: C and S Peninsular India from extreme S Rajasthan and E Gujarat, C Indian highlands of Madhya Pradesh, S Jharkhand, S W Bengal, Chhattisgarh, N Telangana, W Ghats south till N Kerala; Deccan hillocks and transition region in Karnataka Ghats, Wayanad, Nilgiris, Biligirirangans, Mysuru, and Bengaluru regions; further south in the leeward side of the W Ghats in Tamil Nadu including the outcrops of Palani and Varusanadu hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Abdulali
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: As per Abdulali (1982), birds from Kurumbapatty at the base of Servarayan hills are intermediate between this and the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Ghats of Odisha, Andhra, E Telangana, CE Ghats from Nallamala to Tirumala, as well as SE Ghats till Servarayan and Kolli hills.
Subspecies.Notes: Kolli hills population tentatively assumed this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _jonesi_ Baker 1920 also from the same type locality.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, adjoining Punjab and Haryana, and extending till about W Uttarakhand (Garhwal region).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: W and E Uttarakhand (from Dehradun onwards), N Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, Sikkim, W and C Assam, and adjoining Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Deignan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Smithsonian Miscellaneous Collections
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes (see AR2001) included under _mandelli_ Blanford 1871.
Subspecies.Distribution: Meghalaya, Cachar, S Nagaland, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Mishmi hills; and presumably Siang and Lohit valley as well.

Subspecies.Author: Deignan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Smithsonian Miscellaneous Collections
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes (see AR2001) included under _mandelli_ Blanford 1871.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam, SE Arunachal, and N Naga hills.

Subspecies.Author: Deignan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Postilla
Subspecies.Distribution: Manipur valley.

Species.Author: Gould
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Species.Distribution: Brahmaputra plains in C and E Assam as well as adjoining Arunachal along the Dibang valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: W Assam (Manas), Arunachal and adjoining lowland Assam, and east till about Mishmi hills and Lohit valley.

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _nagaensis_ Godwin-Austen 1877 from Naga hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal, E Assam, locally in C Assam south of Brahmaputra, Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Manipur and Cachar records in AR2001 not traced.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Interestingly, _Brachypteryx cryptica_ Ripley 1980 from Noa-Dihing river, Arunachal was in fact this species. Probably the name _garoense_ Godwin-Austen 1874 may have priority (see Dickinson & Ciobis 2010); however, treated here as a synonym pending futher investigation.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Assam (Manas), C Assam (Guwahati and Kaziranga region at least), E Assam, Arunachal from Dafla hills, Siang valley, Mishmi hills, Lohit valley, and Noa-Dihing valley, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Laticilla
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Rufous-vented Prinia; Long-tailed Grass Babbler/Long-tailed Grass Warbler (incl. _L. cinerascens_)

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Indus plains, from W Jammu, W and C Punjab, NW Haryana (Sirsa region), and adjoining NW Rajasthan (Hanumangarh region). Locally in Dudhwa, Uttar Pradesh.

Species.Author: Walden
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Species.TypeLocality: (Dhubri, Border of Assam and West Bengal.)
Species.Taxonomy: Though treated as distinct from _L. burnesii_, the intermediate form _nipalensis_ Baral _et al._ 2008 in lowland Nepal, described as more closer to this species, demands a relook at the species limits.
Species.Distribution: Historically from W Assam (Dhubri) but mostly concentrated along the Brahmaputra and its tributaries in C and E Assam apart from pockets of E Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: AMNH, YPM

Genus.Name: Malacocincla
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _amabilis_ Koelz 1952 from Nichuguard, Naga hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Abu), Surat Dangs in E Gujarat, NW Ghats till about Goa, C Indian highlands of NE Maharashtra, C and E Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, adjoining W Bengal, NE Ghats of Odisha, NE Andhra, and CE Ghats till Tirumala hills; sporadically in SE Ghats (Jawadhu, Kalvarayan, Servarayan, and Kolli hills), Melagiri, Male Mahadeshwara, and Biligirirangan hills.

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.Taxonomy: The nominate subspecies occurs in Nepal while _nigriceps_ occurs west of it and _bayleyi_ occurs east. It is not definitely known whether the intergradation zones of the nominate subspecies with _nigriceps_ or _bayleyi_ straddle India or not – but that is likely to be the case.

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: E Uttarakhand (Kumaon).
Subspecies.Notes: Most of its range is in Nepal but listed here based on the specimens in the catalogue of UMMZ, YPM, and FMNH. Photographs from the Pithoragarh region taken in the field also have features similar to Nepal birds. There are also specimens from N Bengal (Darjeeling) but the photographs from the field suggest this population might be an intergrade with _bayleyi_.

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen
Species.Taxonomy: Whether _daflaensis_ subspecies should be treated as a subspecies of _A. nipalensis_ or _A. waldeni_ is an open question; we include it under the latter. Intergrades occur in Dafla hills (RA2012) and most photographs difficult to assign safely to one or the other. Subspecies status of other populations in Arunachal is also uncertain. Mishmi hill birds are included under _daflaensis_ by RA2012 though the photographs show birds that are markedly different and closer to the nominate subspecies. SE Arunachal birds has been suggested as an undescribed subspecies (Srinivasan _et al._ 2008), but it is uncertain whether those are age-related variations.

Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal (Dafla hills) as well as elsewhere – Talle Valley (C Arunachal), Siang valley (NE Arunachal), Mishmi hills (NE Arunachal), and SE Arunachal (Upper Noa-Dihing valley).

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis

Species.Author: Athreya
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Indian Birds
Species.Taxonomy: No type specimen was collected for its description. However, a few feathers were collected and deposited in the BNHS and its registration number is provided as the holotype.
Species.Distribution: Restricted to Eaglenest with just one report each from Bomdila and Shergaon; both still in the immediate neighbourhood.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Icones avium, or figures and descriptions of new and interesting species of birds from various parts of the globe [world]
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal till Lohit valley.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _khasium_ Koelz 1952 from Liatylngkot, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Noa-Dihing valley), Patkai hills, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Patkai hills included in the range of the nominate subspecies in AR2001. However, Patkai's northern extremity is in Noa-Dihing valley – and hence it should be this subspecies there as well.

Genus.Name: Argya
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin des Sciences Naturelles et de Géologie
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Sykes
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Throughout Indian peninsula from Punjab, adjoining Himachal, W through Rajasthan (locally in Thar), Gujarat (except Kachchh), east through Gangetic plains till Bihar and S W Bengal (historically), Jharkhand, W Odisha, and south till southern tip of Tamil Nadu (except W coastal plains.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Moore
Species.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _arcana_ Koelz 1954 from Karong, Manipur.
Species.Distribution: NW Bihar (historically), N Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of W and C Assam and sporadically in E Assam, Cachar (historically), and Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _poecilorhyncha_ Lafresnaye 1840 from the northern slopes of Nilgiris.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from about Mumbai, south till about Palakkad gap; including eastern extensions in the transition zone in C Karnataka, through Nilgiris to Biligirirangan hills, Servarayan, Kolli, and Pachamalai hills in SE Ghats. Also, locally in SW coastal plains and midlands of Malabar region.

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats roughly south of Palakkad gap till Kalakkad in the south; as well as adjoining midlands (locally) extending east through Palani hills to Sirumalai hills as well as Varusanadu hills.

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _orientalis_ in Kachchh.
Subspecies.Distribution: Punjab, Rajasthan (locally in Thar), and Kachchh.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Dumont
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _terricolor_ Hodgson 1836 of Nepal.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gangetic plains of N India from about Yamuna river valley, through Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, N Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, W Bengal, extending at least till C Assam, and W Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Presence in Khasi hills (E Meghalaya) and E Assam not validated.

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian ornithology, containing fifty figures of new, unfigured and interesting species of birds, chiefly from the south of India
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _orissae_ Jerdon 1847 of Odisha and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gujarat, C India including Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, S Deccan region through C and E Maharashtra, Telangana, locally in C and E Karnataka, Andhra, SE Ghats of Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu in the eastern slopes of W Ghats and SE Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian ornithology, containing fifty figures of new, unfigured and interesting species of birds, chiefly from the south of India
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _orientalis_ in the east of its range.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW India from about Goa and NW Karnataka through Kerala and SW Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _malabaricus_ in Goa.
Subspecies.Distribution: NW India from Surat Dangs, W Maharashtra, and Goa.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian ornithology, containing fifty figures of new, unfigured and interesting species of birds, chiefly from the south of India
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _polioplocamus_ Obserholser 1990, which is a new name for _griseus_ Gmelin from 'Coromandel Coast, India'.
Subspecies.Distribution: Southern peninsular India from about SW Maharashtra (Kolhapur region), N Karnataka, Telangana, NE Maharashtra (Chandrapur region), SE Chhattisgarh (Bastar region), S Odisha, and NE Andhra – all the way south till Kanyakumari (Tamil Nadu).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: W Kashmir, W Jammu, and extreme E Punjab.
Subspecies.Notes: When Abdulali & D'Cunha (1982) resurrected this subspecies, they did not find any specimens from India, boundary being Jhelum river, which clearly fixes the boundary of BNHS specimens as outside India. However, there is a specimen from Kashmir (#1886.10.1.8188) in NHMUK identified as this subspecies; and hence included here.

Subspecies.Author: Dumont
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Dictionnaire des sciences naturelles, dans lequel on traite méthodiquement des différens êtres de la nature, considérés soit en eux-mêmes, d'après l'état actuel de nos connoissances, soit relativement à l'utilité qu'en peuvent retirer la médecine, l'agriculture, le commerce et les arts. Suivi d'une biographie des plus célèbres naturalistes ...Par plusieurs professeurs du Jardin du Roi, et des principales écoles de Paris
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan tracts of Kashmir, Jammu, extending through Punjab and adjoining Himachal, entire N India including Gangetic plains, Rajasthan (including Thar), Gujarat, C India, extending east till W Bengal, NW Odisha, NW Ghats, Deccan, E Ghats, E coastal plains, and sporadically along the eastern side of SW Ghats.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Report from Lakshadweep not evaluated.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Distribution: Indus plains of Jammu, Punjab, and adjoining lowland Himachal.
Subspecies.Notes: May occur in W Gujarat. A good specimen series (BHNS#15964–69) from Jagadhri, Haryana.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Gangetic plains from Haryana and Uttarakhand, Delhi region, adjoining Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, N Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, W Bengal, Brahmaputra plains of Assam, E Arunachal, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura; also, locally in E Odisha.

Genus.Name: Garrulax
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _toxostomina_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Walong region and Noa-Dihing valley), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, W and C Arunachal, W and C Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: E Arunachal (Mishmi hills, Lohit valley, and Namdapha) and adjoining E Assam.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact limits of the subspecies unclear.

Subspecies.Author: Hardwicke
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir (locally – Rajouri district), E Himachal (from about Shimla), Uttarakhand, N Bengal. Assam, and Arunachal – east till Mishmi hills and Lohit valley.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Lohit valley birds tentatively included here.

Subspecies.Author: Reichenow
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _hardwickii_ Ticehurst 1926 from Naga hills.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Noa-Dihing valley), E Assam, C Assam hills south of Brahmaputra, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Ianthocincla

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _grosvenori_ Ripley 1950 from Rekcha, Dailekh district, W Nepal.

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Mishmi hills birds assumed to be this taxon.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam (locally – e.g., Manas), W Arunachal (Dafla hills), C Arunachal (Miri hills, historical), and E Arunachal (Mishmi hills).

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam (Margherita), Cachar, and Manipur.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Zoological Society of India
Subspecies.Taxonomy: The entire Koelz collection from the type locality is in UMMZ and hence so would be the type specimen. Exact holotype number not obtained.
Subspecies.Distribution: Meghalaya (Garo, Khasi, and Jaintia hills).

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Contributions from the Institute for Regional Exploration
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes (e.g., RA2012) included within _assamensis_ Hartert 1909.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Namdapha), Patkai hills, and E Nagaland.
Subspecies.Notes: Namdapha birds listed here as USNM#585892 is from Miao.

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Listed for Meghalaya and Cachar (AR2001), but not verified here.

Subspecies.Author: Koelz
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Distribution: N Uttarakhand – from Chopta till Nepal border.

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal (Dafla hills in the west and Mishmi hills in the east).
Subspecies.Notes: Possibly more populations exist in Arunachal (Upper Subansiri mentioned in AR2001); Mishmi population tentatively included here.

Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen

Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM

Species.Author: Jardine & Selby

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen

Subspecies.Author: Godwin-Austen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland and Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar reports not verified. Has also been sight reported from Meghalaya and Mizoram but better documentation is desirable.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Included here are _uropygialis_ Bonaparte 1850 from Assam and _waddelli_ Ogilvie-Grant 1894 from Rungeet (Rangit) river, Sikkim. The population in India, or sometimes only of NE hill states, assigned to _melanotis_ Blyth 1843 of Arakan, Myanmar. However, its validity doubtful as the differences are mainly individual variations (RA2012). Regional population treated here as a single subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Finn
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.OriginalPublicationReference: Vol. 71, Part 2, N° 3 p.125 (in text), pl. VII
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _oribata_ Koelz 1954 from Blue Mountain, Mizoram (UMMZ#149506–510).
Species.Distribution: Phawngpui in Mizoram only.
Species.Specimens: UMMZ

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal (east till about Tenga).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Records from Cachar unverified.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson

Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal till about Mishmi hills and Lohit valley.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Khasi hills (Meghalaya).
Subspecies.Notes: No recent reports.

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _biswasi_ Koelz 1953 from Kohima, Nagaland.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Noa-Dihing valley), Nagaland, and Manipur.

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _salimalii_ Deignan 1954 from Kotgarh, Himachal.

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen & Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Author: Rippon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Walong region (NE Arunachal).
Subspecies.Notes: Walong population almost certainly this greener-backed subspecies while the birds found in Mayodia and Upper Dibang valley could also belong here, but considered tentatively as _sikkimensis_. A thorough investigation required.

Genus.Name: Tichodroma
Genus.Author: Illiger
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Prodromus systematis mammalium et avium: additis terminis zoographicis utriusque classis, eorumque versione germanica

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, through Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal as well as adjacent N Assam. Non-breeding: At times descending to adjacent foothills at least and plains till Delhi as well as some NE hill states like Nagaland and Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: See Vyas (2019) for reports around Delhi.

Genus.Name: Sitta

Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _simplex_ Koelz 1939 from Londa, NW Karnataka.

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Ogilvie-Grant
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Species.Author: Jardine & Selby
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of ornithology
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _australis_ Koelz 1952 from Nagaland (recognised by AR2001) and _lushaiensis_ Koelz 1952 from Mizoram, latter treated differently in RA2012.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Lesson

Disjunctly in the CW Ghats and SE Ghats from N Karnataka, through Kodagu and E Wayanad, south till Nilgiris, extending east into Biligirirangans, Melagiri, and Servarayan hills; NE Ghats of S Odisha and NE Andhra.

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _infima_ Ripley 1950 (E Uttarakhand and W Nepal) as well as _limes_ Meinertzhagen 1922 (Gilgit and Kashmir).
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Ladakh (straggler), Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand – sporadic in adjacent Punjab, Haryana, and N Uttar Pradesh.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth

Subspecies.Author: Hume

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte

Subspecies.Notes: See Purkayastha & Viswanathan (2020). Reports elsewhere, including Chennai (historical, subspecies unknown), not investigated.

Subspecies.Author: Hume

Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of Interview, Long, Nicholson, Inglis, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Alexandra, Tarmugli, Boat, Rutland, and N Cinque Is.

Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is., C Nicobar group (Teresa, Bompoka, Trinket, Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal Is), S Nicobar group (Meroe, Treis, and Great Nicobar Is.

Genus.Name: Gracula
