Subspecies.Author: Whistler & Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: AR2001 treats it as a synonym of _intermedia_.
Subspecies.Distribution: S W Bengal, Jharkhand (once), NE Ghats of Odisha, S Chhattisgarh, and NE Andhra.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM

Subspecies.Author: Hay
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Beavan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _halibrecta_ Oberholser 1926 from S Nicobar Is. group but Abdulali (1967) argued for recognition of this subspecies; C Nicobar Is. group birds also distinct, but no subspecies named (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Narcondam Is., N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of Ross, Interview, Long, Inglis, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Rutland, C Nicobar Is. group (historical), Little (historical) and Great Nicobar Is.

Species.Author: Cuvier
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Le règne animal distribué d'aprés son organisation, pour servir de base a l'histoire naturelle des animaux et d'introduction à l'anatomie comparée. Nouvelle édition, revue et augmentée
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from south of Goa and N Karnataka till southern tip of the W Ghats – also Biligirirangans and sporadic in transition zone in Deccan Karnataka and sometimes even further east.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, MYS

Genus.Name: Sturnus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Sirsa (NW Haryana) and Bettiah (Bihar); but probably more widely in the intervening northern plains.
Subspecies.Notes: May occur in E Rajasthan as well. Specimen BNHS #6713 is considered here as from Bihar.

Subspecies.Author: Finsch
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, N and C Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat; sporadically in C India, stragglers to S Indian states, and once near Minicoy Is., Lakshadweep.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: See Whistler & Kinnear (1933), Phillips (1964), Ghorpade (1974), Sashikumar _et al._ (2011) for some vagrant reports; which are parked here for now.

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N India – including Kashmir, Himachal, Bihar, but also W Bengal, Assam plains, Arunachal, Cachar, and Manipur.
Subspecies.Notes: Recent reports from NE India presumed to be of this E Palearctic breeding subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _S nitens_ Hume 1873. Though _indicus_ Blyth 1843 was an earlier name available for this population, Biswas (1963) argued that Blyth's _indicus_ was not identifiable to any subspecies. The original specimens based on which Blyth described _indicus_ are also not available for re-examination.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Kashmir. Non-breeding: N Indian subcontinent.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Non-breeding range not well-established.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Etawah (Uttar Pradesh).
Subspecies.Notes: Can occur in Kachchh. The specimen from Etawah (NHMUK#1887.7.1.33) is from the Hume's collection.

Genus.Name: Pastor
Genus.Author: Temminck
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Manuel d'ornithologie, ou tableau systématique des oiseaux qui se trouvent en Europe (etc.)

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Entire Indian subcontinent from Gilgit, Ladakh and Kashmir where mostly on passage to entire N C, W, and S India; reaching as far as W Bengal in the east and not reported any further. Also, Andaman Is. apart from getting reported on ships in the Bay of Bengal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Genus.Name: Agropsar
Genus.Author: Oates
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Birds. 1st ed.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Winter: Andaman Is. – sporadic in Narcondam Is., Car Nicobar and Great Nicobar Is., S Peninsula (Kerala and Tamil Nadu) and W Bengal (once).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK

Species.Author: Forster
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Indische Zoologie oder systematischer Beschreibungen seltener und unbekannter Thiere aus Indien (etc.)
Species.Taxonomy: Follows H&M4 for attributing it to Johann Reinhold Foster who is the author of the book (contra Thomas Pennant who authored the chapter on zoology).
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Nameri (Assam) and Indira Bazar (Little Andaman Is.).

Genus.Name: Gracupica
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Traité d'Ornithologie, ou Tableau Méthodique des ordres, sous-ordres, familles, tribus, genres, sous-genres et races d'oiseaux

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _dehrae_ Baker 1925 from Dehradun.
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire N subcontinent from Jammu, Punjab, south through Delhi, west till about Ahmedabad region in Gujarat, south till about Goa, NE Karnataka, Telangana, Andhra, reaching Chennai region; extending east through Gangetic plains to W Bengal, S Sikkim, W and C Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar, adjoining W Nagaland, Tripura, and adjoining Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Has certainly undergone a range expansion to west and south. However, some of the reports from S India could relate to escapees while some of the population in Maharashtra and further south could have been naturalised population from introduced stocks (see RA2012).

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Postilla
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies not always recognised (Baveja _et al._ 2020, IOC) and treated as a junior synonym of the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam and E Arunachal – till about Mishmi hills in the west.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact western limits not worked out; W Nagaland birds could also belong to this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Manipur valley.

Genus.Name: Sturnia
Genus.Author: Lesson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle générale et particulière des mammifères et des oiseaux découverts après la mort de Buffon. Complément des oeuvres de Buffon, ou histoire naturelle des animaux rares découverts par les naturalistes et les voyageurs depuis la mort de Buffon. Oiseaux

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I [pars I]
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Punchakkari, Thiruvananthapuram (Kerala).

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _sylvestris_ Koelz 1939 from Lucknow.
Species.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, south through entire N India, west till Gujarat, south till tip of the peninsula, and east till W Bengal; also, Mizoram (once).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Along the Himalayan foothills from Jammu, through Himachal, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, C India from E Rajasthan, Gujarat (except Kachchh), through Madhya Pradesh, N Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Odisha, Jharkhand, and E India – including W Bengal, Sikkim, Brahmaputra plains of Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, and Tripura. Winter: Extending to the S peninsula along the W Ghats and W coastal plains, Deccan and E coastal plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, HYD, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: Winter distribution much larger than breeding distribution; but not all birds migrate.

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _assamica_ Koelz 1954 from Nichuguard, Naga hills based on range; contra AR2001 which includes it under the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Cachar, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Mizoram birds tentatively parked here.

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of Indian ornithology, containing fifty figures of new, unfigured and interesting species of birds, chiefly from the south of India
Species.Taxonomy: Not always recognised as distinct species from _S. malabarica_ (see HBW/BLI, H&M4). Zuccon _et al._ (2008) found shallow genetic divergence challenging the species status of this taxon.
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs (sporadic) through Mumbai region and further south till the tip of the SW Ghats; sporadic in Biligirirangans and Deccan transition zone of Karnataka sometimes reaching Belagavi, Hubballi, Davanagere, Mysuru and exceptionally to Bengaluru.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobars.

Subspecies.Author: Beavan
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of N Reef, Interview, Long, Henry Lawrance, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Tarmugli, Jolly Buoy, and Rutland Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Introduced in Kamorta (C Nicobars).

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Possibly a hybrid form as per AR2001. Investigation needed.
Subspecies.Distribution: Katchal Is. (C Nicobars, historically at least).
Subspecies.Notes: No recent reports of this small population.

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Sundarbans (W Bengal), Waithou (Manipur), and Shillong (Meghalaya).

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Dirang, Gelling, Walong, and near Hayuliang – all in Arunachal, and also from E Assam.

Genus.Name: Acridotheres

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Ladakh (sporadic), Kashmir, Jammu, south to the tip of the peninsula; west till Kachchh, and entire E and NE India; introduced in Andaman Is. (all main islands) and Nicobar Is. (all three groups).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Species.Distribution: Entire Indian subcontinent except S peninsula – from Kashmir, Jammu onwards west till Gujarat, east till Brahmaputra plains of Assam, Cachar, and Tripura; south till Maharashtra, C Chhattisgarh, WC Odisha – reports further south in Goa, N Karnataka, Telangana, and NE Andhra may relate to stragglers or escapees.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Wagler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Avium
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the foothills of Himalaya and adjoining plains of Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, N Punjab, N Haryana, Delhi region, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, E Madhya Pradesh, E Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, N and C Odisha, Jharkhand, W Bengal, Assam (W and C), adjoining Arunachal, Meghalaya, Cachar (except NE parts), and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: S Gujarat, W Maharashtra (Ghats and adjoining plateau), Goa, Karnataka (except NE), Andhra, SW Odisha, Kerala and Tamil Nadu (sporadic in SE plains).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Postilla
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam, E Arunachal, Nagaland, NE parts of Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Exact demarcation of the range and intergradation zone not worked out; Manipur and Mizoram birds tentatively parked here.

Species.Author: Godwin-Austen & Walden
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Breeding (?): Manipur valley (historically).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM

Species.Distribution: Summer: Himachal, Uttarakhand, and adjoining Punjab and Haryana. Winter: N Bengal, Sikkim, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and E Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, LKO

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Syntype (NHMUK #1844.12.27.1) from northern regions of Cachar not accepted here.
Species.Distribution: Kashmir (sporadic), Ladakh (sporadic), Himachal, N Uttarakhand, N Sikkim, and NW Arunachal (Sela).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Zoothera
Genus.Author: Vigors
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London

Species.Author: Seebohm
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Himachal till Arunachal. Winter: Also in Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Manipur (historical).

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _whiteheadi_ Baker 1913 and _simlaensis_ Baker 1924 from Shimla – both names for the W Himalayan population in AR2001 and RA2012 – however, Alström _et al._ (2016) found this population not diagnosable from the E Himalayan population.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Winter: Extending to Khasi hills (Meghalaya) and Manipur (historical) sporadically.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Species.Author: Alström et al.
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Avian Research
Species.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, MCZ, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.AlternativeNames: Lesser Brown Thrush, Dark-sided Ground Thrush
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _tenebrosa_ Koelz 1952 from Nichuguard, Nagaland.
Species.Distribution: C Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.AlternativeNames: Large Brown Thrush, Long-billed Ground Thrush

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _tenebricola_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur (historical), and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Holandre
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annuaire Statistique et Historique du Departement de la Moselle, pour l'Année 1825, publié par Verronais
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Dibrugarh (E Assam) and Namdapha (E Arunachal).

Species.Author: Latham
Species.AlternativeNames: Scaly Mountain Thrush, Small-billed Mountain Thrush, Small-billed Scaly Thrush

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Consistent colour variation in the birds in W Himalaya from the NE India ones; no subspecies ascribed though (RA2012). Praveen _et al._ (2023) could not establish the correct identity of BNHS#26346 and it may belong to _Z. d. socia_ Thayer and Bangs 1912, a taxon which is currently synonymised with the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Kashmir (historical), Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, W Arunachal, and Nagaland. Winter: Extending through the peninsula to Delhi region, Bharatpur, E Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh (Raipur, historical), S W Bengal, N Odisha as south as Maharashtra (Melghat in Amaravati and Kamptee in Nagpur); also, in NE India in Assam, Meghalaya, Cachar, Mizoram, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: W Ghats – sporadic in SW Maharashtra (once), Londa (once, historical) but more regularly from Shivamogga south through Nilgiris, Munnar, and Palani hills and further south in Cardomom, Pandalam, and Agasthyamala hills. Also reported from eastern extensions like Biligirirangans.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM

Genus.Name: Cochoa
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Himachal (sporadic), Uttarakhand (sporadic), N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _rothschildi_ Baker 1924 from Sikkim.
Species.Distribution: E Uttarakhand (historical), N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Genus.Name: Geokichla
Genus.Author: Müller
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Tijdschrift voor Natuurlijke Geschiedenis en Physiologie

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Porbandar (Gujarat), Sundarbans (S W Bengal), Manipur (historical), Port Blair and Chidiyatapu (both S Andaman Is.), Little Andaman Is., and Kamorta (C Nicobar Is.).
Subspecies.Notes: Apparently collected from Manipur by Hume, but the specimen has not been located in NHMUK. For other reports, subspecies assumed on range.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Mahabaleshwar (W Maharashtra) and Narcondam Is. only.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Summer: Himachal (sporadic), Uttarakhand, and N Bengal. Winter: Locally in S India – Nandi hills (Bengaluru), Chamundi hills (Mysure), Nilgiris and Servarayan hills in Tamil Nadu, and Munnar hills in Kerala. During migration, from W Ghats south of Bababudan hills till Agasthyamala hills as well as SE Ghats and E coastal plains. Also reported NE Ghats of Andhra, possibly wintering; also, from Kolkata and Garo hills during migration.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Latham
Species.AlternativeNames: Orange-headed Ground Thrush, White-throated Ground Thrush _G. c. cyanota_

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Himalayan foothills from Jammu, through Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, Arunachal, adjoining Assam, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram. Winter: W Himalayan population spreading to N plains, E Rajasthan, Bihar, W Bengal, Assam, and all NE hill states; sporadically in the rest of the peninsula in Odisha, Andhra, S Karnataka, W Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Jardine & Selby
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of ornithology
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _amadoni_ Biswas 1951 from Chanda, Central Provinces [=Madhya Pradesh].
Subspecies.Distribution: Mt. Abu (SW Rajasthan), Gujarat, C Indian highlands in Madhya Pradesh, E Maharashtra, and Chhattisgarh; NE Ghats from Odisha through N Andhra, CE Ghats, and SE Ghats; W Ghats and adjacent midlands and plains from Surat Dangs till S Kerala and Tamil Nadu; locally in Deccan.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of Landfall, Interview, Long, Outram, Nicholson, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Tarmugli, Boat, Jolly Buoy, and S Cinque Is.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: C Nicobar Is. (Tillanchong, Teresa, Bompoka, Trinket, Nancowry, Kamorta, and Katchal Is.), and Great Nicobar Is.

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Subspecies _courtoisi_ (Hartert 1919) of Anhui province, China and _aurimacula_ (Hartert 1910) of Hainan, China and C Indochina are similar, and can be eliminated only on morphometrics. However, the record from Narcondam Is. is tentatively treated here as _melli_ as it has the largest breeding range amongst all three and is also migratory.
Subspecies.Distribution: Narcondam Is. (once).
Subspecies.Notes: See Sivaperuman _et al._ (2022).

Genus.Name: Turdus
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Laubmann
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Namdapha (Arunachal).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Cabanis
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh (sporadic), Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Brehm
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Handbuch der Naturgeschichte aller Vögel Deutschlands

Subspecies.Author: Buturlin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Sistematicheskie Zametki o Ptitsakh Severnogo Kavkaza
Subspecies.Distribution: Four records – Leh (Ladakh), Bharatpur (E Rajasthan,), Harike (Punjab), and Delhi region.
Subspecies.Notes: Reports tentatively included here as it is the eastern most breeding population and the most likely ones to straggle to India during its migration to NE Africa.

Species.Author: Bonaparte
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported once in Narcondam Is.

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Winter: Locally in N plains – Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Bharatpur, and Lucknow; also in lower Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Distribution: CW Ghats as well as SW Ghats – from Bababudan hills, Kudremukh, Kodagu, Biligirirangans, Nilgiris, and Palakkad hills till the Palakkad gap.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Seebohm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with the nominate subspecies in Peechi and Nelliampathies.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats from roughly south of Peechi and Nelliampathies till the southern tip in Kalakkad; extending to outcrops of Palani and Varusanadu hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: de Lafresnaye
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Revue Zoologique, par la Société Cuvierienne
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Neilgherries, restricted to Kalhatti, N. Nilgiri plateau)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _mahrattensis_ Whistler & Kinnear (1932) from Mahabaleshwar, W Maharashtra and _spenci_ Whistler & Kinnear (1932) from Jeypore (NE Ghats), Odisha.
Subspecies.Distribution: Indian peninsular hills from E Rajasthan till Mt. Abu, C Indian highlands, NW Ghats of Gujarat, Maharashtra, and Goa as well as E Ghats. Winter: Extending locally in Deccan hillocks, CW and SW Ghats as well as locally in W coastal midlands and plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Species.Distribution: Winter: W Kameng (once) and Walong (once) – both in Arunachal.

Species.Author: Tickell
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _subbicolor_ Koelz 1954 from Mawphlang, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Species.Distribution: Summer: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal. Winter: Throughout the Peninsula from the lower Himalayan foothills, Delhi region, E Rajasthan, W Gujarat, Kathiawar (local), C India through Madhya Pradesh, N Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Jharkhand, and S W Bengal; NW and CW Ghats; NE and CE Ghats; locally in Deccan hillocks, south to S Karnataka and rarely in N Tamil Nadu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _protomomelas_ Cabanis 1867 from 'Himalaya'.
Species.Distribution: Assam, Arunachal, all NE hill states, sporadic in N Bengal, S W Bengal and once to Odisha (Kuldiha).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Salvadori
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annali del Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Genova
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _subpallidus_ Hume 1888 from 'Eastern hills, Manipur'.
Species.Distribution: Winter: Nagaland, Khasi hills (Meghalaya), Cachar (historical), Manipur, and Mizoram; N Bengal (sporadic).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: Winter: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, all NE hill states, Andaman Is.; sporadially during migration elsewhere in Uttarakhand, Gujarat, Maharashtra, W Bengal, Odisha, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, as well as Narcondam and Tillanchong Is (C Nicobar).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Przevalski
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Mongoliya i strana tangutov: trekhletneye puteshestviye v vostochnoy nagornoy Azii
Species.Distribution: Winter: E Himalaya from Sikkim, N Bengal, W and E Arunachal.

Species.Author: Seebohm
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Species.Taxonomy: Taxonomy of Gilgit birds need revision; intergrades with Common Blackbird _T. merula intermedius_ possible. N Sikkim and N Arunachal birds belong to putative subspecies _buddae_ R. & A. Meinertzhagen 1926 which is currently treated as a synonym.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Teesta Bazaar (N Bengal-Sikkim border) and Hanle (Ladakh).

Species.Author: Royle
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of the botany and other branches of the natural history of the Himalayan mountains, and of the flora of Cashmere
Species.Taxonomy: Includes here _albicollis_ Royle 1835 from 'Himalayas''.
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal; sporadically in Khasi hills (Meghalaya, historical), Nagaland, and Manipur (historical).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Gray & Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the specimens and drawings of mammalia and birds of Nepal and Thibet. Presented by B. H. Hodgson, Esq. to the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, W Assam, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Cachar and Tripura sight reports tentatively included under this subspecies – investigation needed.

Subspecies.Author: Verreaux
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouvelles Archives du Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris, Bulletin
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Sikkim, Arunachal, E Assam, Nagaland, and Mizoram; straggler to W Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: Listing here based on several photos from NE India and Sikkim; where intergrades also occur. ZSI #29433 from Nagaland not examined.

Species.Author: Jarocki
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Spis ptaków w gabinecie Zoologicznym Królewsko Warszawskiego Uniwersytetu znayduiących się a podług naynowszego systemu ustawionych
Species.Distribution: Winter: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, all NE hill states; sporadically into the plains and other parts of subcontinent – in Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Bharatpur, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Rajasthan, Gujarat, S W Bengal, and further south to Telangana (once, historical).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Winter: Sporadic in W Himalaya – from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; Regular in E Himalaya from N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal and sporadic further S in Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Tripura.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Species.Taxonomy: Intermediates with Naumann's Thrush reported across the Himalaya from Ladakh till E Arunachal (see Abhinav _et al._ 2022).
Species.Distribution: Winter: Arunachal – but reported sporadically from Ladakh, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, and Sikkim.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Manuel d'ornithologie, ou tableau systématique des oiseaux qui se trouvent en Europe (etc.)
Species.Taxonomy: Hybrids with Dusky Thrush more common in the region.
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Pure birds reported only from Mandala and Mishmi hills (both Arunachal).

Genus.Name: Muscicapa
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Winter: Has straggled to Goa, SE Ghats of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu, and E coastal Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, LKO
Subspecies.Notes: S Indian birds assumed to be this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Penard
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the New England Zoological Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _H[emichelidon]. fuliginosa_ Hodgson 1844 from Nepal.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states. Winter: Sporadically in S W Bengal, S Jharkhand and N Odisha; has straggled to Narcondam and S Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Records from eastern parts of India assumed to be this subspecies.

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _russata_ Koelz 1954 from Kohima, Nagaland.
Species.Distribution: Summer: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Meghalaya, Cachar, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram. Has straggled to S W Bengal, and Narcondam Is.
Species.Specimens: ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Older name _latirostris_ no longer in circulation after Mlíkovský (2012). Regional subspecies _poonensis_ is sometimes synonymised with the nominate subspecies, but see RA2012 why it needs to be recognised. Listing nominate in museums probably follows the older taxonomy but the nominate might be occurring in NE India or Andaman & Nicobar Is. during its passage migration.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himachal (probably till Jammu and Ladakh), Uttarakhand, N Bengal, and Sikkim; disjunctly in peninsular Indian hills including C Indian highlands, W Ghats, and possibly E Ghats. Non-breeding: Most of the S peninsula in regions south of C Indian highlands, Assam, and NE hill states; also, Andaman, Narcondam, Barren, Nicobar Is. (all groups), and Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Layard
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _khosrovi_ Koelz 1954 from Aizawl, Mizoram.
Species.Distribution: Summer: Sikkim, Arunachal, adjoining Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram. Winter: Gujarat, W Ghats from Surat Dangs south till the southern tip including the midlands of SW India. On passage, mostly in the intervening regions in E and EC India from S W Bengal till Tamil Nadu.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Adumbratiunculæ. Avium variarum praecedenti elencho insertarum, sed quæ in Systemate Naturæ Illustr. Linnæi nondum extant

Subspecies.Author: Poche
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _sibirica_ Neumann 1900.
Subspecies.Distribution: Kachchh.
Subspecies.Notes: RA2012 suggests this may subspecies occur. UMMZ #80180 (Himachal Pradesh) listed as this subspecies has not been examined and may not be correct.

Subspecies.Author: Snigirevski
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Butalis grisola var. pallida_ Zarudny 1903.
Subspecies.Distribution: Non-breeding: Ladakh, W Rajasthan and Gujarat during passage migration (mostly autumn but sporadically spring as well); but also in Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Delhi region, E Rajasthan, NW Maharashtra, and exceptionally from S W Bengal, Goa, W Karnataka, Kerala, S Tamil Nadu, and Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Notes: See Abhinav _et al._ (2022) for spring records.

Subspecies.Author: Portenko
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Trudy Zoologicheskogo Instituta, Akademiya Nauk SSSR
Subspecies.Distribution: Chidiyatapu (S Andaman Is.).
Subspecies.Notes: This subspecies breeds in SE Altai east to SE Transbaikalia and N Mongolia which most likely is passing through India during migration. Andaman record tentatively listed under this subspecies.

Genus.Name: Cercotrichas
Genus.Author: Boie
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Die Vögel Ost-Afrikas

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Manuel d'ornithologie, ou tableau systématique des oiseaux qui se trouvent en Europe (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Ménétries
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue raisonné des objets de zoologie recueillis dans un voyage au Caucase et jusqu'aux frontières actuelles de la Perse
Subspecies.Distribution: W Rajasthan and Kachchh during passage migration but straggling to Jammu, Punjab, Delhi region, C and S Rajasthan, as well as rest of Gujarat.

Genus.Name: Copsychus
Genus.Author: Wagler
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Avium
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Latham
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _munda_ Van Tyne & Koelz 1936 from Bhadwar, Kangra, Himachal and _lucknowensis_ Koelz 1939 from Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan foothills from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand through Indo-Gangetic plains till about W Bihar; Rajasthan, Gujarat, and Madhya Pradesh south till about Tapti river.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Lesson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Voyage aux Indes Orientales par le Nord de l'Europe, les provinces du Caucase, la Géorgie, l'Arménie et la Perse (etc.). Zoologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _stuartbakeri_ Koelz 1939 from Bodhgaya, Bihar.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Bihar, Jharkhand, N Odisha, and W Bengal.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler & Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergradation zone not completely worked out – Tapti and Krishna rivers as the northern and southern boundaries assigned for convenience; northeastern boundary uncertain.
Subspecies.Distribution: C India from Tapti river, Maharashtra (except SW), E Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, C and S Odisha, Telangana, and NE Andhra roughly till about Krishna river.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _ptymatura_ Vieillot 1818 from 'Le Bengale' = Pondicherry [=Puducherry] and _rufiventer_ Swainson 1832 from 'Le Bengale' = Pondicherry [=Puducherry].
Subspecies.Distribution: S Peninsula from SW Maharashtra, Karnataka, S Andhra, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire India – from Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, west till Rajasthan, and Gujarat; sporadic in Thar and Rann; entire NE India and south till about Karnataka and N Tamil Nadu roughly till Kaveri river.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Sclater
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Kerala, C and S Tamil Nadu roughly south of Kaveri river.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is, as well as islets of Paget, N Reef, Ross (in N Andaman), Buchanan, Long, Outram, Havelock, Neil, Ross (Netaji), Tarmugli, Alexandra, Red Skin, Boat, Jolly Buoy, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Author: Scopoli
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Surat Dangs, Khandesh, W Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, and W Tamil Nadu; extending further east along the SE Ghats till about Kaveri river including Biligirirangans.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _indicus_ Baker 1924, which was previously the name for the N Indian population (AR2001, RA2012, H&M4); but now treated as a synonym of _macrourus_ which also includes the SE Asian population.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan foothills from about SE Himachal, Chandigarh region, through Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, and all NE hill states; also in E India from S W Bengal, Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, E Madhya Pradesh, E Maharashtra, adjoining Telangana, E Ghats of Andhra, SE Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu till about Kolli and Pachamalai hills.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is as well as islets of Interview, Long, Spike, Havelock, Neil, Tarmugli, Alexandra, Jolly Buoy, and Rutland Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ

Genus.Name: Leucoptilon
Genus.Author: Sangster, Alström, Gaudin & Olsson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Zootaxa
Genus.Taxonomy: Genus sometimes not recognised and treated under _Cyornis_.

Species.Author: Müller
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Tijdschrift voor Natuurlijke Geschiedenis en Physiologie

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal (Namdapha region) and E Assam (Dihing-Patkai region); rarely in other localities in lowland E Arunachal.

Genus.Name: Sholicola
Genus.Author: Robin, Vishnudas, Gupta, Rheindt, Hooper, Ramakrishnan & Reddy
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: BMC Evolutionary Biology

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.AlternativeNames: Nilgiri Shortwing, Rufous-bellied Shortwing, Nilgiri Blue Robin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: CW and SW Ghats – from Bababudan hills and Kudremukh in CW Ghats of Karnataka through Kodagu, Wayanad, Nilgiris and Muthikulam hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, LKO

Species.Author: Blanford
Species.AlternativeNames: White-bellied Blue Robin, White-bellied Shortwing; Ashambu Sholakili _S [a.] ashambuensis_

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: ZSI#35534 from Palani Hills, Tamil Nadu listed as Holotype in ZSI register must be another Syntype.
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats from Palani, Munnar, and Grass hills and further south sparingly in Cardamom hills; also, in Varusanadu and Pandalam hills till Devarmala in the south – not reported further south till Aryankavu pass.
Subspecies.Notes: Not reported definitively from Nelliampathies though it lies south of the Palakkad gap.

Subspecies.Author: Robin et al.
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: BMC Evolutionary Biology
Subspecies.Distribution: SW Ghats, south of Aryankavu pass in Ashambu hills including Shendurney (Pandimotta), Kulathupuzha (Chemmunji), Peppara (Pandipath), and Neyyar (Agasthyamala) in Kerala and Kalakkad-Mundanthurai and Mahendragiri in Tamil Nadu.

Genus.Name: Niltava
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _pangpui_ Koelz 1954 from Sangau, Mizoram.
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram. Straggler to S W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Burton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: E Himachal, adjoining Punjab, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, and Sikkim. Straggler to S W Bengal.

Subspecies.Author: McClelland
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with the nominate subspecies in N Bengal and Sikkim (AR2001).
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Ticehurst
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya of Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, and adjoining Punjab and Haryana.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The India Review and Journal of Foreign Science and the Arts
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram. Straggler to S W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Salvadori
Species.AlternativeNames: Rufous-bellied Blue Flycatcher, Vivid Niltava incl. _N. vivida_ EL
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annali del Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Genova
Species.Distribution: Breeding: NE Arunachal (east from Siang). Non-breeding: Reported from E Assam, Meghalaya, and Mizoram (last two historical only).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ

Genus.Name: Cyanoptila
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Weigold
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Abhandlungen und Berichte des Königlichen Zoologischen und Anthropologisch-Ethnographischen Museums zu Dresden
Subspecies.Distribution: Non-breeding: Sporadic in the W Ghats from Mumbai region till SC Kerala and Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Unclear on which subspecies, but the continental breeding subspecies is more likely.

Species.Author: Thayer & Bangs
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the Museum of Comparative Zoology
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Only reported from Middle Andaman.

Genus.Name: Eumyias
Genus.Author: Cabanis
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Museum Heineanum. Verzeichniss der orithologischen Sammlung des Oberamtmann Ferdinand Heine

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Taxonomy: Syntypes also listed in ZSI register (ZSI#35480-81).
Species.Distribution: CW Ghats in Bababudan hills and Kudremukh extending south through Kodagu and all along SW Ghats till Kalakkad; includes eastern spurhills of Nilgiris, Biligirirangans, and Palanis.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Swainson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Naturalist's Library
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _Muscicapa melanops_ Vigors 1832.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Himalaya from Gilgit in the west till Arunachal in the east; as well as hills of Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram. Non-breeding: Entire country till the southern tip of the peninsula as well as entire NE India; straggler to Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Genus.Name: Anthipes
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Some birds in E Arunachal is intermediate (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal till about Lohit valley.

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Namdapha birds temporarily placed here.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura.

Genus.Name: Cyornis
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: W Ghats from about Mumbai region all the way south till Kanyakumari district (Tamil Nadu); eastern extensions limited to certain parts of the transition zone in Karnataka, Nilgiris, and the Palani hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, W and C Assam, adjoining W Arunachal, Meghalaya, and Tripura.

Subspecies.Author: Madarász
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zeitschrift für die gesammte Ornithologie
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Include _saturatior_ Robinson & Kinnear 1927 from Dibrugarh, Assam.
Subspecies.Distribution: E Assam, E Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: AR2001 includes Cachar and Mizoram in the range of the nominate subspecies; but treated here under this subspecies on range; intergradation zone unclear.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _C tickelliae_ in NE Andhra and Price (1979) reported that the _tickelliae_ has completely replaced this in NE Andhra. Though intergradation is limited to a thin contact zone in E Ghats, this has lead to questioning the species status of both Tickell's Blue and Pale-chinned Flycatchers (see RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Ghats from N Odisha till NE Andhra.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states. Rare or local in W Himalaya – limted to Garhwal in Uttarakhand (historical) and Kinnaur in E Himachal.

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: True taxonomic status of N Bengal and Sikkim breeders unresolved (Singh _et al._ 2019); but tentatively parked here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Kashmir, through Jammu, Himachal and Uttarakhand; also in N, Bengal and Sikkim. Non-breeding: S W Bengal, W Ghats from about Mumbai region till southern tip in Kanyakumari district; also, in E Ghats from Odisha through Andhra, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu. Widely in passage elsewhere.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Salvadori
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annali del Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Genova
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Suggested as belonging to _C. hainanus_ (Singh _et al._ 2019) but more evidence needed from regions of contact. Low-altitude breeding populations in NE India considered this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Notes: Exact western limits of this subspecies unclear; birds with features of this subspecies occur sparingly in W Himalaya as well as in S India (during winter).

Subspecies.Author: Robinson & Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Singh _et al._ (2019) suggested the high-altitude breeding population in NE Indian hills to be this subspecies. More investigation warranted as songs overlap.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Arunachal – but historically reported from Sikkim, E Assam, Cachar, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, AMNH

Subspecies.Author: Harington
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: E Arunachal, E Assam (C Assam once), Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Type specimen by Fraser listed as the year 1844 in ZSI register.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sub-Himalayan foothills from Kashmir, Jammu through Himachal, Uttarakhand and adjoining states in the plains, Delhi region, Gangetic plains till about extreme west of W Bengal; E Rajasthan, Gujarat, C Indian highlands, Odisha, and entire S India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM, MYS, HYD, LKO

Species.Author: Richmond
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Species.Distribution: Great and Little Nicobar Is. (S Nicobars group).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI

Genus.Name: Brachypteryx
Genus.Author: Horsfield
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Linnean Society of London
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum
Genus.Taxonomy: For dating as 1821 (contra 1822), follows Raphael (1970) where the Volume 3 Part 1 was published in May 1821.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: N Bengal and Sikkim; NE Arunachal from Mishmi hills till Upper Noa-Dihing valley, and E Assam.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, USNM

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and adjacent Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: La Touche
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not recognised by AR2001. Exact boundaries of the subspecies not mapped. Includes _geokichla_ Koelz 1952 from Karong, Manipur.
Subspecies.Distribution: SE Arunachal, E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Sporadic or local in W Himalaya – reported from Himachal and Uttarakhand; E Himalaya from N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, E Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM

Genus.Name: Heteroxenicus
Genus.Author: Sharpe
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Follow AR2001 and Sharpe (1883) in listing type locality as Sikkim (contra Nepal).
Subspecies.Distribution: Dodital (Uttarakhand, historical), N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and Khonoma (Nagaland, once).
Subspecies.Notes: Altitudinal movements not mapped and winter quarters little known.

Genus.Name: Larvivora
Genus.Author: Hodgson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _angamea_ Koelz 1952 from Tekhuba [=Tekhubama], Nagaland
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and Nagaland. Winter: W Ghats from Surat Dangs till the southern tip in Kalakkad, also SE Ghats, locally in Deccan hillocks in Karnataka and Telangana – as well as in Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram. During migration, elsewhere in the intervening subcontinent including Gujarat, C India, NE Ghats, W Bengal, and N plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N Bengal and Cachar. Sporadic elsewhere in Himachal, Uttarakhand, Arunachal, Manipur, Maharashtra, and S Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: See Gassah & Ismavel (2019).

Genus.Name: Luscinia
Genus.Author: Forster
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: A synoptical catalogue of British birds; intended to identify the species mentioned by different names in several catalogues already extant

Subspecies.Author: Gray & Gray
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the specimens and drawings of mammalia and birds of Nepal and Thibet. Presented by B. H. Hodgson, Esq. to the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, N, Himachal, N Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal. Winter: Also straggling to Manipur and Mizoram.

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India, as a winter visitor or passage migrant, from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, east at least till W Bengal, and south till coastal Kerala and NW Tamil Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Zarudny
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Materialy k Poznaniiu Fauny i Flory Rossiyskaya Imperiya, Otdel Zool.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Maharashtra – sporadically elsewhere in the subcontinent.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Sushkin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Spisok i raspredelenie ptits Russkogo Altaia i blizhaishikh chastei Severo-Zapadnoi Mongolii: s opisaniem novykh ili maloizvestnykh form
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Asifabad (Telangana), Haryana, Delhi, Maharashtra, and Cachar.
Subspecies.Notes: Range as per the specimens mentioned in AR2001. However, see Abdulali (1965) on confusion as to which subspecies each of the specimens (BNHS#3133,#3139,#16542,#16543,#16545,#22247,#23254) in BNHS belongs to. Situation not analysed further and RA2012 followed here in listing the subspecies as tentative.

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Trans-Himalayan regions of Gilgit, Baltistan, Ladakh, and Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM
Subspecies.Notes: Winter range uncertain (RA2012); specimens from Gujarat and Rajasthan mentioned in AR2001.

Genus.Name: Myophonus
Genus.Author: Temminck
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Mt. Abu, C Indian highlands of Madhya Pradesh, N and E Maharashtra, and Chhattisgarh; NW Ghats of Odisha and NE Andhra, W Ghats from Surat Dangs in the north till Kalakkad in the osuth; SE and CE Ghats, and locally in Deccan hillocks.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, MYS, LKO

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Deliciae Florae et Faunae Insubricae

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _euterpe_ Koelz 1943 from Mawphlang, Khasi hills, Meghalaya. The correct spelling of the protonym genus is _Myophonus_ and not _Myiophoneus_.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand and adjoining Punjab, Haryana, N Uttar Pradesh, and N Bihar but also straggling to NE Rajasthan; N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Arunachal (Walong region).
Subspecies.Notes: BNHS#16763 from Tezu, Mishmi hills, Arunachal listed as this subspecies. See Sharma _et al._ (2014).

Species.Author: Vigors
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as monotypic (IOC).

Species.Author: Vieillot

Winter: Extending to adjacent foothills in Punjab, N Uttar Pradesh, sporadic further south but has been reported from C Uttar Pradesh (Lucknow region), E Rajasthan (Ranthambore), Jabalpur and Kanha (both Madhya Pradesh), and Bilaspur (Chhattisgarh).

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau recueil de planches coloriées d'oiseaux, pour servir de suite et de complément aux planches enluminées de Buffon
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Only from Andaman (Neil, Middle Andaman, and Andaman Is.) and C Nicobars (Kamorta Is.).

Species.Author: Jerdon & Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Taxonomy: Subsequent to the lumping of genus _Muscicapella_ Bianchi 1907 with Ficedula Brisson 1760, David & Bruce (2016) argued for replacing _sordida_ with _erithacus_ as the specific name of this taxon. Other synonyms includes _amabilis_ Deignan 1947, _erwini_ Wolters 1954, and _hodgsonii_ Moore 1854. Any work on databasing of historical records should consider the fact that Slaty-backed Flycatcher was known by different names in the past, and some of them overlaps with other regionally occuring species like the Pygmy Blue Flycatcher. Also, see Zuccon (2011).
Species.Distribution: Winter: Uttarakhand (straggler), N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, LKO

Species.Author: Jerdon
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Species.Distribution: CW Ghats from Babaduban hills and Kudremukh through Kodagu and in SW Ghats from Wayanad, Nilgiris, Muthikulam, Palani, Munnar, and Grass hills south till about Mathikettan Shola in Cardamom hills; further south in Meghamalai, Pandalam hills and Agasthyamala (Ashambu) hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.Taxonomy: Dickinson & Walters (2006) used _leucomelanura_ instead of _tricolor_ as it was preoccupied in _Muscicapa_. However, when this was moved to _Ficedula_, the name _tricolor_ was once again available. RA2012's treatment of the W Himalayan population as _notata_ (contra nominate) and the E Himalayan population as the nominate (contra _minuta_) must be an error as the type locality (central hills of Nepal) of _tricolor sensu stricto_ nor _leucomelanura sensu stricto_ is in the range of the eastern population (See Biswas 1962).

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _notata_ Whistler 1930 from Gund, Kashmir.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; straggles to Indo-Gangetic plains and has occurred till Bharatpur.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal including Noa-Dihing valley, Assam valley, Meghalaya, and Tripura.

Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Kashmir, through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Winter: Throughout the Indian peninsula south of Himalaya from Bihar in the east till Gujarat in the west and all the way south till S Deccan in Karnataka and N Tamil Nadu; sporadic further south.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM, HYD, LKO

Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal (rare in E), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, and Manipur. Non-breeding: Adjacent plains in Jharkhand, S W Bengal, and Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Swainson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The Naturalist's Library
Species.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal and Uttarakhand. Winter: W Ghats from Mumbai region (sporadic), mostly from SW Maharashtra till the southern tip in Kanyakumari district. During migration, it spread widely in the subcontinent along E Ghats, C Indian highlands, N Bengal, Gujarat, W Bengal, and Delhi region.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout the peninsula from Ladakh, Kashmir and Jammu – sporadic, sub-Himalayan foothills of W Himalaya and Indo-Gangetic plains, entire E India from W Bengal onwards, W through Rajasthan and Gujarat, C India, S India including E Ghats, Deccan, W India, and sporadically in SW coast; also, Andaman and Narcondam Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, HYD

Species.Author: Hartert & Steinbacher
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel. Ergänzungsband
Species.Taxonomy: New name for _Siphia hyperythra_ Cabanis 1866. Any work on databasing of historical records should consider the fact that Kashmir Flycatcher was known by a different name in the past that is now the accepted specific name for Snowy-browed Flycatcher.
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Kashmir. Winter: Mostly Nilgiris but locally in Munnar hills as well; however, in many locations in the peninsula during migration including SE Tamil Nadu, SE Ghats, Bengaluru region, W Maharashtra, C India, Gujarat, Bihar, Uttarakhand, and Himachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO
