Subspecies.Distribution: NE Ghats of S Odisha (historical) and NE Andhra.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nests and eggs of Indian birds: rough draft
Subspecies.Distribution: Sporadic and local in NW Ghats from Mumbai region till Goa; CW and SW Ghats; sporadic in the Deccan transition zone in Karnataka; occurs further east in Biligirirangans, Servarayan, and Kolli hills in SE Ghats as well as outcrops of Palani and Varusanadu hills in Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Possibly undergone a range expansion to the NW Ghats.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: Uttarakhand, N Uttar Pradesh, N Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, and all NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _estriata_ Koelz 1939 from Jagalbet, near Londa, NW Karnataka.
Subspecies.Distribution: S Gujarat, Maharashtra, SE Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, and S W Bengal – extending south all the way till the tip of the peninsula.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM
Subspecies.Notes: Very local in Deccan and hence the population from the northeastern part of its range in EC India nearly disjunct from the western and southern population.

Subspecies.Author: Walden
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology
Subspecies.Distribution: N, Middle, S, and Little Andaman Is. as well as the islets of Anderson, Long, Havelock, Neil, Alexandra, and Rutland Is.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.Distribution: Car Nicobar Is. and C Nicobar Is. group (Teresa, Trinket, Kamorta, Nancowry, and Katchal).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]
Species.Taxonomy: Presence of cinnamon-flanked individuals in Tricoloured Munia flocks variously attributed to Chestnut Munia _L. atricapilla_ (natural or escapees), or hybrids with that species. Such individuals are known from different parts of the range including S India, W Bengal, and Gujarat (Bhatt _et al._ 2019). However, presence of cinnamon-flanked individuals in Tricoloured Munia naturalised populations in C America lends support that these are colour aberrations of this species. Molecular analysis recommended for a more definitive answer. Includes here _bakeri_ Delacour 1943 (new name for _orientalis_ Baker 1925) from Madras [=Chennai].
Species.Distribution: Throughout India – from Jammu south through Indo-Gangetic plains till W Bengal; Rajasthan and Gujarat; C and S India.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with the nominate subspecies in E Nepal.
Subspecies.Distribution: Historically in terai and plains of Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar but now curiously only reported sporadically from N Uttar Pradesh.
Subspecies.Notes: Investigation into its former range needed and possibly is getting replaced by Tricoloured Munia. Population now almost entirely restricted to Nepal with Uttar Pradesh reports being stragglers from Nepal. Birds reported from Delhi could have been escapees (Vyas 2019). RA2012 includes 'Indian Punjab' in its range while AR2001 includes Jagadhri (Haryana) as the western limit.

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Histoire naturelle des plus beaux oiseaux chanteurs de la zône torride
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal, adjoining Jharkhand, E Bihar and N Odisha, Brahmaputra plains of Assam and E Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Tripura.

Genus.Name: Amandava
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The natural history of Selborne, with its antiquities; naturalist's calendar, &c. A new edition, with notes by Edward Blyth

Species.Author: Latham
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Index ornithologicus, sive systema ornithologiæ; complectens avium divisionem in classes, ordines, genera, species, ipsarumque varietates: adjectis synonymis, locis, descriptionibus, &c.
Species.Distribution: C India – historically from Rajasthan, N Gujarat till Lucknow and SW Bihar; south till Mahableshwar (Maharashtra) and NE Andhra. Now local and restricted to a few known pockets – Mt. Abu region, Jhansi (S Uttar Pradesh), Amaravati (N Maharashtra) and NE Ghats of S Odisha, SE Chhattisgarh, and NE Andhra.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India – widespread and sometimes locally at least – from Jammu south till the southern tip of peninsula; west till Gujarat, and east through the Brahmaputra plains of Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Species has expanded its range in a few parts of India.

Genus.Name: Prunella
Genus.Author: Vieillot
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Analyse d'une Nouvelle Ornithologie Élémentaire

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annus I Historico-naturalis. Descriptiones avium musei proprii earumque rariorum, quas vidit in vivario Augustiss. Imperatorus, et museo excell. Comitis Francisci Annib. Turriani

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Izvestiya Imperatorskago Obshchestva Lyubitelei Estestvoznaniya, Antropologii i Etnografii
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit and Astor.

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Intergrades with _rufilata_ in Ladakh.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal till Kumaon (Uttarakhand).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Population in Nagaland (Bora & Mondal 2024) has not been taxonomically sampled and might belong to a distinct subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal, and Arunachal. Also, in Naga hills.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Blyth described this species, in February 1842 from a collection by Pearson. The type specimen (ZSI#35564) marked in registers is from Darjeeling, in fact by T Pearson, in the year 1843. Though this remains to be relocated, it is desirous to reverify whether the year was a transcription mistake for 1842.
Species.Distribution: Winter: Along this Himalaya from Ladakh, Kashmir through Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal and W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen & Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised (AR2001, RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Astor, Ladakh, Kashmir (sporadic), and Himachal.
Subspecies.Notes: No Uttarakhand reports found.

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: N Bengal records not validated; no reports from Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Brooks
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, Ladakh, Jammu, Himachal till Uttarakhand – straggling to extreme E Punjab.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal, and Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Izvestiya Imperatorskago Obshchestva Lyubitelei Estestvoznaniya, Antropologii i Etnografii
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand (sporadically).
Subspecies.Notes: See Sharma & Arora (2021), Sondhi _et al._ (2021). Migration from the extralimital population exists, but is not investigated here.

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel Band I Heft VI
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Gilgit.
Subspecies.Notes: Based on NHMUK#1897.12.10.1068 which was previously unreported.

Subspecies.Author: Collin & Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: RA2012 and IOC treats this as a synonym of _khamensis_ Sushkin 1925.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N Sikkim.
Subspecies.Notes: Though the specimen was believed to be in the NHMUK, it could not be located.

Subspecies.Author: Brandt
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Classe Physico-Mathématique de l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de Saint-Pétersbourg
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit.

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the birds in The Museum of the Hononrable East-India Company
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _atrogularis_ Hutton 1849.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal through Uttarakhand; also adjoining E Punjab and NE Haryana.

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Sikkim, N Bengal, and Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM

Genus.Name: Passer
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Jardine & Selby
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Illustrations of ornithology
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _nigricollis_ Burton 1838 from South India.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout India from Kashmir south till the southern tip of peninsula; west till Gujarat and east till Assam, E Arunachal, and all NE hill states. Introduced in all major islands and islets in Andamans, Car Nicobar Is., Kamorta Is. (C Nicobar group), and Great Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Zarudny & Kudashev
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nasha Okhota
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Rajasthan.
Subspecies.Notes: Both this and _parkini_ winters in Rajasthan and separation almost impossible. At least two birds ringed from Bharatpur recovered in Tajikistan thereby establishing the presence of this subspecies (Editors 1967, Editors 1969, AR2001). BNHS collection also has a specimen with a ring collected in 1967, currently labelled as this subspecies, presumably with an assumption that they are of this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Kashmir, Ladakh, and Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal). Winter: Extending to Rajasthan.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM
Subspecies.Notes: AR2001 includes its range till Sikkim but RA2012 considers this a W Himalayan subspecies.

Species.Author: Temminck
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Manuel d'ornithologie, ou tableau systématique des oiseaux qui se trouvent en Europe (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Tschusi zu Schmidhoffen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India – Punjab, Himachal (sporadic), Haryana, Delhi region, SW Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, and exceptionally to Kachchh. Stragglers in Ladakh, Mirzapur (SE Uttar Pradesh, historical), and Ponnani (Kerala).
Subspecies.Notes: See Abhinav (2020).

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: NW India – from Jammu through Punjab, adjoining Pong in Himachal, Haryana, and Delhi region extending east through N and E Rajasthan including Thar region and has straggled to Gujarat (historical).
Species.Specimens: BNHS

Subspecies.Author: Rothschild
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _annectans_ Koelz 1952 from Mawryngkneng, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram – as well as adjoining Assam.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _debilis_ Hartert 1904 from Sind-Tal in Kashmir.
Subspecies.Distribution: Ladakh (sporadic), Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal, and adjoining Assam.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the United States National Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit

Subspecies.Author: Baker
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Ladakh, Sikkim and Arunachal.
Subspecies.Notes: Occurrence of this subspecies in India debated (RA2012); however, USNM #522811 from Khalaktang, W Kameng, Arunachal to be reinvestigated. Reports from Ladakh could also be of this subspecies.

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Arunachal (Mishmi hills), Patkai hills of E Assam and E Arunachal, Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Subspecies.Notes: Mizoram birds tentatively placed here. Investigation required.

Subspecies.Author: Dubois
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Faune des vertébrés de la Belgique. Série des oiseaux
Subspecies.Distribution: Himachal (very local), Uttarakhand (historical), N Bengal, Sikkim, W and C Arunachal, Assam (except extreme E), Meghalaya, Cachar, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Himachal and Uttarakhand birds tentatively placed here. Investigation required.

Genus.Name: Gymnoris
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationReference: Band I Heft VI p.145, fig. 30, 31
Subspecies.Distribution: NW India from Jammu, Punjab, Haryana, E and C Rajasthan, and Kachchh.

Subspecies.Author: Burton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: A catalogue of the collection of mammalia and birds in the museum of the Army Medical Department, at Fort Pitt, Chatham
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _flavicollis_ Franklin 1831.
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from about Himachal through the sub-Himalayan terai till W Bengal, further south in Gangetic plains, C India, Gujarat, W coast and W Ghats, E Ghats, locally in much of Deccan, and SE coastal plains.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Local migration patterns not worked out.

Genus.Name: Petronia
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novitates Zoologicae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Leucotype as per AMNH catalogue.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit and Ladakh.

Genus.Name: Carpospiza
Genus.Author: Müller
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Description de nouveaux oiseaux d'Afrique

Species.Author: Bonaparte
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Species.Distribution: Winter: Kachchh region and W Gujarat but also straggling to Tal Chhapar (Rajasthan) and coasts of Karnataka and Kerala.

Genus.Name: Montifringilla
Genus.Author: Brehm
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Subspecies.Author: Adams
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of Ladakh, Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal), and N Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Onychostruthus
Genus.Author: Richmond
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The Auk

Species.Author: Przevalski
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Mongoliya i strana tangutov: trekhletneye puteshestviye v vostochnoy nagornoy Azii
Species.Distribution: Trans Himalaya of Ladakh and Sikkim.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK

Genus.Name: Pyrgilauda
Genus.Author: Verreaux
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Bull. Nouvelles Archives du Muséum VI
Genus.Taxonomy: Follow H&M4 in assigning genus authority to Verreaux (contra Bonaparte 1850).

Subspecies.Author: Blanford
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: AMNH#717336 doubtfully listed as a Syntype.
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of E Ladakh (sporadic), and N Sikkim; also straggling to N Bengal.

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Stray Feathers
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Border of Tibet to the north of Sikkim)
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of Ladakh, and N Sikkim; also, N Bengal (historical).

Genus.Name: Dendronanthus
Genus.Author: Blyth
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: The Annals and Magazine of Natural History including Zoology, Botany, and Geology

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Distribution: Winter: W Ghats from about Mumbai till southern tip of the peninsula in Kanyakumari district, Andaman & Nicobar Is. Locally in most parts of the subcontinent including W coastal plains, Gujarat, C India, E Ghats, Deccan, W Bengal, and most of NE India (except Arunachal). Sporadic stragglers further west through the Gangetic plains till about Delhi region, Bharatpur and Uttarakhand.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Motacilla
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Tunstall
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia Britannica: seu avium omnium Britannicarum tam terrestrium, quam aquaticarum catalogus (etc.)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Regional birds sometimes considered part of the eastern subspecies _melanope_ Pallas, PS 1776.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit till Sikkim. Non-breeding: Throughout the country including Narcondam, Andaman, and Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch Russland zur Untersuchung der drey Natur-Reiche
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India – but actual reports from Delhi region, Rajasthan, W Bengal, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, and Kerala.
Subspecies.Notes: Included based on the specimen in NHMUK (see RA2012 under _taivana_). However, the same could not be located recently. Ferlini & Artemyeva (2020) suggested most birds in India are passage migrants.

Subspecies.Author: Billberg
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Synopsis faunae Scandinaviae, complectens animalia Sveciae Norvegiae que hucusque detecta
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout W and C parts of India; absent or sporadic in E India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout W and S India but sporadic further east till W Bengal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Michahelles
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _melanogrisea_ (Homeyer, 1878) from 'India'.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Mostly W and S India from Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Kerala, and Tamil Nadu.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ

Subspecies.Author: Przevalski
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Zapiski Imperatorskoi Akademii Nauk
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India – but reports from Punjab (historical), Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Bengal, Meghalaya (historical), Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu; sporadic elsewhere till about Jammu in the north and Odisha coast in the east.
Subspecies.Notes: Contra Ferlini _et al._ (2021), the Koelz specimens from Phulbari in UMMZ treated as from Phulbari in Garo hills, Meghalaya

Subspecies.Author: Thayer & Bangs
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the New England Zoological Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as a subspecies of _M. flava_ (RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: E India and possibly in S India.
Subspecies.Notes: Birds from this population winters in India and may account for a majority of the north Siberian Yellow Wagtails but identification from _thunbergi_ can be difficult.

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _simillima_ Hartert 1905 from Kamchatka, NE Russia.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Bengal, Assam, Andaman Is. and sporadically elsewhere.

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Andaman Is. and Kerala (one report).
Subspecies.Notes: See Viswanathan _et al._ (2017), Praveen (2021). A specimen in NHMUK, tagged as this taxon, has been reidentified as a _M. flava lutea_ (RA2012).

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the country.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Winter range of this and _werae_ not worked out due to extremely similar winter plumage. Birds with phenotypes of both subspecies have been recorded across the country with no specific pattern.

Subspecies.Author: Buturlin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologische Monatsberichte
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Extremely similar to the nominate subspecies and sometimes not recognised (see IOC, Alström & Mild 2003 contra Shirihai & Svensson 2018 and eBird/Clements).
Subspecies.Distribution: Throughout the country from Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kashmir till the southern tip of the peninsula (though scarce in south); from W in Gujarat till east in Arunachal and NE hill states; also occurs in Andaman and Narcondam Is.

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit till Arunachal. Non-breeding: Extending to adjacent northern plains and sporadically to Gujarat.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Gmelin
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturae. Editio decima tertia, aucta, reformata. Cura Jo. Frid. Gmelin (etc.). Tomus I. Pars II
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _kangrae_ Koelz 1939 from Badhwar, Kangra, Himachal.
Species.Distribution: Throughout Indian subcontinent from Kashmir, east till C Assam, west till Gujarat, and south till the southern tip of the peninsula.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, TNHM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W India.
Subspecies.Notes: In winter plumage, impossible to separate from _dukhunensis_ and hence range confounded. Likely to be restricted to W India as it is a more westerly breeding species. Specimens exist; but they might have been of _dukhunensis_.

Subspecies.Author: Sykes
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised (see Alström & Mild 2003) and treated as a junior synonym of the nominate subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India from Kashmir till the southern tip of the peninsula; Gujarat in the west till NE India in the east; also Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, MYS, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Ring recoveries exist of this subspecies of birds that were ringed from Gujarat.

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Brahmaputra plains of Assam and E Arunachal; SW Karnataka (once).

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Non-breeding: N India, and sporadically to E India and S India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Mainly E and NE India but has also occurred elsewhere in the subcontinent; also, Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Identity of birds reported as this not always certain as intermediates with _dukhunensis_ exists.

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Mainly E India but reported as far west as Uttarakhand and Delhi region; as well as till Gujarat and south till S Karnataka; also, Andaman Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _albula_ Koelz 1954 from Barapani, Khasi hills, Meghalaya.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Along the Himalaya from Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Non-breeding: Extending to adjacent plains including entire E India, as far west as W Rajasthan.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Anthus
Genus.Author: Bechstein
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Gemeinnützige Naturgeschichte Deutschlands nach allen drey Reichen. Ein Handbuch zur deutlichern und vollständigern Selbstbelehrung besonders für Forstmänner, Jugendlehrer und Oekonomen. Zweyte vermehrte und verbesserte Auflage
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Illustrations of British ornithology

Species.Author: Vieillot
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as monotypic (Alström & Mild 2003, IOC).

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W India.
Subspecies.Notes: Most westerly breeding population; it is likely that some of the individuals may occur in W part of India. Listing in museums likely following older taxonomy and would need reassignment.

Subspecies.Author: Johansen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Bengal, adjoining Jharkhand and Odisha; Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Tripura; also, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Subspecies.Notes: Most likely subspecies in E India.

Subspecies.Author: Kistjakowsky
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Memoirs of the Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Math.-Phys.Cl.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N India including Ladakh, Jammu, Himachal, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi region, and NE Rajasthan; sporadic in C India; widely in S India from Maharashtra till the tip of the peninsula.
Subspecies.Notes: Most likely subspecies in the Indian peninsula.

Subspecies.Author: Whistler
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Not always recognised (see RA2012).
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire NW India from Kashmir, Jammu, till about W Uttar Pradesh, and N Madhya Pradesh.

Subspecies.Author: Vieillot
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle, appliquée aux arts, à l'agriculture, à l'économie rurale et domestique, à la médecine, etc. Nouvelle édition
Subspecies.Distribution: Entire country from about W, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh; entire E India including all NE hill states (not reported from Sikkim); entire peninsular India S from Maharashtra except Kerala.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Eyton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Kerala (SW India) – including the plains and the hills.

Subspecies.Author: Meinertzhagen
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W India from Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Madhya Pradesh, and NW Maharashtra.
Subspecies.Notes: Extact winter limits uncertain.

Subspecies.Author: Finsch
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Transactions of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Foothills of Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, adjoining regions in Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh. Non-breeding: Entire N and C India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: The population present throughout the year in most of India are tentatively assumed to be this subspecies – more study required to understand the meeting point of breeding ranges of the nominate subspecies and this subspecies. Its range in E India, including N Bengal as well as Assam valley is tentative. Exact taxon involved is also not clear.

Subspecies.Author: Jerdon
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Madras Journal of Literature and Science
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _cockburniae_ Oates 1890 from Nilgiri hills, NW Tamil Nadu. Note, Ri1961 treats the protonym genus as _Anthus_, but see Jerdon (1840) for listing it under _Agrodoma_.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats from Maharashtra till about Palakkad gap and Deccan – locally as well as E Ghats.

Subspecies.Author: Ripley
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Postilla
Subspecies.TypeLocality: (Road to Muthukuzhi, Ashambu hills, S Tamil Nadu)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Sometimes not treated as a valid subspecies (Alström & Mild 2003); however, subspecies quite distinct in plumage.
Subspecies.Distribution: W Ghats south of Palakkad gap till Kalakkad in S Tamil Nadu.

Species.Author: Taczanowski
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Société Zoologique de France
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _striolatus_ Blyth 1847 from Darjeeling, N Bengal.
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India from Himachal through Delhi region, west till Gujarat, east through Assam plains, Arunachal, Tripura, and south till S Tamil Nadu; also, Great Nicobar (once).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Taxonomy: Regional form often treated as subspecies _griseus_ Nicoll 1920 (Type Locality: Tischan, Turkestan) which along with _kastchenkoi_ Johansen 1952 (Type Locality: Novosibirsk, W Siberia) that was reported from Uttar Pradesh and Bihar (AR2001) are no longer considered valid and the species is treated as monotypic (Alström & Mild 2003).
Species.Distribution: Winter: Throughout Indian subcontinent – from Gilgit (historical, passage), Jammu, Himachal and east till Bihar, Chhattisgarh and EC Odisha; west till Gujarat and south till S Tamil Nadu and C Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM

Species.Author: Sharpe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Species.Distribution: Nilgiris (Tamil Nadu and adjoining Kerala), Palani, Munnar, and Grass hills.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _oreinus_ Koelz 1954 from Kotla, Kangra, Himachal.
Species.Distribution: Along the W Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; also reported from N Bengal (historically) and N Sikkim more recently.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as monotypic (IOC).

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Ladakh only.
Subspecies.Notes: See Tanveer (2021). Based on specimens from Pakistan, Ladakh birds assumed to be of this subspecies.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, through Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Non-breeding: Along the Indo-Gangetic and Brahmaputra plains and all NE hills states; south till about Jaipur, Gwalior, Ranchi and Kolkata region – sporadic further south in Gujarat (historical), NW Maharashtra, and Chhattisgarh.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout India; sporadic in extreme S India and NE India – has been reported from C Assam, W Arunachal, and W Meghalaya; also, Lakshadweep Is.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, MYS, HYD

Subspecies.Author: Witherby
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _burzil_ Koelz 1939 from Burzil Pass, edge of Deosai plains, Baltistan.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Kashmir, Ladakh, and Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal). Non-breeding: Widespread in N India but also reported from NW Karnataka (Londa), NW Telangana (Utnur), and SE Tamil Nadu (Point Calimere).

Subspecies.Author: Uchida & Kuroda
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annotationes Zoologicae Japonenses
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Throughout the country, locally, including the entire W Ghats, E Ghats, and other hills of peninsular India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, FMNH, USNM, YPM, TNHM

Subspecies.Author: Richmond
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Publication Carnegie Institution
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _maculatus_ Jerdon 1864 from Kolkata.
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Himachal (adjacent Jammu), Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Non-breeding: Throughout the peninsula till CW Ghats of Karnataka (Ali 1969) and entire NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Exact winter distribution of this subspecies not worked out.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Distribution: Non-breeding: Sporadic or local throughout India from Gilgit (historical), Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Bengal, Assam valley, Manipur valley (historical), NE Arunachal, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, and Tamil Nadu; also, Narcondam and Andaman Is. (where regular).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, AMNH, ROM

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Audouin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Description de l'Égypte, ou recueil des observations et des recherches qui ont été faites en Égypte pendant l'expédition de l'armée française. Histoire naturelle. Vol. 1
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Garner _et al._ (2015) suggests species status for this subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Little Rann of Kachchh (Gujarat).
Subspecies.Notes: See Prasad (2017); confirmation desirable with more definitive photographs and sound recordings. RA2012 follows Alström & Mild (2002) in treating this subspecies as not occurring in S Asia. Several intermediate specimens with _blackistoni_ in NHMUK from northern India. Specimens in BNHS, UMMZ, and FMNH not examined for subspecies verification.

Subspecies.Author: Swinhoe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Synonymised with _coutelli_ Audouin 1826 (Type Locality: Egypt) in AR2001.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: NW India from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Delhi region, W Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat; also, Assam (once).
Subspecies.Notes: W Bengal, and Arunachal reports not validated.

Species.Author: Tunstall
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia Britannica: seu avium omnium Britannicarum tam terrestrium, quam aquaticarum catalogus (etc.)

Subspecies.Author: Temminck & Schlegel
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Japonica sive descriptio animalium, quae in itinere per Japoniam, jussu et auspiciis superiorum, qui summum in India Batava imperium tenent, suscepto, annis 1825-1830 collegit, notis, observationibus et adumbrationibus illustravit. Vol. 4. Aves
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Sporadic and local in NW India from Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, and Gujarat; also, N Bengal (historical), Arunachal (passage?), Assam, and Manipur (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: See Ash & Sinha (2020).

Genus.Name: Fringilla

Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Linnaeus
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Notes: Based on specimens from Afghanistan, Indian birds assumed to be of the nominate subspecies.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Winter: Reported from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, and Himachal; sporadically to Uttarakhand and Arunachal. Straggler to Delhi region (once).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK

Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal.

Genus.Name: Coccothraustes

Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit and Domel (Kashmir, historical).
Subspecies.Notes: Two of the historical specimens collected by Crump from Kashmir are in USNM (#265039) and MCZ(#149851).

Genus.Name: Carpodacus
Genus.Author: Kaup
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Skizzirte Entwickelungs-Geschichte und natürliches System der Europäischen Thierwelt (etc.)
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Appendix to A list of the genera of birds

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novi Commentarii Academiae Scientiarum Imperialis Petropolitanae
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: N Indian peninsula at least south to Pune and Nagpur and east to Assam and possibly in NE hill states.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, FMNH, USNM
Subspecies.Notes: Identification of subspecies within the _erythrinus_ group in winter quarters is difficult; range based on historical data using specimens. At least one subspecies of _erythrinus_ group is present in NE hill states and most likely it is the nominate based on its breeding range.

Subspecies.Author: Laubmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Verhandlungen der Ornithologischen Gesellschaft in Bayern
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Poorly differentiated subspecies by morphology though genetically the most distinct (Hung _et al._ 2013). Various specimens in museums labelled as this but it is likely that many of them are misidentified. NHMUK has specimens from Punjab, Gujarat specimens present in USNM, a Liddar valley (Kashmir) specimen in BNHS, Lahaul (Himachal) specimens in MCZ, , a long series of specimens from Kangra (Himachal) in UMMZ. Last several are by Koelz, taken between April and September, and it is not clear if they were compared aganist _ferghanensis_ before labeling it. Considering its breeding range, only Punjab and Gujarat winter specimens accepted here.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Punjab, Gujarat and presumably other parts of NW India.
Subspecies.Notes: Range imperfectly known but most certainly Indian subcontinent as there is no other wintering range for the birds breeding in Caucasus and Turkey.

Subspecies.Author: Kozlova
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Byulleten' Moskovskogo Obshchestva Ispytatelei Prirody, Otdel Biologicheskii
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, and Lahaul-Spiti (Himachal). Winter: Adjacent plains and northern peninsula as far south as N Karnataka (Londa).
Subspecies.Notes: Entire breeding population likely wintering in India.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationReference: Vol. 11, Part I, N° 125 p.461 (in text)
Subspecies.Distribution: Summer: Himalaya from Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal. Winter: Southern peninsula including W Ghats, E Ghats, Deccan hillocks as well as NE India.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, TNHM, HYD
Subspecies.Notes: Most males in winter quarters identifiable (RA2012).

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Species.Distribution: Uttarakhand, Sikkim, N Bengal, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as a subspecies of _C. rhodochlamys_ Brandt, 1843 (HBW/BLI). Type specimen taken from Tyne range in N Uttarakhand and hence type locality has been modified from 'Range beyond Shimla'.
Species.Distribution: W Himalaya – from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal (mostly Lahaul-Spiti region, sporadic elsewhere), and Uttarakhand (sporadic).
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Himachal, Uttarakhand, N Bengal, Sikkim (?), and W Arunachal.

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported once from Sandakphu, N Bengal.
Subspecies.Notes: Assumed to be this subspecies on range.

Subspecies.Notes: Likely this subspecies based on photographs.

Species.AlternativeNames: Sillem's Mountain Finch, Tawny-headed Mountain Finch

Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of Ladakh, Himachal (historical), and N Sikkim; straggler to Pangot (Uttarakhand).

Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _elbis_ Koelz 1939 from Puga, Rupshu, Ladakh, and _niethammeri_ Keve 1943 from Spiti to the Pamirs.
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Himachal (Lahaul-Spiti region), N Uttarakhand (sporadic), and N Sikkim.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Vaurie
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: American Museum Novitates
Subspecies.Distribution: N Ladakh – north of the Karakoram range.
Subspecies.Notes: RA2012 treats all birds in E Ladakh as this subspecies; on what authority is unclear. Distribution given here is after Vaurie (1956), who included this range in the species description and had access to at least a specimen collected from an untraced locality by name 'Tar Sar', not far from Sumdo near the Karakoram according to the collector's itinerary. Evidently, he examined specimen (s) that remain to be located. No specimens located in NHMUK nor in AMNH catalogue. There are multiple sites in Ladakh named Sumdo and an investigation required to ascertain the exact locality of the specimen. Inclusion presently follows RA2012.

Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Though no photographs have been obtained, multiple sight reports from Nagaland (Jan-May) and Manipur (November) treated here as valid. However, a single report from Meghalaya not treated here as definitive.

Genus.Name: Leucosticte
Genus.Author: Swainson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Fauna Boreali-Americana; or the zoology of the northern parts of British America: containing descriptions of the objects of natural history collected on the late northern land expeditions under command of Captain Sir John Franklin, R.N. Part second, the birds

Species.Author: Hodgson
Species.AlternativeNames: Plain-coloured Mountain Finch, Hodgson's Mountain Finch

Subspecies.Author: Eversmann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Société Impériale des Naturalistes de Moscou
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Hodgson
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Asiatic Researches; or, Transactions of the Society instituted in Bengal, for enquiring into the history, the antiquities, the arts and sciences, and literature of Asia
Subspecies.Distribution: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal; exceptionally in lowland E Assam (Dibru Saikhowa).
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Bonaparte
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Conspectus generum avium
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit (straggler).
Subspecies.Notes: Biddulph's collection (NHMUK#1887.6.1.496).

Subspecies.Author: Severtsov
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit and Ladakh.
Subspecies.Notes: Biddulph's collection (NHMUK#188.9.12.145 etc) from Gilgit while Vaurie examined a specimen from Ladakh which has now been located (MCZ#166798).

Subspecies.Author: Gould
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: The birds of Asia
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _audreyana_ Stresemann 1939 from Zemu Glaciar (ZMB#39.833), N Sikkim; which is distinct enough as per RA2012.
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit, Ladakh, N Sikkim, and W Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, ZMB, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Report from Gangotri (Uttarakhand) likely to be correct. Report of _pallidior_ from Sikkim in AR2001 found to be fraudulent (RA2012).

Genus.Name: Rhodospiza
Genus.Author: Sharpe
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum

Species.Author: Lichtenstein
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise von Orenburg nach Buchara
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Borit Lake (Gilgit), Nathusari Chopta in Sirsa (Haryana), and Jaisalmer (Rajasthan).

Genus.Name: Chloris
Genus.Author: Cuvier
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Leçons d'anatomie comparée

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh (sporadic), Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, adjoining Haryana and N Uttar Pradesh; N Bengal, Sikkim, and W Arunachal.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, FMNH, YPM

Subspecies.Author: Stresemann
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Mitteilungen aus dem Zoologischen Museum in Berlin
Subspecies.Distribution: Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.

Species.Author: Oustalet
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin du Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle

Subspecies.Author: Kinnear
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Subspecies.Distribution: NE Arunachal (Upper Dibang valley and Walong region).
Subspecies.Notes: On range, assumed to be this subspecies.

Genus.Name: Linaria
Genus.Author: Bechstein
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologisches Taschenbuch von und für Deutschland (etc.)
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , Catalogue of the genera and subgenera of birds contained in the British Museum

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hume
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Lahore to Yārkand (etc.)
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _baltistanicus_ R. & A. Meinertzhagen 1926 from Sanpur, near Skardu (Gilgit).
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit.

Subspecies.Author: Walton
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes here _ladacensis_ R. & A. Meinertzhagen 1926.
Subspecies.Distribution: Trans-Himalaya of Ladakh, Lahaul-Spiti, and N Sikkim.
Subspecies.Notes: Uttarakhand records (from Gangotri) lacking in details, but likely to be correct.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.AlternativeNames: Linnet, Common Linnet, Eastern Linnet, European Linnet
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Brehm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Isis
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Sporadic in Gilgit, Ladakh, and Kangra (Himachal).
Subspecies.Notes: The only known specimen is from Baltistan (USNM#126837).

Genus.Name: Loxia
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: RA2012 opinions that a revision of Red Crossbill taxonomy may warrant a species status for the regional subspecies. Additionally, the large-billed birds recorded from N Sikkim from the Tibetan population may represent an undescribed subspecies.
Subspecies.Distribution: Sporadic in W Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal till Walong region.

Genus.Name: Carduelis
Genus.Author: Brisson
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Ornithologia sive synopsis methodica sistens avium divisionem in ordines, sectiones, genera, species, ipsarumaque varietates

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Vigors
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Committee of Science and Correspondence of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; sporadically in adjoining Punjab and Haryana.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, LKO

Genus.Name: Serinus
Genus.Author: Koch
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: System der baierischen Zoologie (etc.)

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Zoographia Rosso-Asiatica, sistens omnium animalium in extenso Imperio Rossico (etc.)
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _Emberiza aurifrons_ Blyth 1849 from Himachal Pradesh.
Species.Distribution: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, through Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand; also, rarely in immediate adjacent Haryana.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, UMZC, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM

Genus.Name: Spinus
Genus.Author: Koch
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: System der baierischen Zoologie (etc.)

Species.Author: Hume
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Ibis
Species.Distribution: Winter: N Bengal, Sikkim, and Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Vagrant along the Himalaya. Reported from Borit Lake (Gilgit), Srinagar (Jammu & Kashmir), Solang Nalla in Kullu (Himachal), Eaglenest and Mandala (both W Arunachal).

Genus.Name: Emberiza
Genus.Author: Linnaeus
Genus.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Genus.GenusDesignationPublicationName: , A list of the genera of birds, with an indication of the typical species of each genus

Species.Author: Gray
Species.OriginalPublicationName: The zoological miscellany
Species.Taxonomy: Includes _subcristata_ Sykes 1832 described from Dukhun [=Deccan].
Species.Distribution: Along the Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal and Uttarakhand; adjoining Indus plains, N Uttar Pradesh, Delhi region, E Rajasthan, Gujarat, C India till Jharkhand, W Bengal in the east and Maharashtra and Telangana in the south; further east in Sikkim, N Bengal, Arunachal, Assam, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura. Sporadic in Odisha, Karnataka, and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Scopoli
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Annus I Historico-naturalis. Descriptiones avium musei proprii earumque rariorum, quas vidit in vivario Augustiss. Imperatorus, et museo excell. Comitis Francisci Annib. Turriani
Species.Distribution: Winter: Mostly W India in Punjab, Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Telangana, and N Karnataka but also sporadically in Gilgit, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, W Bengal, E Odisha, Andhra, S Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala. Straggler to Manipur valley.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, MCZ, ROM, YPM

Species.Author: Brandt
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin Scientifique publié par l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de Saint-Pétersbourg
Species.Distribution: Winter: Entire peninsula from Gilgit (passage), Kashmir, east till W Bengal, west till Gujarat and south till C Karnataka; sporadic further south in S Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM, TNHM, LKO

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs

Subspecies.Author: Sharpe
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Catalogue of the birds in the British Museum
Subspecies.Distribution: W Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh, through Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand. Winter straggler further south to about Delhi region.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Rajasthan (Sangha _et al._ 2016) not considered definitive here vis-a-vis first winter _E. stewarti_.

Subspecies.Author: La Touche
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin of the British Ornithologists' Club
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Treated under the nominate subspecies in AR2001.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: SW and N Bengal, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Tripura. Stragglers to SW India.
Subspecies.Notes: Stragglers to SW Karnataka, and presumably Kerala as well, of this subspecies (See Monappa & Kumar 2018).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ. Editio duodecima reformata. Tomus I [part 1]

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Trans Himalaya of Gilgit, Ladakh, and possibly Lahaul (Himachal). Non-breeding: Further south in N India including Punjab and Haryana with a specimen from Varanasi (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: Sight report from Pune (Ingalhalikar 1993) has been retracted (Prasad 2006).

Subspecies.Author: Moore
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Subspecies.Distribution: Outer Himalaya from Kashmir, Jammu, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, ROM, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Non-breeding distribution not worked out but presumably only an altitude migrant.

Species.Author: Taczanowski
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal für Ornithologie

Subspecies.Author: Sushkin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Boston Society of Natural History
Subspecies.Distribution: Walong region (NE Arunachal) only.
Subspecies.Notes: Sharma _et al._ (2014) assumed this subspecies though not definitely known.

Subspecies.Author: Sushkin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Boston Society of Natural History
Subspecies.Distribution: Gilgit and Ladakh
Subspecies.Notes: Recent reports of birds from the C Asian population and this is the likely subspecies.

Species.Author: Brandt
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Bulletin de la Classe Physico-Mathématique de l'Académie Impériale des Sciences de Saint-Pétersbourg

Subspecies.Author: Sushkin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Spisok i raspredelenie ptits Russkogo Altaia i blizhaishikh chastei Severo-Zapadnoi Mongolii: s opisaniem novykh ili maloizvestnykh form
Subspecies.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported only from Gilgit.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies likely on range.

Species.Author: Blyth
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Species.Taxonomy: Type specimen lost (Sharpe 1894).
Species.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, and Himachal. Non-breeding: N India, south till Madhya Pradesh, N Maharashtra, and Gujarat; sporadic reports from Bihar, W Bengal, and W Arunachal.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, USNM, YPM, LKO

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Brehm
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Der vollständige Vogelfang. Eine gründliche Anleitung, alle europäischen Vögel (etc.)
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Himalaya from Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal, and Uttarakhand.
Subspecies.Notes: Plumage closest to this subspecies with possible hybrids with Pune Bunting _E. leucocephalos_ also noted.

Subspecies.Author: Gmelin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Novi Commentarii Academiae Scientiarum Imperialis Petropolitanae
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _albida_ Blyth 1849 from Tyne Range, N Uttarakhand whose type is in ZSI.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Himalaya from Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Jammu, and Himachal; sporadically into plains in Punjab and Haryana.
Subspecies.Notes: Multiple reported from NE Arunachal (RA2012) not validated, but likely to be correct.

Subspecies.Author: de Filippi
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Archivio per la Zoologia, l'Anatomia e la Fisiologia
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W India.
Subspecies.Notes: Winter range assumed.

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: Includes _huttoni_ Dresser 1902 (described from Afghanistan).
Subspecies.Distribution: Western half of the peninsula from Kashmir, Himachal, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi region, Rajasthan, C India, Gujarat, Maharashtra, W Telangana, W Andhra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, and W Tami Nadu.

Subspecies.Author: Paynter
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Check-list of birds of the world
Subspecies.Distribution: Breeding: Gilgit, Zanskar. Non-breeding: E India (Jharkhand, Odisha, W Bengal, Assam, and Arunachal). Gujarat, and possibly N India.
Subspecies.Notes: Birds reported from NE India (Assam, Arunachal) are almost certainly of this subspecies as the most easterly breeding population. Breeding season specimens from Zanskar (FMNH#245359), Baltistan (FMNH#245358) while winter specimens are from Gujarat (FMNH#245357,#214300).

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata
Species.Distribution: Passage: Gilgit, Sundarbans (W Bengal), SW India (Kenjar in Karnataka, Madayipara and Ponnani in Kerala), and Chidiyatapu (S Andaman Is.).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, MCZ

Subspecies.Author: Lichtenstein
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Verzeichniss der Doubletten des zoologischen Museums der Königl. Universität zu Berlin nebst Beschreibung vieler bisher unbekannter Arten von Säugethieren, Vögeln, Amphibien und Fischen
Subspecies.Distribution: Western half of India from Jammu, Punjab, Haryana, W Uttar Pradesh, Delhi region, Rajasthan, Gujarat, W Madhya Pradesh, W Maharashtra, and straggling further east and south to N Karnataka.
Subspecies.Notes: Locally breeding but population augumented with winter visitors.

Species.Author: Linnaeus
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Systema Naturæ per Regna Tria Naturæ, Secundum Classes, Ordines, Genera, Species, cum Characteribus, Differentiis, Synonymis, Locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata

Subspecies.Author: Hartert
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Die Vögel der paläarktischen Fauna. Systematische Übersicht der in Europa, Nord-Asien und der Mittelmeerregion vorkommenden Vögel
Subspecies.Taxonomy: See Shirihai & Svensson (2018) – regionally occurring _pallidior_ sometimes treated under the nominate subspecies as it is impossible to tell even on a series. Birds of the World (Copete & Christie 2021) treats regional birds as _passerina_ Pallas 1771, on what authority is uncertain.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit, Kashmir, and Ladakh; historically has straggled to Haryana and Delhi region as well as E Assam.
Subspecies.Notes: Subspecies identity of the E Assam birds uncertain.

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Haryana (historical), Himachal, W Bengal, and stragglers to W coast (Gujarat, Goa, SW Karnataka, and Kerala).
Subspecies.Notes: As per AR2001, the nominate subspecies is what winters in India while RA2012 could not find any specimens. Birds seen in the western parts of India are presumed to be from this population in Europe. This population has declined drastically in the last few decades and may amount to only 120-600 mature individuals. See Shirihai & Svensson (2018) for a picture labelled as this subspecies from West Bengal, India.

Subspecies.Author: Shulpin
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Annuaire du Musée Zoologique de l'Académie des Sciences de l'Union des Républiques Sovietiques Socialistes
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Jharkhand, W Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura; as well as Andaman and also Nicobar Is. (historical).
Subspecies.Notes: RA2012 identified the male specimens as this subspecies.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Winter: Gilgit, Ladakh, Kashmir, Himachal, Uttarakhand, W Bengal, Sikkim, Assam, Arunachal, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Cachar, Manipur, and Mizoram. Sporadically in W India – from Gujarat, Maharashtra, SW Karnataka and Kerala (Munnar hills). Also reported from Narcondam, Andaman & Nicobar Is.
Species.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, UMMZ, AMNH, FMNH, MCZ, ROM, USNM, YPM

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.Taxonomy: Sometimes treated as monotypic (IOC).

Subspecies.Author: Pallas
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: Reports from Leh (Ladakh), Kangan (Kashmir), Chamba and Udaipur (both NW Himachal), and Roing (NE Arunachal).
Subspecies.Notes: Not possible to identify subspecies from photographs, but vagrants may have been from the western population.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs

Subspecies.Author: Blyth
Subspecies.OriginalPublicationName: Journal of the Asiatic Society of Bengal
Subspecies.Taxonomy: New name for _E melanops_ Blyth 1845 from Tripura.
Subspecies.Distribution: Winter: W Bengal, Assam, adjoining Arunachal, Nagaland, Cachar, Manipur valley, and Tripura.
Subspecies.Specimens: BNHS, ZSI, NHMUK, AMNH, FMNH, YPM
Subspecies.Notes: Reports from Meghalaya (AR2001) not verified.

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Winter: NE Arunachal (Mishmi hills and Upper Noa Dihing valley), Nagaland, Meghalaya, Manipur, and Mizoram; sporadically in W Assam, Sikkim, N Bengal, Uttarakhand, Ladakh (historically), and Andaman Is. (historically).
Species.Specimens: NHMUK, UMMZ, USNM

Species.Author: Pallas
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Reise durch verschiedene Provinzen des Russischen Reichs
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Bail Is. (W Bengal) and Ograbarj (S Andaman Is.).

Species.Author: Swinhoe
Species.OriginalPublicationName: Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London
Species.Distribution: Vagrant. Reported from Mishmi hills and Namdapha (both E Arunachal).
